results.description:
UPDATE:  1st week was so much fun!!  Thank you all for coming.  I can't wait to see you all on Monday.  If you missed it, it is not too late to join us at all!!  In this series, we will focus on 6 count moves so that the materials will be different from the lessons in March.  We will review both triple steps and single steps so that we can dance to faster music.  We will also introduce Charleston footwork so that we can combine the 6 count moves with Charleston!!

NOTE: Saying yes to this meet up page doesn't guarantee your entry to the class!  Please visit QED website http://qedastoria.com/collections/michael-duke-akemi-kinukawa  and register to guarantee your spot!!   Looking forward to dancing with you! 


*********************************

Please join us for the basics of swing dancing and lindy hop! No partner or experience necessary, just bring your comfortable shoes and happy feet! This month, we will be learning 8 count footwork using triple steps!


We will meet every Monday from 7:10pm to 8:00pm (April 11, 18, 25, May 2) so that you will be comfortable with the basic steps of swing dancing. 

If you already have some experience with swing dancing, please check out the Advanced Beginner class starting at 6:30. 

We will rotate partners frequently during the lesson so you will instantly make lots of new friends!! You will have a chance to mingle and dance with each other and try out all the new moves to authentic 30's and 40's jazz music. 

Although drop ins are welcome, we highly recommend to attend all 4 classes to learn various steps of swing dancing so that you will be comfortable on the social dance floor. Besides, there is a big discount by signing up for the whole month so please take advantage of it! 

Classes are taught by Akemi Kinukawa and Andrew Kontola, very experienced and friendly instructors of Swing Dance Astoria (www.Facebook.com/swingdanceastoria). 

Space is limited and only advance purchase will guarantee your spot! Register here: http://qedastoria.com/collections/michael-duke-akemi-kinukawa
Looking forward to dancing with you!

ADMISSIONS: Free Introductory Class or $30 2 Hour Beginner Class

DESCRIPTION:

Fencing, also called Olympic fencing emerged as a competitive sport at the end of the 19th century, with the Italian school having modified the "classical fencing", and the French school having later refined the Italian system.

Modern fencing uses three weapons, and so is divided respectively into three competitive scenes: foil, sabre and épée. Most (but not all) competitive fencers choose to specialise in one of these only.

Competitive fencing is one of five activities which have been featured in every one of the modern Olympic Games, the other four being athletics, cycling, swimming, and gymnastics.

ATTRACTIONS:

• Free Protective Gear & Weapon

• Accuracy & Precision

• Fittest

• Speed & Movement

results.description:
Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be on the infield near the sand pit

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion
Brooklyn Heights Women's Book Club Monthly Meetup

results.description:
What Do You Believe? (Second Discussion)

Sura 16 Aya 35

Those who ascribe divinity to other than God say: “Had God so willed we would not have served anything other than Him—neither we nor our forefathers; nor would we have forbidden anything without His sanction.”

Thus also said those who went before them. Yet what is the mission of messengers except to communicate clearly.

This aya addresses four questions that deeply impact everyone’s life:

(1) What do you believe about God?

(2) How do you relate to what you have been taught by the previous generation?

(3) How do you decide what you can or cannot do; i.e., what prohibitions are important?

(4) What is the role of a teacher?

These questions will be discussed in our meeting.

You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the meeting.


Our discussions are based on the book 'The Quran and The Life of Excellence.'

  Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: Quran Discussion in Manhattan-- What Do You Believe?

results.description:
British wine critic Tim Atkin is famous (or maybe infamous) for comparing Chilean wine to a Volvo—safe but boring.  He has since expressed regret for that comment, but perhaps he had a point.  For much of the wine-drinking public, Chile is a source of moderately priced, inoffensively drinkable, and universally available wines made from familiar European varietals.  Nothing to make a face about and spit out, but nothing to get excited about either.

But is there more to Chilean wine than the mass-produced Cabernet and Sauvignon Blanc that you probably drank at your last wedding reception, theater intermission, or coach-class flight?

Chile has a number of viticultural advantages.  It’s one of the few wine-producing regions that have remained phylloxera-free, so Vinifera grapes can be planted ungrafted on their own rootstocks.  It has a Mediterranean climate, sheltered by the Andes to the east and the Pacific coastal ranges to the west.  Mountain snowmelt makes irrigation easy.  And the varied terrain and climate, from the flat Central Valley, to the high-altitude vineyards of Aconcagua, to the cool Pacific regions of Casablanca and San Antonio, provide an optimal growing environment for a wide variety of high-quality grapes.

A new generation of cosmopolitan winemakers has started focusing on quality over quantity, planting a range of grape varieties in terroirs where they can excel.  And Carmenère (once widely misidentified as Merlot) has become Chile’s answer to Argentina’s Malbec—a trademark Chilean varietal that can produce outstanding, distinctive wines when carefully made, keeping its typical meaty, smoky qualities under control.

From north to south, Chile’s major winemaking regions:

Limarí Valley — For the most part this region, north of Santiago and close to the Atacama Desert, is hot and dry.  But vineyards are planted close to the Pacific Coast, where they benefit from cool morning fogs and ocean breezes.  Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, and Syrah are the specialties here.  We’ll be trying a Limarí Pinot Noir (an unusual varietal at this latitude) as well as a Chardonnay aged for 11 months in French oak.  We’ll see if the unique limestone soils of the region produce Burgundian results.

Aconcagua Valley — Named for the highest peak in the Western Hemisphere, this region, also north of Santiago, is one of Chile’s hottest.  But again, proximity to the coast and vineyard altitude are key.  We’ll be trying one of the great Cabernet blends of Chile (obtained for a bargain price), the Errazuriz Don Maximiano Founder’s Reserve.  Its mint and mineral notes are hallmarks of cool-climate Cabernet.

Casablanca and San Antonio Valleys — Considered subregions of Aconcagua, these are cool-climate coastal regions that specialize in white wines.  There are wide temperature shifts between day and night and a long growing season, which make for ripe Chardonnays and Sauvignon Blancs that retain their acidity.  We’ll be trying a Sauvignon Blanc by Matetic, a highly regarded biodynamic winemaker in San Antonio.

Maipo Valley — South of Santiago and at the north end of the extensive Central Valley, the Maipo Valley is the original home of Chilean viticulture.  It’s considered the Bordeaux of South America, focusing on Cabernet and blends, with the higher-altitude vineyards of Alto Maipo producing the best quality.  (Many of Chile’s prestige wines are made in Alto Maipo, such as Almaviva and Don Melchor.)  Perhaps because of its proximity to Santiago, many of Chile’s mega-wineries, such as Concha y Toro, Cousiño Macul, and Santa Rita, are headquartered in Maipo.

Rapel Valley — In between the Andes and the Coastal Range, this is a large region of the Central Valley, further subdivided into the Cachapoal and Colchagua Valleys.  Cachapoal, to the north, has well-drained vineyards to the east in the foothills of the Andes.  To the south, Colchagua’s vineyards are concentrated in the west, with the cooling influence of the Pacific.  We’ll be comparing reds from each of these two subregions—from Cachapoal, the Sideral Bordeaux blend from the Viña San Pedro (maker of ultra-premium Altaïr), and from Colchagua, Purple Angel from Viña Montes.  Montes is a respected, modern winemaker and Purple Angel is often considered the standard-bearer for Chilean Carmenère.  But it can be a polarizing wine—rave review from the Spectator (93 score), but lukewarm reviews from UK-based Jancis Robinson.  A previous vintage was dismissed by her site as “over the top, cliché US-market stuff.”  Ouch!  Let’s see what we think.   

Curicó Valley — A workhorse region south of Rapel, known mainly for value-priced Cabernet and Sauvignon Blanc, neither of which tend to achieve the quality found in the more northerly regions. 

Maule Valley — The southernmost major wine region of Chile (only the up-and-coming Bío-Bío and Malleco are farther south), this is a large area that has long been known more for quantity than quality.  But there are pockets of world-class winemaking, particularly using rare old vines that have been saved amid the push for modernity in this region.  We’ll be trying an earthy, old-vines Malbec blend by De Martino, which focuses on traditional, Old World–style winemaking.

In keeping with the South American theme of the tasting, we’ll be dining at Balvanera on the Lower East Side, where the menu features imported Argentine and Uruguayan beef. 

http://www.balvaneranyc.com/

2014 Matetic Coastal Sauvignon Blanc EQ (Casablanca Valley)  $16

Wine Spectator 89 – Juicy and fresh-tasting, with ripe melon, citrus and savory herbal flavors, supported by ample acidity. Offers a rich, buttery finish. Drink now.

2014 De Martino Chardonnay Legado Reserva (Limarí Valley)  $15

Wine Advocate 91 – Freshness and mineral character. The palate is fresh and vibrant, and leaves a salty taste on your lips. For this price, the quality is very high.

2009 Viña Tabalí Pinot Noir Talinay (Limarí Valley)  $33

Wine Advocate 91 – The 2009 Talinay Pinot Noir takes it to another level. Earthy minerals, spice box, cherry blossom, incense, and assorted red fruits are just some of the elements composing the wine’s suave personality. Smooth, long, and serious in its mien, it could well evolve for 1-2 years although it can be approached now.

Wine Anorak 94 – Beautifully fine, earthy, chalky mineral nose with some red cherry fruit. The palate has tight cherry fruit with real concentration and high acidity. Savoury, mineral and structured, this is a serious wine.

2012 Viña San Pedro Sideral (Rapel, Cachapoal Valley)  $10 (sale price, reg $25) 

J. Suckling 93 – A balanced and compacted style of red with fine, polished tannins and dark fruit character. Full body, excellent fruit and a long finish. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Carmenère, Cabernet Franc, and Petit Verdot. Drink or hold.

2013 Errazuriz Don Maximiano Founder's Reserve (Aconcagua Valley)  $35 (sale price, reg. $65)

Wine Advocate 93 – The 2013 Don Maximiano Founder's Reserve, sourced from a cool vintage, is a blend of 79% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Malbec, 6% Carmenère and 5% Petit Verdot; it fermented in small stainless steel vats and matured in French oak barrels (65% new) for 22 months. It has a very classical nose, a Bordeaux blend with aromas of blackberries, faint balsamic notes, cedar wood, graphite, cigar box, cracked peppercorns, and tobacco leaves. It has a lot less new oak than the vintages of yesteryear. The palate is medium to full-bodied with the telltale Cabernet tannins, juicy fruit, and tension keeping the freshness balancing the sweet fruit. One of the finest versions of Don Maximiano.

Jancis Robinson 17/20 – Dark luscious purplish crimson colour. Freshness is the watchword on the nose, as opposed to the rich ripeness of the Maipo Cabs. Quite subtle and a bit minty. Tannins very well managed. Well put together. But it’s pretty muscular as opposed to fleshy. Dry tea-leaf flavours on the finish. Should make old bones. 

2012 Viña Montes Purple Angel Carmenère (Rapel, Colchagua Valley)  $50 (sale price, reg. $65)

Wine Spectator 93–Suave and plush, with a broad, open texture that transmits a spicy array of dark cherry, currant, blackberry, and cocoa powder notes. Very creamy, with silky tannins on the finish of Asian spice and chocolate. Drink now through 2022.

Jancis Robinson 15/20 – Super fruity—rich, ripe, bold. Medicinal flavours add some variation but this is a heavy, dense style that tires quickly.

2011 De Martino Old Bush Vines Single Vineyard Limavida (Maule Valley)  $15 (sale price, reg. $37)

Wine Advocate 93 – The 2011 Single Vineyard Limavida is produced with the fruit from a 2.3-hectare, ungrafted, dry-farmed, old vineyard from Maule planted back in 1945 with mixed varieties, mainly Malbec (around 80%) and other red grapes, mainly Carmenère and Cabernet Sauvignon on granitic soils. It displays a bright ruby color with strong aromas of flowers (the telltale violets that the best Malbec really masters) and notes of aniseed, red fruit, licorice, smoked hints and the tension and acidity from the old vines with fine-grained tannins. With time in the glass, it develops a beautiful orange peel note that makes it appealing and fresh. A serious red from Maule. Delicious!

results.description:
Dearest Beloveds,

I am deeply honored and grateful to share this 10 month journey of The Path Of Light with each of you. This course will help you manifest and create the life of your soul with the love, support and guidance of the Ascended Masters. 

This journey is about expanding our consciousness and aligning to the truth of who we are. The path of self mastery assists you in healing those parts of you that no longer serve you. You will create a deeper and intimate connection to your spirit. You'll manifest your highest potential, and release fear, limitations and judgements. Your relationships will improve and reflect the love and honoring of self. 

Let us walk the path of Oneness!

Much Love and Gratitude,

Julie

The Path Of Light course was channeled by Ishtar, an embodied Ascended Master channel from Australia. Please visit her website: by clicking here 

"Be the change you wish to see in the world". ~~ Ghandi

FIELD TRIP NIGHT PHOTOGRAPHY:

This photography workshop starts at our facilities by reviewing the foundations of exposure as related uniquely to night photography. Students will test shoot all learned concepts and then head out to shoot a series of experimental key night images that will take their skills to the next level. This photo tour follows with plenty of shooting from ambiance, through motion blur to lighting effects and wonderful cityscapes. Class times are assigned so to capture part of dusk, weather permitting. Shooting areas will be Union Square park or the Highline (when possible). PhotoManhattan will provide Tripods as needed. Class is limited to 10 students. 

Requirements: basic knowledge of Manual exposure. And camera with Manual control of shutter-speed and aperture. 

NOTE: In case of rain, sessions will be rescheduled. We'l offer you the next available class thereafter.

Please ONLY RSVP if you are certain you can make it. Free up your spot if your availability changes so that the next person in line can have your spot. Thanks!

See you there!

View other workshops or classes at: http://www.photomanhattan.com/photography-workshops-nyc-s/1896.htm

results.description: ARCsquared  stands for American Red Cross Amateur Radio Club. We are located at the Northern New Jersey headquarters of the New Jersey Chapter of the American Red Cross, and our "Base station", Call sign NJ2RC, is located in the Disaster Operations Center ("DOC"). It is a project that was started in 2005 by ARC volunteers to improve the ARC's ability to communicate during disaster and emergency operations. It is not a corporation or other legal entity.  It is a group of hams interested in assisting The American Red Cross.  Hams are urged to become official Red Cross volunteers. Members are interested in emergency communications using amateur (Ham) radio, and are (or aspire to be) licensed by the FCC as Ham radio operators.

results.description:
What up ya'll?! It's time to get the unlimited Monday action on once again! Last time we did it in Murry Hill, this time we are taking our taco love uptown to Cascabel. Casbabel looks like it's going to be another instant classic on our list of joints to haunt.


On Monday's they have all you can eat Tacos for 2 hours for $25. This includes all you can drink Sangria and/or Dos XX Beer. For those of you looking for that Monday escape from "The Monday's" come join me at this perfect little oasis.

The spot has a huge selection of tacos, including some optionsfor the vegetarians/vegans in the group, great choices of cocktails and is decorated with luchador masks (which are also for sale) How can you go wrong?!

With unlimited Sangria and Dos XX included for $25 this will be a Monday to remember. Let's get this party started and make Monday feel like Friday.. or at least, Thursday.  ;)

As Always, if your plans change please change your RSVP asap. Looking forward to seeing you there.


DeRM


Tres Leches Cake?!?! WoRD!

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

For experienced Circlers, the evening will begin promptly at 7:30 pm.
On select evenings, Beginners are invited to join us at 6:30 pm.

See the schedule below:

April 18 - 6:30 beginners, 7:30 everyone
April 25   Community Circling Night 7:30- 10:30 EVERYONE
 

Please be punctual and check-in prior to start time in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Circling Lab will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

***NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6:30-7:15 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7:30-10:30 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014


"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2014 “ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) "Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 7:30 PM – 9:00 PM

Day: Mondays

Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520

Contact: Nan, [masked]

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

results.description:
Mondays from 8 – 9:30 pm with Yasuko Kasaki & Chris Pelham

A Course in Miracles and A Course of Love classes are $20 each

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.

These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
Healing Clinic suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!

In this class you will learn how to dance like a natural and unlock your inner beauty! You will learn how to respond to the music in a way that allows you to express your emotions through movement. Other added benifits: Increase your muscle tone, stamina, coordination, posture. Releive stress and tension all while have fun and looking great!

All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, you are never just another face in the crowd, but an individual!

Classes start this Monday 8:00pm to 9:00pm

$20 a single class, $45 for 3 classes, $60 for 4.

Cash or check made out to "Tarik Sultan".  To find out more about Tarik visit www.tariksultan.net/Class_Schedule.html

For more information call[masked]
results.name: Jersey City Belly Dance Classes Resume this Monday!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and what we have to offer so you can have the sex life and relationships that you really want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at this event are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
HackerNest Tech Socials are informal monthly meetups where the NYC tech community gets together at a local venue to hang out, make new friends, and take a break from coding.

All you have to do is show up, grab a nametag, find a beer/wine/water, and hang out - that's it, there's literally nothing formal planned. Plan on meeting new friends in the tech industry, and getting into heated debates about Emacs & Vim.

Best of all, it's free (as in beer).

Still confused? That's OK, you'll figure it out. For more info: 
HackerNest FAQ | HackerNest Twitter | HackerNest Facebook

Attendees:

That's you! Thanks for coming. Attendance is free, so all you need to do is be friendly and welcoming. We expect everyone to respect the HackerNest "No Douchebag" policy, which includes everything on the JSConf Code of Conduct, but also includes other forms of harassment like soliciting business or aggressively recruiting. Events like ours rely on everyone being great, so if you see someone being less than awesome, let us know, and they can take it elsewhere :)

Sponsors:

Sponsors make this growing movement possible, so we treasure and build deep, long-term relationships with the companies that endorse us. If you are the real deal and want to connect with the NYC tech community, let us know.

Become a HackerNestNYC Sponsor

Venue:

WeWork Charging Bull: A platform for creators

Thanks to WeWork for hosting us in their killer space downtown. They've got a ton of locations all over the city for your co-working needs - check them out!


Wanna show off your office? We're always looking for big open spaces with 200+ (standing room) capacity that are easily accessible. Email us! 

Host a HackerNestNYC Event

Community Partner: 

Get to know 550 startups who are pushing the boundaries of innovation and changing the world as we know it! Thursday, on April 21st at Pier 94, NY TechDay will gather hundreds of startups under one roof for a day of celebration! TechDay is your opportunity to connect with the startups you already use, find new products to integrate into your everyday life, or even find your next job! The best part is, it’s totally FREE to attend! So snag a ticket and tell your friends! https://techdayhq.com/new-york/attend


Volunteers: 

Every city has a small team of volunteers that makes HackerNest possible. Usually, this just involves moving furniture, putting beer on ice, serving drinks, etc., and we will never let it take over your whole night. So if you can spare some time to pitch in and help out, please do!

Become a HackerNestNYC Volunteer
results.name: HackerNest NYC April Tech Social

Monday Night Volleyball is intended to be for more advanced, fast paced volleyball geared toward players capable of defending against a hard spike, playing within a structured offensive and defensive system. Some nights we will set up a separate net for more advanced players. This will be up to the discretion of the organizers. 

No beginners, or lower skilled players please.

Please consider your safety and the safety of others when signing up. In faster systems, please realize that being out of position can result in injuries. 


A few rules :

results.description:
Are you looking for note deals? Are you looking for 1st's or 2nd's but don't have a clue on where to turn to help closer more deals? Well, I'm sure you've all heard the analogy about "Give a man a fish and feed him for a day, but teach him how to fish and feed him for a lifetime." Well, on this episode of the Monday Note, I'll teach you how to "FISH" for Note Deals by showing you where to look! Are you in the 5% of action takers or are you just looking for another hand out?

Please register for The Monday Note - Looking For Note Deals at: https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/7004202803658233858

Between Facebook, Linked In, Emails and all the other social networks, "wanna-be" investors keep asking me how do I find assets or deals? Worse is that they just want me to give away my hard earned sources so that they can either buy them or flip them to investors. Well on the Monday Note, I'll show you how to FIND deals this week.
results.name: The Monday Note - Looking For Note Deals

results.description:
This is a meeting for people who have, or who have had at some point in the past, a good grasp of Latin grammar. If you had a few years of Latin in high school 20 years ago, chances are you'll be able to catch up without too much trouble. If you're just starting out, it might not be your cup of tea.

For next week, read lines 1-150 of Capitulum 40 of Lingua Latína II: Roma Æterna, and, if you like, reread Capitulum 2 of Familia Romana. Texts are downloadable at Lingua Latina per se Illustrata or for sale at Focus. Other resources are available at the website with videos and the flashcard website.

Macte virtúte!
results.name: Grex Intermedius

group.name: Circulus Latínus Noveborácénsis (New York Latin Circle)

results.description:
RSVP: http://www.findspark.com/event/master-the-job-hunt-a-grad-bootcamp/

At a Glance
Free, live, virtual workshop focused on the things you didn’t learn in school – like salary negotiation, resume writing, and managing your money – that are essential for real life, plus a live Q&A with our Founder & CEO, Emily Miethner.

Why Attend?
“How’s your job search going?” may be every graduating senior’s least favorite question. The real world is waiting for you, but you might not be totally ready for it yet – and that’s okay. We know the job hunt and the transition to “adulthood” can be overwhelming, and we’ve got you covered. In this workshop, you’ll learn to:
- Craft applications that recruiters will actually notice
- Nail the interview and land an offer
- Negotiate your salary to get what you deserve
- Make sense of and manage your finances
- Get comfortable networking and sharing your story
- Create a stellar online presence
- Stay positive during the job search (we’re here to cheer you on!)

This free virtual workshop will be held by none other than our fabulous and fearless leader, Emily Miethner.

The presentation will last about 45 minutes, followed by a 15 minute Q&A.
results.name: Master the Job Hunt: A Grad Bootcamp

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

**Pay cash at reception**

If your new to the group what better excuse to try us out. We play 3v3 or 4v4 depending on numbers. (No keepers)

THE PITCH is NYC’s only soccer-specific indoor facility, located in the heart of Brooklyn’s Williamsburg neighborhood at North 14th and Berry St.

We have one field, which is slightly longer and wider than the standard NYC Parks basketball court and middle-school gym. Unlike most of these courts/gyms, our field has a walled (padded) perimeter, so the ball never goes out. results.description:
Join in on NYSR Summer Distance Reiki Shares!

Boost your work week! RSVP to participate in the NYSR Distance Reiki Shares! With “Right Mind and Intention”, Distance Reiki sessions are as effective as sessions conducted in person.


These Summer Reiki Shares are a group effort of Practitioners who collaborate for the benefit of healing, supporting our personal lives, and enhancing the development of Reiki Skills, including sensitivity to giving and receiving Reiki.

AND YOU CAN DO THIS FROM HOME!

Mondays at 10PM for 45 minutes, we practice Distance Reiki among all participants that RSVP. Angela and I prepare “space” 15 minutes prior to start time and your participation will involve the following:

1. Sit or Lay comfortably and quietly.

2. *Set your intent to heal yourself and others participating to receive
whatever is needed for healing to take place.

3. Hold the space for energy to flow, remembering your own
connection to “Oneness” which supports the flow of energy
between the practitioner and recipient.

4. Once your ready and  receptive to receive, set your intent to begin sharing Reiki.

*Participant names will be forwarded via email or text if you prefer. Please use firstname and lastname initial (i.e.Michelle D.) or your Meetup ID Name.when you RSVP. Guest welcome and must RSVP individually; also required to submit (min) $10 donation via PayPal.

There is no “cancellation of energy”. Each individual receives as much Reiki needed at the present time to assist with the unique situations of his/her own life.
results.how_to_find_us: In you're own comfort space.
results.name: Distance Reiki Share Monday Nights from Home!

Open Call


Here's the deal: Art-A-Hack will provide space for four Saturdays (10am-6pm) in June and July, equipment, facilitation and advice, and stellar showcase opportunities.

Our group has been invited to come and develop amazing experiences together, the dates are June 11, 18, 25, July 9 and July 15 from 10am - 6pm.


We will also be hosting Unity Education lectures, teaching you the necessary skills to develop amazing VR && AR content during these Saturday workshops.

How to apply

To apply, send your ideas now to [masked]. Describe a project idea you want to try, the technologies you'd like to get into, or the skills you have to contribute.

Please include info on any technical tools you know, or a project proposal you have. If you want to focus on a subject area, or social issue, let us know. Please also confirm that you are available on the dates listed (June 11, 18, 25, July 9 and July 15).

If anyone has any questions feel free to ask in the comments, maybe you don't know what to write in the email, or don't have a specific project idea in mind, we can help you get inspired!

Apply Now

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

It's simple...

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!


Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study hard, practise conversation, and share good energy.

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Whatever you're learning, good, daily study habits will make you fluent. 

Try it out!
results.name: Let's Get Fluent! Language Study at Starbucks

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 37 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and will be 80 members by August 1st! That's a promise.


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45-55 people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Docks Oyster Bar
40th and 3rd Ave
(633 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)
results.how_to_find_us: business-networking lead-generation tech-startups women-in-networking entrepreneurs
results.name: New Frontier-26 (NYC Business Networking - BNI)

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

BNI Dream Team is currently looking for these professions to pass a boat load of business to. 

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Florist, Photographer, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, October 20th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

results.description:
We will do cold readings of plays in progress and short pieces from 1 to 2pm and then from 2 to 3pm -- if you are an actor pressed for time that day, please let me know if 1pm or 2pm works better for you, and I will try to accommodate your needs! I want you to be able to participate with ease.

At 3pm, we write til 4pm with a prompt. If you are only coming to write, please come by 3pm so we can start on time without interruptions. If you have paid in advance for the workshop, and you can't attend a writing session, the prompt will be sent to your email, so make sure I have your email. If you have a piece to be read, please try to send it to me via email in advance with a character breakdown to help me with casting.

You are also free to cast your own piece -- you may not cast yourself in your piece. Give yourself the chance to honor your writing by listening to it as a writer. You may know exactly how you want it done, but that doesn't necessarily help you as a writer. Trust me on this, or ask me about it -- I am happy to discuss it with you. You can also bring in a piece and ask to have it read, and we'll read it cold.

Please check your piece for time! Each writer gets up to ten minutes of material. This usually means ten pages if you write in accepted format with 12 point Courier font and your pages are not full of monologues. Monologues read longer than a minute a page. So time your work.

Write Now Workshop is free for actors, but writers pay a fee that I am trying to reduce by 1) opening the workshop up to the community for free as a model for creating community and involvement and offering content to seniors who live nearby and 2) using a space that doesn't cost me a fortune (most of the fees are space fees) and 3) applying for funding as we grow and documenting the way the concept works and 4) having the workshop subsidized by patrons of the arts (already happening so that I can offer it at the current rate).

The writers fees are currently $35 per session or $30 in advance for 9 workshops at $270 payable by cash or check or paypal to [masked]

Thank you!

Write Now; Right Later!
Emma

(FREE & OPEN TO THE COMMUNITY)

JOIN us on April 19th (Bicycle Day) for a bike ride, followed by talks, and storytelling near the UN!

To address the state of global drug policy, the United Nations General Assembly is holding a Special Session in New York City. 

We’re speaking out. Throughout the month of April, we’re encouraging everyone to use #psychedelicsbecause on social media to help spread the message.

This campaign aims to actively:

- Increase awareness around the benefits of psychedelics
- Share stories humanizing the diversity of psychedelic users
- Reverse decades of negative stigma surrounding psychedelic and psychoactive drugs
- Educate people on the current scientific research
- Promote psychedelic harm reduction by understanding the true risks and how to manage them
- Help end arrests, incarceration, and criminalization associated with global drug prohibition
- Unite psychedelic, drug policy reform, and harm reduction movements

Please join us for the historic occasion and help us spread the message of the campaign.

Schedule & location. 

2pm Meet at the Alice in Wonderland Statue in Central Park for a bike ride to the United Nations
4-6pm Stories in front of the UN at Dag Hammarskjöld Plaza (near 1st avenue)

Stay tuned for featured storytellers and other details soon.

We are a coalition of global research, policy, and social organizations including:
- Psymposia
- Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS)
- Drug Policy Alliance
- Students for Sensible Drug Policy
- The Beckley Foundation
- The Psychedelic Society of Brooklyn
results.name: Bicycle Day Ride and Stories

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
This event is currently at its maximum and is closed to new players.

From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.

The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls. 

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.
results.name: Ascension: The Isle of Dread

Traction, distribution, ACV, LTV, Magic Number, inside vs. outside sales.  All are topics that often come up in board rooms, investor pitches, and conversations between founders and investors, but what do investors really think of sales? Our panel of top-tier investors share their views and experiences of what really matter in B2B sales.

Our investor panelists include:


• Adam Townsend, Investor at Scrabble Investments - @adamscrabble


• David Aronoff, General Partner at Flybridge Capital - @dba

• Mia Hegazy, Associate at Catalyst Investors - @MiaHegazy


• Michael Gilroy, Venture Investor at Canaan Partners - @mbgilroy

We look forward to hearing more about their though process around investing in B2B tech companies, how they evaluate sales and revenue traction, and what things they have seen that works and does not work.  We will also touch on the topic of "sales of the future" and how they view sales teams, sales technologies, and the state of sales over the next few years.

Please share our community and this event with your colleagues and friends in sales.  You can post on LinkedIn and share over Twitter as well as following the conversation on our group hashtag #B2BSales.

Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/adapting-to-the-future-of-content-creation-and-marketing-tickets-24605503724

First there was radio, then TV took over radio, and now according to Apple CEO, Tim Cook, "Apps are the Next TV." Whoever would have though record studios would go out of business with musicians being able to sell direct?
At this Meetup we will have a presentation about the important media trends that are not only bound to grow but also bound to dominate. In ways that are overlooked and even ignored.

From 6:00pm to 6:45pm will be time for networking and mingling. Following, there will be a presentation covering the future of media for content creation and marketing.

1. Just For Me Media- how the ability for anyone to create their own "radio station" or "TV channel" with their phone will put Hollywood stars in fierce competition with social media stars.
2. Trailblazers- how those experimenting with new media channels like live streaming and virtual reality content are not getting the right recognition and why. While answering the question "if you start VR and live streaming before the rat race begins, you will eventually succeed."
3. How will VR take away the need to leave the house to watch movies like Netflix took away the need to leave the need to leave the house to rent movies.
4. What businesses can do to spend less money on paid advertising by instead connecting with social media influencers.
5. What the landscape of media could be by 2020.
results.name: Adapting to the Future of Content Creation and Marketing

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!...then bar party with everyone!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com

Real-Time Architecture Development with AngularJS

We recently built and launched a real-time sports wagering application, Winview using AngularJS and Ionic. During the application development process, as the business development goals evolved to need more and more real-time components, we slowly built out a framework within AngularJS for handling robust real-time functionality using long-polling alongside our internal application architecture. This talk details the evolution of the application's internal architecture to support real-time functionality using AngularJS.

Russell Wolf builds awesome digital products for fun and profit. Russell has been a software engineer at Philosophie for two years, and have worked with AngularJS for a little over a year.
