results.description:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/bsc-event-future-of-nyc-sustainability-opportunities-challenges-in-building-a-green-city-tickets-24433833253 Get 20% off ticket price using discount code GreenNewYorkers

Be Social Change invites Green New Yorkers on Tuesday, April 19th for a panel discussion on the Future of NYC: Sustainability - Opportunities & Challenges in Building a Green City.

"Home to over 8.5 million people, NYC’s high population density wouldn’t be possible without highly efficient innovations, including an extensive mass transit system, electrical power grid, the water system, sewage removal and treatment, product packaging, and solid waste removal. With greenhouse gas emissions at a fraction of the national average, some say NYC is a model of environmental responsibility. However, with over 1.2 billion gallons of water drawn from reservoirs over 100 miles from the city and over 25,000 tons of garbage collected each day, the city is far from self-sufficient.

Bringing together leaders and experts from nonprofits, academia, government, and the private sector, this panel will explore the challenges and opportunities facing NYC in becoming a more sustainable city and how New Yorkers can do their part in protecting the planet and it’s resources. What initiatives are addressing energy and buildings, waste and recycling, parks and public spaces, and environmental justice in NYC? What would a green, sustainable NYC look like, and what policies and programs are laying the groundwork to get us there?

{Snacks will be provided!}

Join the conversation on Twitter:

@besocialchange | @marcossalazar | @Interface_NYC | @StarrettLehigh | @solaronenyc | @roofproject

The Future of NYC is a monthly event series produced by Be Social Change that explores long-term opportunities and challenges facing our city and its 8.5 million residents. With experts in areas ranging from education to transportation, sustainability to disaster relief, we’ll dive deep into innovative projects, programs, and policies across the five boroughs and examine the impact today’s actions will have in 10, 20, 50 years."
results.name: Panel Discussion: Future of NYC Sustainability (tickets on Eventbrite)

results.description:
RSVP UPDATE:

The RSVP deadline has been changed to SUNDAY, April 17, at 12 noon. By that time you must either RSVP Yes or No. This is because of several last minute cancellations for workshops which have been the cause of inconvenience to your organizer as well as members, in general. Everyone's schedule and circumstances (not only yours!) must be respected.

FYI: PLEASE REMEMBER: Some members come from very far away to attend workshops. If you cancel at the last minute, you are depriving those who really want to attend so they can improve their skills, meet other members and network with like-minded folks, despite the fact that workshops may cause them extensive travel. Please be CONSIDERATE OF OTHERS when you RSVP or cancel. Thank you!

Details:

GREETINGS, STSANY SINGERS, ACTORS & INSTRUMENTALISTS of ALL AGES and LEVELS of Experience!

Would you like to improve your performing skills and try out your songs and monologues in a friendly, helpful atmosphere? Come to our workshop for singers, actors and instrumentalists on Tuesday, April 19  from 6:00-7:30, approximately.  Dates are subject to change. Let us know the best days and evenings you could attend workshops, including weekends. We will try to accommodate you! FEEL FREE TO INVITE YOUR FRIENDS TO ATTEND A WORKSHOP, to participate or observe. Spread the word!

Photo: STSANY volunteer performers in their original play with music, "Looking for Christmas"at Kravis Children's Hospital at Mt. Sinai in December 2015. Left to right: Christine, Anna, Jessica, Sheri and Lourdes

You will learn to breathe properly through helpful breathing exercises, easy, effective vocal warm-ups and improve your interpretive skills.

STSANY welcomes NEW MEMBERS, FIRST-TIMERS, Pros, Non-Pros, Semi-Pros and invited GUESTS to this workshop and all those to follow.

Meetup Fees: Members: $20; Participating Guests; $15; Observers: $10. Policy: Exact amount in cash at the door, when you attend each meetup.

Please arrive 10 minutes prior to the meetup, if possible, as elevators are busy at that hour.

•  NOTE: RSVP DEADLINE is at 10:00 p.m. on Monday, April 18. You must RSVP on this posting page. IMPORTANT! I

• IMPORTANT! PLEASE ADHERE TO OUR RSVP REQUIREMENT: If you RSVP and decide you cannot attend, be sure to change your RSVP to "no." This is a firm STSANY requirement so please adhere to it as a courtesy to your organizer and fellow members! Scheduling and keeping track of attendees takes a lot of time and effort. 

All workshops benefit members who want to improve their vocal, acting  and instrumental technique and interpretation. They provide a safe, supportive, AFFORDABLE, enjoyable atmosphere which addresses self-confidence, stage fright and other matters important to our members. Workshops are a first step in providing performance and volunteer opportunities.

Besides workshops and private lessons, members have the chance to perform in showcases, concerts, informal musicales, plays and musicals, and to volunteer to participate in outreach events around the City, which is incredibly rewarding! 

MEETUPS serve several purposes: 

* Learning: You are given instruction in singing and acting technique and interpretation, and you also learn from watching and listening to others. 

• Networking: You are encouraged to exchange information and possibly collaborate with other members (before, at a break and after the meetup) with whom you feel an affinity, personally and/or performance-wise, and to possibly collaborate with them on  STSANY projects or outside the meetup;

• Performance Opportunities: Concerts, Musical and/or Theatrical Events, One or Two-Person Shows, Informal Musicales, Outreach events including those during the December holidays, and more....

•  Volunteering: Please volunteer to be an assistant organizer (talk to me about your special talents!), and to help out at our various outreach events in hospitals, senior residences, etc.;

• Social: Enjoy meeting and getting to know others either before, during a workshop break, after meetup is over, at purely social events, and attending concerts, plays and other cultural events.

• What to bring to all meetup workshops: (Please read, carefully!) 

Singers: Bring 2 copies of 2 contrasting songs of any style (entire sheet music). If you don't have written songs, let me know and I can provide some at the meetup.

NOTE! If you don't wish to sing solo, please join us in our group numbers. Getting started is the important thing.  The shyness will subside, little by little.

Actors: Bring 2 copies of 2 contrasting monologues, poems or recitations.

Instrumentalists: Be prepared to play one or two contrasting pieces of any style.

YOU ARE ENCOURAGED TO RECORD the meetups for continued learning and inspiration!

• PRIVATE LESSONS are offered from 11:00 a.m to 8:00 p.m., by appointment, on weekdays/nights, and on Saturdays(sometimes Sundays) from 10:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m. Member discount cost: $75 for 45 minutes. (Non-members: $85) 

TO read about STSANY's GOALS and reviews, click on pages: http://www.meetup.com/SOMETHING-TO-SING-ABOUT-IN-NEW-YORK/about/

To see and hear members perform, please VISIT and SUBSCRIBE TO our youtube channel by clicking on this link: https://www.youtube.com/user/AlmaMusica/videos?view_as=public

Be inspired and live your DREAMS! Carpe diem!

All the best,

Anna 

www.annabartos.com

Founder-Director, STSANY since 2010

Founder-Director, Flor y Canto Chamber Ensemble since 1998

NYU Vocal Faculty from[masked] 

REVIEWS by STSANY members, fellow performers and event audience members: 

Had a lovely time ! I felt welcomed and enjoyed meeting everyone there. Everyone was friendly and this made me want to come back again.____Rick, STSANY member who attended our Getting to Know You! event at Jacques Torres

Anna Bartos is not only a superb singing teacher (she knows her music), she is an equally excellent coach, which is a rarity among singing teachers. She is also capable of imparting manyhelpful nuggets of information about the process of singing and performing that one doesn't usually receive from one's teacher. I found her instruction of enormous value.___. P. Vincent, NYC actor, playwright and STSANY showcase performer.

It was a wonderful session w/a warm, knowledgeable & insightful instructor & in great company!____Allyson, Member, STSANY

Fortunately for me I had the pleasure of Anna helping me with my singing technique which is something that I have always wanted to do. You should all attend this meetup whether you are experienced or a beginner (like me). You will be able to discover something so unique and wonderful about yourself with this group. I can guarantee it! _____Chels, Member, STSANY 

An excellent meetup! Anna knows her stuff and helped me improve my performances; the other members/performers are talented and friendly and fun."____Glen, Member, STSANY

The MUSICALE was a wonderfully diverse program in an intimate setting. I found the preliminary workshops extremely helpful in putting a role I'd worked on into a historical, musical, and linguistic framework. Anna Bartos is knowledgeable about a broad range of musical styles and genres, acting and character development as well as singing. ____Rebecca, Member of STSANY (Musicale on 1/19/14)

Amazing event. Thank you, Anna for holding the musicale. I am also glad to meet new singers.___Saadat, Member of STSANY

What a delightful surprise! Congratulations to Anna, a real pro, and an impressive mentor to a diverse array of talent. The 'meet-up' seems to be a real resource for both the performers and those of us in the audience.  Keep up the good work!____Mary Jay, Seasoned Senior Performer

It was a privilege to work with Anna Bartos on this 9/11 memorial concert. All of the performers were of high caliber and the audience rewarded our efforts with heartfelt applause. The program, with its mixture of styles and its emphasis on Americana, was just perfect for the anniversary date. I had a great time yesterday. It was a meaningful and well-organized concert.___ Moshe Knoll, Professional Classical pianist.

Thank you so much for inviting us to perform on this wonderful 9/11 concert.___Rosa Hyewon, Classical Guitarist

57+ RSVPs through Eventbrite so far - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/alleyboost-social-media-done-right-tickets-22558049734


Jason Malki, Co-Founder and CEO of AlleyBoost and SportsWonks will be hosting a Social Media panel featuring special guests, Courtney Spritzer, Co-Founder and COO of Socialfly, Jeongwoon Eun, Founder of Tigerwon, and Pavel Konoplenko, Co-Founder and CEO of Spoiled Media.

Topics that will be covered include ad buying, successful strategies, benefits of the different platforms, finding the right influencers , and more!

Join us for a Social Media focused evening:


6 – 6:15pm: Enjoy Light Refreshments and Hors d’Oeuvres

6:15 – 6:45pm: Startup Feedback: 3 startup pitches with feedback from our panel of experts

6:45 – 7:30pm: Panel

7:30 – 7:45pm: Q & A Between the Panel/Crowd

7:45 – 8pm: Business Development Networking: Mix and Mingle with the Audience and Panelists

PANEL

Jason Malki, Founder and CEO, AlleyBoost & SportsWonks (Moderator)

Jason is the Founder and CEO of AlleyBoost, which is a startup events series that hosts startup mixers, panels, investor nights, and expos in NYC. He is also the Founder and CEO of SportsWonks which is a sports social network that is set to launch in early May. Jason holds a B.A. from Montclair State University.

Courtney Spritzer, Co-Founder and COO, Socialfly

Courtney Spritzer is COO and Co-Founder of Socialfly, a New York-based social media marketing and influencer agency, where she oversees all operations, strategy, and finance. She is also co-author of Like, Love, Follow, her first book, written as a guide for entrepreneurs looking to grow their businesses using social media. Ms. Spritzer has made appearances on Bloomberg TV, is a frequent contributor on Entrepreneur.com and has lent her social media expertise to countless news outlets. A copy of her book, Like, Love, Follow, can be purchased on LikeLoveFollow.com.

Jeongwoon Eun, Founder, Tigerwon

Jeongwoon Eun (also known as Tigerwon™) is a passionately creative interviewer and vlogger who currently resides in New York City. She is the founder of “Tigerwon™ Inc.,” which utilizes various live streams to share exclusive content. Additionally, Tigerwon™ Inc. is a promotion and marketing service revolving around branding services, consulting, development, management, and marketing of brands for businesses and individuals. It’s also an entertainment service that features photographic, audio, video, and prose presentations on various topics such as food, fashion, travel, technology, and writing. Furthermore, Tigerwon™ is the Creator of Facebook group “IrEnVivo™,” a learning and connecting community for fellow live streamers.

Pavel Konoplenko, Co-Founder and CEO, Spoiled Media

Pavel works to make an impact where media, brands, and creators intersect. Combining the passion of connecting people and ideas, Pavel is the Co-Founder of Spoiled Media and The Culture LP.

Jenna Menking, Partner and CEO, Gotham Group

Jenna has an extensive background in PR, social media and creative marketing. With years of experience working with both corporate level and startup business clients, Jenna is looking to continually extend her portfolio to companies looking to grow in the ever expanding marketing world. Education: Vanderbilt University Experience: Jenna successfully created, built and sold one of the world’s largest celebrity social media management company to industry leading PR firm Rogers & Cowan.

Philosophy: There are a lot of companies just trying to push packages. You need a professional who will provide what you need, but will also look after the best interests of the company, future goals and return on investment.

Balsamiq is a small and personable company that competes on usability and customer service. Balsamiq believes work should be fun, and that life is too short for bad software.

The online streaming platform, uhetv.com, has reached over 3.5million household and 23 countries showcasing quality content entertaining viewers for the past few years, free of charge. results.description:
How is it that we haven't been to a proper pizza place yet for book club?!  (Since it's our city's signature food and all;-)  That's going to change in April, when we indulge in Neapolitan delights and a great $5 happy hour (until 7:00), all while discussing a riveting NYC psychological thriller!  Here's the details on the book http://amzn.to/1QXmqgI:

Morgan Prager, at age thirty, is completing her thesis on victim psychology at John Jay College of Criminal Justice in Manhattan. She is newly engaged to Bennett, a seductive but possessive and secretive man. She returns from class one day to find Bennett mauled to death, and her dogs—a Great Pyrenees and two pit bulls she has rescued—covered in blood. Bewildered and devastated that her dogs could have committed such violence, she worries that she might suffer from one of the syndromes she studies: pathological altruism, when selfless acts do more damage than good.

When Morgan tries to locate Bennett’s parents to tell them about their son’s hideous death, she discovers he was not the man he said he was. Everything he has told her—where he was born, where he lives and works—was a lie. In fact, he has several fiancées, and fits the clinical definition of a sociopath. And then, one by one, these other women are murdered. Suddenly Morgan’s research into Bennett takes on the urgency of survival: to stay alive, she must find out who is killing the women Bennett was closest to.


Excited to see you guys then, xo!
results.name: Discuss "The Hand That Feeds You" Over Pizza!

results.description:
First there was radio, then TV took over radio, and now according to Apple CEO, Tim Cook, "Apps are the Next TV." Whoever would have though record studios would go out of business with musicians being able to sell direct?


At this Meetup we will have a presentation about the important media trends that are not only bound to grow but also bound to dominate. In ways that are overlooked and even ignored.

From 6:00pm to 6:45pm will be time for networking and mingling. Following, their will be a presentation from Alexis Cardoza, moderated by Paul Rocks, covering the future of media for content creation and marketing.

Alexis Cardoza is a cinematographer working in film, VR, and putting it all together to bring stories to life.  One of his current featured film is Start Broadcast a documentary taking an experimental approach by being a documentary filmed via Periscope with the help of the Periscope Community.  He also runs the tech for Summit.Live and VR Salon.


The presentation will explore the in and outs of live streamers in social media and creators alike in the VR world.


1. Just For Me Media- how the ability for anyone to create their own "radio station" or "TV channel" with their phone will put Hollywood stars in fierce competition with social media stars.

2. Trailblazers- how those experimenting with new media channels like live streaming and virtual reality content are not getting the right recognition and why. While answering the question "if you start VR and live streaming before the rat race begins, you will eventually succeed."

3. How will VR take away the need to leave the house to watch movies like Netflix took away the need to leave the need to leave the house to rent movies.

4. What businesses can do to spend less money on paid advertising by instead connecting with social media influencers.

5. What the landscape of media could be by 2020.
results.name: Adapting to Future of Content Creation and Marketing

We will also be playing two card games: Cards against humanity and the new game SUPER FIGHT card games. Those who aren't familar with the new cool superfight game, here is the video showing you how to play it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oftjijhP-fs


____________________________________________ Meetup happy hour specials at Action Burger:

Meetup Happy hour specials:

$20 Rum & coke, open bar for 2 hours. Unlimited 16oz rum and cokes for one person for two hours.
Cheese Burger fries & Soda $8. Comes with up to 5 of the free toppings.

_______________________________________________
See you there. Written rules for SuperFight:

SUPERFIGHT BASIC RULES

The Setup:
Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

Youngest player goes first. Player one
starts by drawing three white cards and
three black cards. You can look at them,
but don’t let anyone else see them.
Player two (the next player to the left) does
the same.

Each player chooses one white card and
one black card from their hand to create a
fighter and places those cards face down.
Then they discard their remaining cards
into two separate piles (one for characters,
one for attributes).
Next, both players turn over their cards and
reveal their fighters.
Each player then draws a random black
card from the deck and adds it to their
fighter.

The Superfight:
Both players argue and plead their cases
about why their fighters would win the fight.
Once the arguing is done, the table votes
for a winner.

In the event of a tie, both players draw a
random white card and fight to the death
with no attributes. The table votes again. Do
this until there is a winner, then discard the
white cards from the tiebreaker fights.
The winning fighter stays on the table for
the next player to fight and will not get any
new attributes in the next fight. The player
who won the fight earns one point.

The Next Match:
Player three (the next player to the left) now
creates a fighter to battle the winner from
the last match, following the same rules for
fighter creation as in The Setup. Then The
Superfight begins again.

ALTERNATE RULES

Villain Battle:
Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

Every player draws three white cards and
three black cards. You can look at them, but
don’t let anyone else see them. The least liked
person at the table takes the first turn
as the Villain.

The Villain chooses one white card and one
black card from their hand and places those
cards face up on the table. Then the Villain
draws one random black card from the
deck and adds it to their fighter.

All other players choose one white card and
one black card from their hands to create
fighters to defeat the Villain. When everyone
is ready, reveal the fighters one at a time and
announce them to the table. Starting with the
player to the left of the Villain, play an
additional black card from your hand onto
any fighter on the table (including the Villain
or yourself!) and then discard the rest of your
hand.

Next the Villain picks who would do the best
against his or her fighter. That fighter wins
the battle and gets one point.
The player to the left of the current Villain
becomes the new Villain. Every player draws
three new white cards and three new black
cards, and a new battle begins.

Battle Royale:

Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

All players draw three white cards and three
black cards. You can look at them, but don’t
let anyone else see them. Each player places
one white card and one black card face
down on the table. One at a time, players
reveal their fighters and announce the
fighters to the table.

Before playing the second black card, select
one of the following game modes:

A) Each fighter’s second black card is drawn
randomly from the deck.

B) Players may play one additional black
card from their hands onto any fighter at
the table (including themselves).
Everyone votes on which fighter would be
the last one standing.

Pacifists:
Follow any of the rules outlined above, but
this time choose the winner based on who
is the funniest, or imagine it’s a dating
website and you’re picking the best match.
Pick who would be the best construction
worker, or nanny, or use your imagination!

Finally:
Unlike other judge-based games, this is not
anonymous. If a player is being biased, for
whatever dumb reason, never play with
that person again. They are lame, and
should go play charades with their cats
until they learn how to play with people.
Imagine the fighters are fighting on an
island or anywhere you want, but New York
is a good default.

Players of all skill levels are welcome. Westchester FC is about playing the beautiful game in a fun environment where everyone can get a good workout and improve their skills. It doesn't matter if you are the Messi of White Plains or you have never kicked a ball before, all you need are shoes.

While we will spend most of the time playing pick-up games, we will start with some warm-up to get the blood flowing. SPREAD THE WORD and get your friends to sign up!

I can't stress enough that fun is the top priority, because of this, no rough play (slide tackling is prohibited) or rude language. Violators will be warned, sent off, suspended or banned from Westchester FC games. We want everyone to feel comfortable so that we can really grow this club.

DON'T MISS OUR FIRST ARDUINO TUESDAYS VENDOR PRESENTATION!

IMPORTANT: Everyone is invited to come learn and ask questions.  If you would like to install the software and get the MPLAB Xpress Evaluation Board running from your laptop, please submit this form, ( just signing up on meetup.com is not sufficient).  We will be giving away boards to the first 8 people who sign up. As of 11:30AM Today April 19 12 people have signed up for the meetup but only 6 of the 8 boards are spoken for - 2 more are available.

6:00PM - Introductions, general gathering, set-up, connect your laptops.

6:30PM  - MICROCHIP will be presenting about their  8-bit micro-controllers and development tools:

Hands on getting started with MPLAB Xpress:

They will walk through loading an example, simulating, compiling and, programming the Xpress board using the Xpress IDE. They will the walk the attendees through starting a project from scratch using MCC to create a serial link back to their host PC to monitor the an Analog voltage on the Potentiometer.

Microchip recently acquired Atmel the manufacturer of the Arduino microcontroller chips.  Their local Field Applications Engineer who is focused on Arduino / Atmel will also be on-site to offer assistance and answer any questions.

             We look forward to seeing you there.

results.description:
What is your pathway to growth and increased revenue?  Discover the surest path to growth with resources on the edge of your company’s current operations.

Edge Innovation:  Best Opportunities Hidden in Plain Sight 

Tuesday, April 19, 2015, 6:00-8:00 pm @ 299 Broadway, New York, NY

Alan Lewis

Dan McKone

Alan Lewis and Dan McKone – the authors of Edge Strategy: A New Mindset for Profitable Growth (Harvard Business Review Press, 2016) -- will discuss how to innovate effectively and incrementally by taking advantage of products, customers and assets on the edge or periphery of a company’s current operations.

Alan Lewis is a Managing Director and Partner, of L.E.K Consulting, a global corporate advisory firm, based in Boston.  His focus is to partner with clients to help them define and realize their growth strategies.  His areas of expertise are new product and service development, new market entry strategy, customer loyalty, customer experience strategy, digital customer engagement strategy, inorganic growth strategy, implementing growth strategy and organizational change.  He has worked extensively with clients in the travel, hospitality, leisure, and transportation industries.

Dan McKone is a Managing Director and Partner of L.E.K Consulting, Over the last two decades, Dan has been a thought leader on the growth and optimization of consumer-facing businesses. He has directed over 300 projects spanning performance improvement, strategic decision analysis, new concept development, channel strategy, pricing and positioning, organizational design, new business launches and mergers & acquisitions. In particular, he has deep experience advising companies in the Retail, Consumer Products and Travel & Leisure spaces.

Date: Tuesday April 19, 2016

Time: 6:00 – 8:00 PM

6:00 – 6:30 Gathering & Networking 

6:30 – 7:30 Presentation and Discussion 

7:30 – 8:00 Additional Networking

Pricing:

PDMA Members - FREE 

Non Members: Register by April 10th - $15, after April 10th - $20 

Students - $15

Location: Acquis Consulting Group, 299 Broadway, (between Duane and Reade Streets), 12th Floor, Manhattan - A PDMA NY/NJ Chapter Sponsor

Click here to Learn More and Register

If you have any questions, please contact the Product Development and Management Association New York / New Jersey chapter at [masked]

Register at http://www.pdma.org/p/cm/ld/fid=1991
results.name: The Best Opportunities are Hidden in Plain Sight:  Explore "Edge Innovation"

results.description:
Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/adapting-to-the-future-of-content-creation-and-marketing-tickets-24605503724

First there was radio, then TV took over radio, and now according to Apple CEO, Tim Cook, "Apps are the Next TV." Whoever would have though record studios would go out of business with musicians being able to sell direct?
At this Meetup we will have a presentation about the important media trends that are not only bound to grow but also bound to dominate. In ways that are overlooked and even ignored.

From 6:00pm to 6:45pm will be time for networking and mingling. Following, there will be a presentation covering the future of media for content creation and marketing.

1. Just For Me Media- how the ability for anyone to create their own "radio station" or "TV channel" with their phone will put Hollywood stars in fierce competition with social media stars.
2. Trailblazers- how those experimenting with new media channels like live streaming and virtual reality content are not getting the right recognition and why. While answering the question "if you start VR and live streaming before the rat race begins, you will eventually succeed."
3. How will VR take away the need to leave the house to watch movies like Netflix took away the need to leave the need to leave the house to rent movies.
4. What businesses can do to spend less money on paid advertising by instead connecting with social media influencers.
5. What the landscape of media could be by 2020.
results.name: Adapting to the Future of Content Creation and Marketing

group.name: Geeks & Suits NYC meetup where tech meets-up with business

On April 19th join the the New Jersey LGBT Chamber of Commerce at the Clifton favorite, Spuntino Wine Bar.  

Spuntino's philosophy: "...life is an adventure filled with unlimited opportunities, possibilities and experiences."  The Chamber couldn't agree more.  So come out and meet new people in this beautiful space.  Talk business, make social connections and learn who else in the LGBT business and social community is right in your neighborhood.

New Jersey Monthly magazine has noted that the wine list is extensive and the small-plate options are plentiful -- and is there any better way to relax and meet new people?

The Chamber's board of directors will be hosting the evening and making introductions, all around.  Come out and meet the other LGBT business professionals in your area.

Bring your business cards!   We'll be raffling off a one-year membership to the Chamber at 9pm!

There is no entrance fee or cover for this event and RSVPs are non-committal, but for headcount purposes, it allows the restaurant to staff properly -- so please hit the RSVP button!  And you can also RSVP directly to [masked]

results.description:
With the majority of Wordpress and WooCommerce host available online, choosing a host can seem daunting.  Given that Wordpress and Woocommerce are open source, how can you find a hosted provider who takes care of everything for you?

In this meetup we will explore what hosting in the cloud means and how it compares to hosted platforms like Shopify and BigCommerce.

We will review WooCommerce features, frameworks, what all this means when choosing a host, developer, and getting support for your WooCommerce website.

Please note that RSVP's and a ticket is required for the meetup.

Ticket URL: hhttps://app.moonclerk.com/pay/hx1ff30fiir

So all members can appropriately plan for attendance, we intend to keep the the timing of the meetup consistent throughout the year.

Come and learn and be part of the ever growing WooCommerce community.

Location: Grind NYC

Meet & Greet: 6:15pm - 6:30pm

Get To Know your fellow WooCommerce patrons, exchange a business card, and perhaps learn a thing or two you didn’t know before.

WooCommerce Hosting In The Cloud 6:30- 7:30PM

Come find out what WooCommerce cloud hosting entails and how can easily transfer your store to WooCommerce if you are on another hosted solution like BigCommerce or Shopify.

With more business owners looking for a more robust and affordable solution, switching over to WooCommerce has never been easier.  Come find out how.

We will review, frameworks, what all this means and how to understand how everything in WooCommerce is connected.

Q&A: 7:15-8:00PM

Meeting close: 8:00PM

Tickets: In order to guarantee a space at the meetup events, a ticket must be purchase to gain access to the venue. We want to offset any shave also provided an opportunity for those his ensures we keep the high quality of the meetups Ticket URL: https://app.moonclerk.com/pay/hx1ff30fiir

$5 OnSite

$2 Virtual

***Only for the cost of a fiverr gig.
results.name: WooCommerce Hosting In The Cloud

results.description:
What you do in the markets in the next few months will determine how much money you will make in the next few years.


The markets are in an unusual state since mid-February -- both stocks AND commodities -- are going up. There is more money though, at least in the long term, to be made in commodities. After declining for almost 5 years since 2011, many commodities are super cheap (the low in the proverbial "buy low"), while stocks are fairly expensive (the high in "sell high"). 


See my latest articles on Seeking Alpha (follow me to get them sent to you) and TalkMarkets. There are daily updates on Twitter: @nyinvesting.

Adding interactivity to sites requires JavaScript. Whether you know how to write code or you copy/paste it from the web, JavaScript is going through massive changes that you need to know about. This talk will map out the new JavaScript landscape (heard of ES6?) to help you get ready for the future of web design. Highlights include:
- An introduction to ES6 and how it makes writing code easier
- The ability to read and understand ES6 code—even if you’re new to the language
- How modern JavaScript fits into your existing workflow

Kyle Simpson, speaker and author of the “You Don’t Know JavaScript” book series, will cover the 80/20 of functional programming.

Get most of the benefit without all the crazy rules and academic language that’s sometimes used to talk about simple concepts.

Kyle will show you a practical take on functional programming, so you can use techniques like Pure Functions, Composability & Immutability, map/reduce/filter and Recursion to improve your programs today.

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =

Kyle Simpson is Head of Curriculum for MakerSquare and an evangelist of the open web. He's passionate about all things JavaScript, writes books, teaches JavaScript, speaks, and contributes to the world of OSS.

Website: http://getify.me

GitHub: https://github.com/getify

Books: http://search.oreilly.com/?q=you+don%27t+know+js+kyle+simpson

About MakerSquare:


MakerSquare utilizes Hack Reactor's hiring partner network and renowned immersive curriculum to help maintain a 96% employment rate and industry leading graduate salaries: $106k in San Francisco, $92k in Los Angeles, and $75k in Austin. Classes in NYC start 5/31. Over three months, students learn computer science fundamentals and full-stack JavaScript development in an intense, inspiring, supportive environment for 11 hours a day, six days a week. For more information, visit MakerSquare's website.

results.description:
This week I am going to see Criminal I will arrive at 6:30 for the 7:05 pm showing. I  have seat C6 If you are coming post your seat #  If anyone wants to go to the Red Oak Diner after the movie meetup again in the lobby after the show.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie


Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!    Love, Cassie

PS: I am doing this with my friendship group too so if you are S&L do wear your wristbands. These are loads of fun at the movies they glow in the dark!

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!
results.how_to_find_us: assinged seats
results.name: $5.50 Movie Night- Criminal

Hoard Of The Dragon Queen... Sort Of....

results.description: If you're new to backpacking or just want a refresher, this indoor seminar presents an introductory overview of backpacking. Like any efficient backpacker, it "packs" the essentials into a small amount of space! Learn about equipment choices, physical preparation, packing tips, basic skills, Leave No Trace principles, and upcoming AMC beginner backpack trips. Nonrefundable $5 registration fee (helps pay for AMC volunteer backpack leader WFA training). Limited to 20 people. Please join the wait list here, and register on the AMC website by clicking here. I'll then add you to the RSVP list as "going" after I receive your registration email.
results.how_to_find_us: Office is located in YMCA on 2nd floor. Subway: Take #1 train to W. 66th St. & Broadway; or the A, C, B or D train to Columbus Circle.
results.name: Introduction to Backpacking Indoor Seminar NYC

group.name: Appalachian Mountain Club New York-North Jersey

results.description:
After the New York voters express their "New York Values" at the ballot box, come watch the Primary results with your fellow members over drinks and refreshments.

The members of Current Events Cafe will be joining us.


The doors open at 6:30pm.

------------------------------------------------------------

Here's a short poetic piece in a spirit of this crucial pre-election contest:

Come one, come all

Let's cheer and jeer the victory and concession speeches

Some of the Candidates have returned "Home" to New York


For they wish to express their "New York State of Mind"

While others simply hope to be part of it, New York, New York


The candidates are running in their vagabond shoes

As they find themselves in a City that never sleeps

Whoever wins here may be the king (or the queen) of the hill, top of the heap


Who cares if a Candidate eats pizza with a fork

We're too busy to give a hoot

Not even in a New York Minute . . . 'cause the Rent is Too Damn High!

This ain't no Iowa

There ain't no raucous-caucus

Nor any corn-dog eatin' Straw Poll hocus-pocus

Because if they can make it here . . . they can make it anywhere

So, it's up to you, New York, New York!
results.name: NYS Primary Election Results Viewing Party

results.description:
As featured by ABC News and Time Out NYC, our scavenger hunts are part hunt, part obstacle course & ALL FUN! 

This time we're going to explore the awesome High Line! The High Line is a one and a half mile long NYC linear park on an elevated section of a disused New York Central Railroad spur called the West Side Line. 

You can come alone and be placed on one of our teams or you can sign up with friends. It is a great way to connect meet new friends or connect with old ones. 

*PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Apr-19-2016_at_0630PM

*PREPAY ONLY EVENT. MUST PURCHASE IN ADVANCE.

A series of clues will lead your team around the High Line. You'll experience the excitement of being part of a team that solves clues & faces mental and (not-so) physical challenges in a race to the finish line.  

Each member of the winning group receives a gift package, and the pictures you'll snap along the way will be priceless.

What to expect: 

• A fun night with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Apr-19-2016_at_0630PM

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door) 

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event.  

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged) The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Please download that before you come to the event.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain! 

How many members will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on pre-sales and RSVP's from other groups, we will have at least 25 people attending. 

How do I attend? RSVP with group and prepay at link below. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets ASAP here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Apr-19-2016_at_0630PM
results.name: The Amazing NYC High Line Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Only)

results.description:
As featured by ABC News and Time Out NYC, our scavenger hunts are part hunt, part obstacle course & ALL FUN! 

This time we're going to explore the awesome High Line! The High Line is a one and a half mile long NYC linear park on an elevated section of a disused New York Central Railroad spur called the West Side Line. 

You can come alone and be placed on one of our teams or you can sign up with friends. It is a great way to connect meet new friends or connect with old ones. 

*PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Apr-19-2016_at_0630PM

*PREPAY ONLY EVENT. MUST PURCHASE IN ADVANCE.

A series of clues will lead your team around the High Line. You'll experience the excitement of being part of a team that solves clues & faces mental and (not-so) physical challenges in a race to the finish line.  

Each member of the winning group receives a gift package, and the pictures you'll snap along the way will be priceless.

What to expect: 

• A fun night with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Apr-19-2016_at_0630PM

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door) 

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event.  

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged) The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Please download that before you come to the event.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain! 

How many members will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on pre-sales and RSVP's from other groups, we will have at least 25 people attending. 

How do I attend? RSVP with group and prepay at link below. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets ASAP here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Apr-19-2016_at_0630PM

results.description:
In our first event focused on Angel Investors and the companies they select we will hear from both and learn more about how these relationships work.

Please join us for an evening with the healthcare crowd in our first ever Healthcare Angels focused event!

Meet The Startups


We are pleased to bring you three great new companies to pitch:

Ron Gold - CEO and Co-Founder, LeanOnWe.com - Lean On We is a LeanOnWe is an innovative service in the home care market featuring a hybrid business model matching careseekers with the most highly referred caregivers. The service allows families to find the caregiver that meets their unique needs while maintaining control over the management of that care. Families choose from the exclusive list of recommended caregivers and we do the rest!

Om Vadlapatla - CEO and Founder at Klincis. Hemcis, Klincis' flagship product, is a clinical decision support system for blood transfusions. Using EMR data and real-time lab data combined with current guidelines, we provide composite data and relevant literature at the point of care, enabling clinicians to make evidence-based decisions. 

Chris Adams, Founder and CEO, Ceeable, creators of EYECARE ANYWHERE™ A revolutionary way to detect and treat retinopathies for billions of people worldwide.


Meet Our Angels

We have invited some of the top Angels in healthcare to be our Healthcare Angels Panelists.  In the past we have had Esther Dyson and Owen Davis, Todd Petri, Charles Huang, and dozens of other top healthcare investors up front.  The panel is still assembling so if you are an active angel investor in the space, please email us here.   

Here is our Panel so far:

Dr. Atul Kumar, MD, MBA

Dr. Kumar is a long time healthcare angel investor, Staff Gastroenterologist for the VA, Senior Faculty at Stony Brook University and a member of the MedStartr Investment Review Committee.  He has also served as a TEDMED Scholar, as Chaor of the GI Drugs Advisory Committee at the FDA, and been involved as Entrepreneur, Investor, and Adviser to numerous healthcare startups.  Learn more here.

Neale Trangucci

Neale served as a Partner and Officer at Stonehill Investment Corp and Mason Capital Management for 23 years and now invests in startups including AdhereTech, AllGood, and iPracticeBuilder and serves on several boards.  Learn more about Neale on LinkedIn.

Dr. Sunny Malhotra, MD

Dr. Sunny Malhotrais a Sports Cardiologist working at AdvantageCare Physicians in New York. He is an entrepreneur, physician advisor, and health technology investor. He is the winner of Best in Healthcare – Notable Young Professional and the national Governor General’s Caring Canadian Award 2015. He is a contributing editor to Canadian Health Technology magazine and writer for the Medical Post. Follow on twitter, instagram: @drsunnymalhotra or Linkedin

Your Moderator


Jim Lebret, MD

Dr. Lebret  is an academic physician, consultant and advisor in digital health as well as an Assistant Professor of Medicine and Clinical Innovation and Director of Code Team Leaders at NYU Medical Center.  He also is a consultant for CloudMedx and Oscar Insurance sits on the advisory board of Cohere Health and the NYC EDC's Digital Health Breakthrough Network.  His goal is to revolutionize healthcare with technology and innovation.  Follow him @JimLebret or learn more about him on Linkedin. 

Get Involved


If you want to present your company, please Apply here.


If you want to sponsor this event, please email events (at) medstartr.com

If you want to be a Healthcare Angel panelist to to be considered for a role at another event, please Apply Here. 


Agenda

6:30 - 7:00  Networking, Meet, Tweet and Greet – #H2NYC

7:00 - 7:05  Welcome, Introductions, Opening Remarks

7:05  - 7:45  Pitches and Q & A

7:45 - 8: 00   Panel and Pitches

8:00 - 8:30 Panel Discussion on Healthcare Angel Investing  

8:30-8:40  Wrap-up and Closing Thoughts  

8:40-9:30  Networking 


Healthy snacks and beverages will be available.

Watch Live or Later

There will be no live feed for this event (Mike is working the Primary) but you can see it later on MedStartr.tv.  

It is always better in person though, so get a ticket, support your health innovation community, and we will see you there.

Thank You!

Thank you for being part of this amazing crowdsourced community that has helped so many new companies get going in healthcare!  

Best Regards,

Alex, Anthony, Mimi, Steve, Kim, Jim, and the H2NYC/MedStartr gang

results.description:
Humanity has heard and spoken with “the others” across human history: we’ve quantified types and communication protocols for those whom have passed.


A human or animal spirit can and will imprint on a person, place or thing in times of deep emotional spikes: love, fear, anger, joy.  We walk into a room and hear the whispers of the past inhabitants, feel the brush of cold on our neck, see a shadow flash past.  All imprints on the fabric of time: what are called ghosts.

We’re intertwined with the spirits of loved ones past; our emotional ties truly bind though space and time.  They walk with us in our dreams, during times of great joy or stress and when we shake off the mortal coil, they await us with open arms: what are the soul’s lifeforce passed: spirits. 

They caution before times of great peril, harbingers of danger and the ultimate family or environmental guardians: the specters that haunt and harrow.

Cohabitation with spirits, ghosts and specters happens constantly: communicating with them can be achieved with time, patience and practice.  Join B, professional Medium for this week’s Alchemy Moderne Workshop, Mediumship Protocols; Speaking with Ghosts, Spirits and Specters to explore the different types of entities, safe connection and communication, proper release and removal techniques.  Participants are welcome to bring in any object that they feel connects them with a specific spirit and encouraged to share experiences with “those who have passed”. 

Note: We will be communicating with one or more of each participant’s spirit of choice: Please do bring any amulets, talisman, pen and paper, pendulum and crystal ball that will increase your personal comfort level.  We will, if time allows, be working with automatic writing without channeling...interesting, no?

The Touchstones of the evening are Carnelian, Ruby and Salt Minerals of all species.  All great stones for cleansing negativity from environment, excellent facilitator for making connection with spirits while protecting the human handler. 

All natural, non-heated/color treated carnelian, ruby and the salts: halite, angelate, hanksite are welcome for this workshop.  Quartz crystal ball are also invited to boost your gain.

Participants are encouraged to bring in stones for identification: carnelian, ruby and rock salt minerals will be on hand for purchase, play and utilization.  As always, Berzbeez local honey sweetened herbal tea will be served, gratis.

$25 per person: cash on site or via paypal: [masked]

RSVP yes with sincerity…..

If you rsvp yes and can’t make it, no issues!: please just drop me a line…this way we know you’re safe and sound!

results.description:
Brad Bebee, Chief Executive Officer, Blazegraph

Free beer + drinks, swag, candy & more!

A Database Month event http://www.DBMonth.com/database/gpu-analytics

Apache Spark and GPUs are two of the biggest stories in Data Science and Analytics in the past year. Apache Spark makes it easy to build analytics over large scale data sets. NVIDIA GPUs provide the computational power for machine and deep learning challenges.

However, It is non-trivial to exploit the power of GPUs and scale applications onto multi-core, parallel architectures. GPU algorithms not only require significant expertise to develop, but also intimate knowledge of the CPU and GPU memory systems, and detailed knowledge of the Compute Unified Device Architecture (CUDA), Writing fast, efficient data analytics for graph and machine learning on GPUs can be hard due to the complexities of CUDA and achieving effective parallelism.

DASL and SPARQL are high-level languages for graph and machine learning algorithms (DASL) and graph pattern matching (SPARQL) that provide speedups of up to 1,000x over Spark native and up to 300x over leading graph databases when executed on the BlazeGraph platform.

We will present Blazegraph GPU benchmarking results against our SPARQL-enabled, non-GPU Blazegraph platform over the Lehigh University Benchmark (LUBM) and Berlin Sparql Benchmark (BSBM) demonstrating[masked]X speed-up. Users of the RDF/SPARQL API are able to achieve this acceleration simply by changing to the GPU-enabled platform without underlying code or application changes.

We will present Blazegraph DASL (pronounced 'dazzle') for graph and predictive analytics that combines the ease of Spark with the speed of GPUs. It has shown 1000X acceleration for large graphs when compared to in-memory processing with GraphX. DASL is a Scala-based language provides graphs and machine learning algorithms over linear algebra primitives. DASL programs are translated into task graphs that expose the available parallelism. The underlying Blazegraph DASL runtime integrates closely with Apache Spark. It provides the ability to write and execute DASL programs in Apache Spark and delivers a distributed, scalable architecture for machine learning and graph algorithms on GPUs and GPU clusters within the Spark environment.

Brad Bebee, Chief Executive Officer, Blazegraph

Brad is the CEO of Blazegraph leading efforts to deliver graphs at scale with Blazegraph products. An expert in graphs and large-scale analytics, he has a diverse background in software developments, telecommunications, and information retrieval.

Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm
Power-Networking at 6:35pm 
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

Did you know that Techie Youth is the ONE-AND-ONLY organization providing career-opportunities to severely-at-risk foster-youth in New York?

Techie Youth is a 501c3 not-for-profit charity of NYC that provides technology-education, followed by assistance beginning an IT-career, to at-risk youth in NYC & Long Island who are in foster-care and classified as being severely-at-risk of becoming homeless and/or incarcerated in the next 18-24 months.

These kids need YOU, they have nobody else.
Please help them. Learn about Nadine, a student of Techie Youth: http://www.TechieYouth.org/hope

results.description:
Visit us at Metis in New York City on Tuesday, April 19th from 6:30 - 8pm and meet the instructors, students, and alumni of our Data Science Bootcamp. 


Enjoy food and drinks as Sr. Data Scientists Julia Lintern and Michael Galvin walk you through a sampling of what students learn throughout their 12 weeks of project-based data science work. Jennifer Raimone, Metis Career Advisor, will also speak about the career support process, and Jason Moss, Metis Co-Founder, will be on hand to take your questions.  

6:30 - 7:00 Register, Mingle, Eat & Drink 
7:00 - 7:30 Julia and Mike discuss the Metis Data Science Bootcamp and Jenn shares the career support structure 
7:30 - 8:00 Chat with Metis students, staff, and alumni and enjoy more food & drinks

Plan on learning about the Bootcamp curriculum and outcomes, as well as how it culminates with Metis Career Day – when hiring partners come to Metis for student final presentations and portfolio reviews.

Julia Lintern 
Metis Sr. Data Scientist

Julia comes to Metis after working at JetBlue as a quantitative engineer. While at JetBlue, she used quantitative analysis and machine learning methods to provide continuous assessment of the aircraft fleet. Julia began her career as a structures engineer, where she designed repairs for damaged aircraft. In 2011, she transferred into a quantitative role at JetBlue and began her M.A. in Applied Math at Hunter College, where she focused on visualizations of various numerical methods including collocation and finite element methods. She discovered a deep appreciation for the combination of mathematics and visualizations and found data science to be a natural extension. Julia has also worked as an Expert in Residence for a company that provides data science training. She continues to collaborate on various projects including the development of stock trading algorithms. During certain seasons of her career, she has also worked on creative side projects such as Lia Lintern, her own fashion label.

Michael Galvin 
Metis Sr. Data Scientist 

Michael comes to Metis from General Electric where he worked to establish the company’s data science strategy and capabilities for field services and to build solutions supporting global operations, risk, engineering, sales, and marketing. He also taught data science and machine learning for General Assembly. Prior to GE, Michael spent several years as a data scientist working on problems in credit modeling at Kabbage and corporate travel and procurement at TRX. Michael holds a Bachelor's degree in Mathematics and a Master's degree in Computational Science and Engineering from the Georgia Institute of Technology where he also spent 3 years working on machine learning research problems related to computational biology and bioinformatics. Additionally, Michael spent 12 years in the United States Marine Corps where he held various leadership roles within aviation, logistics, and training units. In his spare time, he enjoys running, traveling, and reading.

Vinny Senguttuvan 
Metis Sr. Data Scientist

Vinny comes to Metis after leading a team of Data Scientists at High 5 Games. Prior to that he taught Machine Learning at General Assembly and built tools for Animators and Effects Artists at Blue Sky Studios (the company that made Ice Age, Rio and The Peanuts Movie). He has a Masters in Computational Engineering and another in Creative Writing. He enjoys the nexus of mathematics, computer programming, human perception and arts. Over the past three years, Vinny has been knee-deep in large distributed data -- aggregating, building recommendation systems, measuring popularity and predicting Lifetime Value. In that time, he also finished a first draft of his novel. An avid programmer, Vinny has won various programming contests including the Regional ACM Collegiate Programming Contest. He has taught at the University of Miami and has given talks and presentations at various colleges and conferences.

Jennifer Raimone
Career Advisor

Jennifer comes to Metis with close to 8 years of experience in career development. Her tenure at TheLadders included managing a team of sourcers dedicated to connecting talent with employers. With a double certification in Career Coaching and Resume Writing coupled with a keen sense of the recruitment process, Jennifer is eager to share her experience and knowledge on how to successful gain employment. Jennifer has her BA in English and Language Arts. During her free time, she enjoys cooking, reading, and dancing with her husband and new baby boy.

Jason Moss 
Metis Co-Founder and GM

For almost 20 years, Jason has worked in education. From founding a nonprofit organization in New Orleans to working at companies such as McKinsey & Company, Scholastic, Kaplan, and now Metis (a part of Kaplan), he has sought opportunities to build businesses and work with exceptional teams on creating transformative learning experiences and products. He spends most his time at Metis (1) ensuring the quality of the student experience and outcome; (2) developing the roadmap and building the team to grow the business, and (3) engaging with data scientists around the country with whom Metis can collaborate.

Connect with us before the event! @thisismetis
results.name: Metis Data Science Open House: Meet the Instructors, Students, and Alumni

results.description:
Despite being the ingress point to almost all of today’s applications and websites, DNS has been overlooked as a way to significantly improve application performance. In this talk, Kris Beevers, Co-founder of NS1, will give a brief history of DNS and explain how in the past few years this ubiquitous protocol has evolved to meet the needs of the modern application stack. Kris will also discuss how DNS, when combined with real-time metrics and modular traffic rules, is critical to building a resilient, high performance, and scalable application that meets the demands of today’s users and is optimized down to the millisecond.

Kristopher Beevers (@beevek) is founder and CEO of NS1, a high performance managed DNS company in New York delivering modern data driven DNS, with customers like Yelp, Imgur, Collective Media, MaxCDN, and more, ranging from ad tech to rich media to ecommerce. Prior to NS1, Dr. Beevers led platform development at Voxel dot Net, where he built cloud and bare metal platforms, content delivery networks, and other distributed infrastructure products up to and following Voxel's acquisition by Internap. Dr. Beevers holds BS, MS, and PhD degrees in computer science from RPI.

Spotify is hosting us again. And they still have food and beer!

As always, we are going to have geekaways with geeky prizes provided by our sponsors!

Agenda:

6:30 - Arrive at Spotify, meet other members
6:45 - Event starts
7:00 - DNS as a Web Performance Tool (Kris Beevers)
8:00 - Q&A
8:15 - "Books and Stuff" geekaways
8:30 - Open Discussion, Networking

Location:

Spotify
45 West 18th St
7th floor
New York, NY

Directions on Google Maps: http://bit.ly/1Jx2bUA

Entrance on StreetView: http://bit.ly/1Jc5g6P

Our Sponsors:

• Akamai® is the leading cloud platform for helping enterprises provide secure, high-performing user experiences on any device, anywhere.

• New Relic is a software analytics company that makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications in real time.


• SOASTA’s web and mobile app test automation solution enables developers, QA professionals, and IT Operations teams to test with unprecedented speed, scale and precision.
results.name: DNS as a Web Performance Tool

Each member of the winning group receives a gift package, and the pictures you'll snap along the way will be priceless.

Co-Hosted by NYC Open Data meetup and NYC Data Science Academy meetup.


*** Apply for 12 week full time Data Science bootcamp program to be a Data Scientist , next offering is from July 5th to Sept 20th, 2016 *** 

=====================================

Bio 
Anthony Goldbloom is the founder and CEO of Kaggle. In 2011 & 2012, Forbes Magazine named Anthony as one of the 30 under 30 in technology, in 2013 the MIT Tech Review named him one of top 35 innovators under the age of 35 and the University of Melbourne awarded him an Alumni of Distinction Award. He holds a first call honors degree in Econometrics from the University of Melbourne. Anthony has published in the The Economist and the Harvard Business Review. 

Title: What Kaggle has learned from 2MM machine learning models 

Abstract: Kaggle is a community of over 500K data scientists who have built almost 2MM machine learning models to participate in our competitions. Data scientists come to Kaggle to learn, collaborate and develop the state of the art in machine learning. This talk will cover some of the lessons we have learned from top performers in the Kaggle community. 
  Reference: www.kaggle.com

results.description:
Join Dev Bootcamp for a talk with Ajay Yadav, Founder and CEO of Roomi, a mobile-­first, co-­living platform that’s reinventing the way people search and connect in the rental industry. Ajay will draw from his experiences as an entrepreneur and developer and discuss what companies, particularly growing startups, look for when hiring developers; what the day-to-day workflow is like for engineers at startups; and building a great app idea into a marketable company.

Ajay created Roomi after helping a friend search for a roommate, spending countless hours emailing back and forth, sifting through candidates with conflicting preferences, and worrying about safety when going to see a listing. Ajay developed the concept for a new app to help connect people looking for a place to live with those looking for a roommate. He wrote the code himself until he could afford his first employee. Since then, he’s guided Roomi through its debut in New York and expansion to California, Pennsylvania and Texas, with other markets and services

Before Roomi, Ajay studied computer science at NYIT and helped to launch two other startups. Ajay also serves as a Lean Startup Machine mentor, advising early­ stage startups during crucial growth points. He loves working with people who are also passionate about building a better world, and he strives to lead by example. It’s no surprise that people have called Ajay the scrappiest entrepreneur on the planet, a title that brings a smile to his face. When he isn’t dreaming up new ideas to change the world, you can find him with his nose in a business or spirituality book, or enjoying a good sci­-fi flick.
results.name: Building a Career and Company: A talk with Roomi CEO Ajay Yadav

results.description:
Use our Speaker Form to suggest a keynote presentation or lightning talk you'd like to give. If there's a topic you'd like someone else to talk about, post that too.

We're looking for tutorials, walkthroughs, talks, discussion topics, personal projects, and production apps about or related to Meteor.

And don't worry, you're not required to get technical. Meteor is new, and we're learning together. 

NOTE: Include both your first and last name in your meetup profile so you can enter the building. 

6:30pm - Networking and Food/Drinks
7:00pm - Tutorial & Featured Presentations

Justin Krup – Meet[eor] Docker Deploys

Justin walks us through the process of getting a meteor app deployed on AWS using docker containers and the benefits of such a system.


Justin Krup has been using Meteor in all of his freelance/side projects for the past year and has really enjoyed it. He comes from a Ruby on Rails background. Contact him at <a>[masked]</a>. 

Anders Ramsay — Get Started with Meteor 1.3 and React

The new release of Meteor (1.3) makes significant changes from previous versions. In this session, we’ll discuss major differences compared to previous versions.  Topics covered include: 

* The new “imports” directory 

* Replacing “magic globals” with ES6 modules 

* Using npm packages in a Meteor app  Installing React and FlowRouter in Meteor 1.3

Anders Ramsay is a UX designer; developer and Agile Coach; and the organizer of the Agile Experience Design Meetup; who regularly conducts workshops on coding, UX, and Agile practices. Anders blogs about coding and about UX and Agile. Follow him on Twitter at @codechron or @andersramsay.


Faraz Fazli – mDeploy

On tax day, all access to *.meteor.com will be gone. Based on community feedback on MDG's decision, Meteor-NY member Faraz Fazli has created a solution. "Deploy Meteor applications in less than a minute onto scalable and fault tolerant infrastructure with mDeploy. We provide a cost-effective solution to meet your deployment needs."

Faraz Fazli, an  18-year-old college drop-out who has been coding since he was 11 loves Meteor, Go, and native Android application development using Java. Faraz leads the NYC Mobile App Dev meetup with over 700 members and is currently working remotely, leading the mobile team at Contap, a startup based out of Philadelphia. Reach him at <a>[masked]</a>.



8:00pm - Break


8:15pm - Lightning Talks

8:45pm - Announcements


9:00pm - Broome Street Bar

We'll head out afterwards to the Broome Street Bar at 363 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013 (between Grand & Leonard Streets).

results.description:
One of the most fun aspects of beer club is searching out different venues at which to consume terrific beers. With so many members, there's always a new place that I haven't been to that is a favorite of someone, and that is how Keith K. led several of us to One Mile House last weekend (even though I thought it was out of the way).

We were immediately welcomed by an astonishing draft list prominently posted on the wall and there were at least three beers I had never had before, and I drink a lot of beer! Additionally, when we told the manager about our group, she was enthusiastic about having us. She works on Tuesday evenings so we have scheduled something in order to be sure she's there to take care of us.

To tell you how much I wanted to go here, I will let you know I actually had to call the place, on a telephone, to set up the meetup. It was pretty awful. I mean, who uses a phone to talk to someone, am I right? 

Anyway, if you haven't been here, it's a great location, convenient to numerous subways. This should be a terrific meetup in a cool area of town. Hope to see you there!


Cheers,

Bill

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't allow latecomers to enter.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

results.description:
***Come any time between 6:30pm and 9:30pm, stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to. (Arriving at 7:30pm or 8:30pm is perfectly great.)***

Join us for dinner at Green Zenphony, a delightful and delicious 100% vegan restaurant in Rego Park, Queens which has an extensive and varied menu of creative and mouthwatering Asian dishes including appetizers, soups, entrees, desserts, and fresh juices.

The cheerful and welcoming owners, who were the proprietors of the former Green Melody in Long island and Green Symphony in Westchester, have designed Green Zenphony with peacefulness and relaxation in mind. 

Recent Yelp reviewers said "The ingredients are all fresh and the dishes are beautifully presented",  "Incredible food, large portions and quickly delivered hot. Whether you are a carnivore or a vegan or somewhere in between this place is excellent", and "What a fantastic restaurant! Today was my first time here and I LOVED it!!! I had the sesame vegan "beef" with brown rice-- a masterpiece! I wish I lived closer! Even meat lovers would appreciate this. Super friendly staff and service too!"

Other Yelp reviewers said "The mixed appetizer dish is a classic Buddhist specialty- it's big, so make sure you have someone to share it with, or bring some home." and "The 'Gourmet' menu are house specials that you will not find anywhere else."

Other Yelp reviewers stated "If you are less adventurous you can pick from the more-traditional vegetable, vegetarian "meat", tofu, or fried rice and noodle dishes."

"Other nice touches [include] complimentary kimchi". The pretty vegan desserts include cheesecake, sweet and comforting mango pudding, and generous portions of ice cream.

Let's give this terrific new-ish vegan restaurant with friendly and generous owners some great business and enjoy a wonderful, delicious meal in a relaxing atmosphere!

For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events: this is an incredibly friendly & welcoming group. It will be easy to find our group: most of the people in the restaurant will be us. (If you are unsure, just ask a waitperson.) Everyone pays for their own meal. Easy!


Train directions: Green Zenphony is easily accessible by subway. Take R or M train to 63rd Drive in Queens, exit on the South side of Queens Boulevard and walk 1  1/2  blocks on Queens Blvd to Green Zenphony. It is across the boulevard from the Rego Park Mall. Note that the F and E are express trains from Manhattan that can be taken to Roosevelt Avenue in Queens, and then change at the Roosevelt Avenue station across the platform for the local train (R or M) a few stops to 63rd Drive.

Facebook page which has a link to their menu: https://www.facebook.com/Green-Zenphony-1486055795033901/

See you at Green Zenphony!

Joyce


***Come any time between 6:30pm and 9:30pm, stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to. (Arriving at 7:30pm or 8:30pm is perfectly great.)***

2001AT50

This monumental film deserves a monumental celebration. So, we're going to start preparing now for a year-long festival happening throughout all of 2018.

There will be daily screenings, live score performances, new score commissions, readings and lectures and book clubs, Kubrick Walking tours, other programmed film series, theatrical interpretations, and anything else we want to have happen.

Let's use the boundary breaking energy of this film to launch us into the ultimate trip of creative planning, research and development. This is a festival for everyone everywhere.

This is the first of many meetings to bring this festival to life. We'll begin the discussion and planning for what we want to see happen throughout the year of 2018. We need collaborators and enthusiasts of all kinds: creative, administrative, designers, readers, thinkers, poets, artists, scientists, historians,composers, cosmologists, and....who else?

All are welcome, all ways. Hope to see you there.
2001AT50

Join us at our frequent home E's Bar NYC for a special edition of Drinking About Museums NYC! We'll meet on Tuesday April 19,[masked]:30-8:30PM.


Our special guest this time - everyone's favorite Event Organizer and Wearer of Great Bow Ties, Mr. Neal Stimler. Neal has hosted DAMs events since 2012 and was one of the early regional organizers of Drinking About Museums. Neal is happy to be passing "the next round" on to Drew Radtke, your new host and organizer.


Stop by to help us thank Neal for his work building this community, welcoming newcomers, and somehow knowing everyone's names at the drop of a hat. Neal Stimler, Digital Asset Specialist for the Metropolitan Museum of Art, is a passionate art lover, open access advocate, and tech enthusiast. You can find him on Instagram and Twitter. Connect with Neal on LinkedIn and visit his website www.nealstimler.com.

From Neal:

"My sincere gratitude to those who participated in #drinkingaboutmuseums #NYC over these last years. I cherish the friendships I have made in this amazing community. I thank our museum and venue partners, especially E's Bar, for their generosity, resources, staff and time in helping us make fantastic events. I will continue to nurture the museum and cultural communities in New York City and abroad in other capacities. Please come out and support Drew Radtke in his efforts with the group! Drew is a kind, caring and welcoming person. He has fun ideas planned for the future of group. Congratulations, Drew! You are going to do great! Heartfelt thanks." - Neal Stimler

Send any questions or concerns to Drew at [masked] or send me a message on Twitter. Or connect with me on LinkedIn.

results.description:
PLEASE MAKE SURE TO PURCHASE A TICKET THROUGH NYC UXPA WEBSITE

We are all aware that UX is a diverse field. No two UX professionals come from the same background. But how about building a successful, meaningful career? What are some ways to lead, and grow as a UX professional?

This month, we invite you to take a peek at the journeys of two UX leaders / entrepreneurs -- what were their decision processes like at some of the critical moments in their career paths? How did they develop the leadership skills they needed to be truly autonomous? How do they currently foster an entrepreneurial spirit in their staff? They will give their narratives, as well as, answering the audience's burning questions.  

Meet the Speakers:

UX Growth: Lessons From An Entrepreneur

In this talk, Mona Patel, CEO & Founder of Motivate Design, will inspire you to build a stronger connection between your management skills and your user experience know-how. Through lessons learned as an entrepreneur building a UX research, design, and staffing shop, as well as, lessons from her time out in the field, Mona will highlight what she's seen as the catalyst for success amongst teams.


Leading By Design

John Payne is Managing Director at Moment, a digital strategy and design consultancy he co-founded in 2002. With over twenty-five years of experience as a design consultant and educator, he brings deep expertise in design methodologies and user-centered innovation techniques to Moment clients like Bloomberg, ESPN, Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, The Weather Channel and American Express. In 2017, John will co-chair Interaction 17, IxDA’s 10th annual global design conference.

Agenda:

6:30-6:55PM  Networking & Refreshments

6:55-7:00PM  Opening Announcements

7:00-8:00PM  Presentations and Q&A

8:00-8:45PM  More Networking & Refreshments
results.name: Suggested Event: Journey Into UX
