results.description:
Dear Dharma Drink Friends,

Our next topic will be on the Four Noble Truths.  Anybody who's studied a little about Buddhism knows about the Four Nobel Truths.  Here is the oversimplified one-liner: suffering, desires, cessation of desires, and the way to cessation or Eightfold Path / Middle way.

Many have interpreted the First Noble Truth as all life is suffering or "dukkha."  Here is where many misconceptions of Buddhism arises.  The word "suffering" is not a complete translation.  Other meanings of include, impermanence, imperfections, insubstantiality, emptiness.  There is no exact translation.  In fact, in Buddhism, dukkha also contains the various types of happiness.  

Join us for another fun workshop taught by Venerable Guo Xing.  This topic is also another major section of the Heart Sutra.  While the sutra is one of the shortest and best known, the concepts are deep and that often requires many (and more) sessions to understand.  If you are interested in this type of studies or have some background, this would be a beneficial workshop for you.  It may not be for everyone.

There is no cost to this workshop.  If you want to donate you can donate to your charity of choice or Venerable GuoXing's center.


------------

Venerable Guo Xing will be doing a teaching-workshop where we can discuss and exchange ideas.  


Many of you have come to dinner and have met Venerable Guo Xing.  So you know that this will be a rare opportunity to learn from him in this setting.

Venerable Guo Xing is the current Abbot of Chan Meditation Center in Queens NY and Dharma Drum Retreat Center in Upstate NY, part of Dharma Drum Mountain, an international Buddhist organization based in Taiwan. Venerable was ordained under Late Chan Master Shen Yen in 1986 and assisted the Master between 1987 and 2007 in leading meditation retreats in Taiwan, Southeast Asia, and the United States, totaling more than 50 retreats, including the first 49 day retreat at DDRC in 2000.  Venerable is one of Chan Master Sheng Yen’s Dharma heirs.


_/|\_

Eddie

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your NEW YEAR with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
As usual, members of FUSP and other community members are invited to attend without RSVP'ing through meetup.  Some snacks will be provided. Feel free to bring something to share.

One of the most crucial and polarizing issues of this election season is immigration and the relationship of recent immigrants to the rest of the US economy.  This touching and well-received Emmy award winning documentary (70 minutes) touches on both. Filmmaker: Almudena Carracedo

Setup and snacks: 7:00

Film screening 7:15 - 8:30

Discussion: 8:30 - 9:00

Summary: Maria Pineda, Maura Colorado, and Guadalupe "Lupe" Hernandez are three immigrants from Mexico who work in a California factory that makes discount fashion garments; their employers frequently ignore both the letter and the spirit of protective labor regulations, subjecting their workers to 14-hour work days, paying well below minimum wage, and maintaining a workplace that is both dirty and dangerous. Pineda, Colorado, and Hernandez wanted to see that their bosses treat them and their fellow workers with the respect they deserve, and with the help of the activists at the Garment Workers Center, they volunteered to join a campaign to bring legal action against the owners of American sweatshops, as well as encourage protests and boycotts against retailers who carry merchandise manufactured by offending companies. The campaign to bring safety and security back to the American clothing business leads these three women on a journey of self-respect and self-discovery that takes them to New York City for the first time.

results.description:
Paul Ross will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment by Trio Elegante!

Trio Elegante are Robin Russell, Julia Hartman, and John Austin.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance!

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up.

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on 72nd transverse at the point that overlooks Bethesda Fountain
results.name: Central Park Training Run

results.description:
Thanks to all who could make last night's talk - Let Him Lead the Way. During our talk and reading, we touched on Responsibility, which will be our next topic. 

Please RSVP before Tuesday, 4/19 to attend our next meeting.


Responsibility (as the world defines it) is usually linked to guilt and shame, but the Course teaches us to be both responsible and forgiving of ourselves if we seem to make apparent mistakes.

From Chapter 21 

This is the only thing that you need do for vision, happiness, release from pain and the complete escape from sin, all to be given you.

Say only this, but mean it with no reservations, 
for here the power of salvation lies:

I am responsible for what I see. 
I choose the feelings I experience, 
and I decide upon the goal I would achieve. 
And everything that seems to happen to me 
I ask for, 
and receive as I have asked.

This may be very difficult for the ego mind to accept, but the sooner we learn of our responsibility, the sooner we learn to choose peace regardless of the circumstances we find ourselves in.

We hope you'll join us this coming Tuesday at 7pm.
results.name: ACIM - Responsibility

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds/credit: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund, please provide the Paypal Transaction ID: 18D76937M[masked]R No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W 77th street): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors, check for pictures. the door is closed but unlocked, report to our security and go to the second floor.

results.description:
Come join us for an Introductory class on variables, functions, and control structures! We'll be hosting it at 7pm on Tuesday, April 19th, at C4Q HQ. This event is limited to the first 40 guests who RSVP.


Requirements: No previous programming experience required, must have a Mac or PC. 

Prior to attending the workshop, please download and install Chrome and Sublime Text. Click on the links below and follow instructions.

1. Chrome: https://www.google.com/chrome/browser/desktop/index.html
2. Sublime Text: https://www.sublimetext.com/ followed by clicking on the Download button in the top menu. 

Chrome is a browser made by Google that has good developer tools which will help us see what's going on as we code, and to see where we have errors. Sublime Text is a text editor. Text editors are like word processors but are dedicated to coding, and so help by using a fixed-width font, coloring the text in a way to make it easier to read (syntax highlighting) and by removing all unnecessary formatting tools.

If any of the terms (such as browser, text editor, fixed-width font, or syntax highlighting) in these descriptions are unfamiliar it would be good to google them. It's not required knowledge but would be less to think about during the lesson.
results.name: Intro to Programming in JavaScript

Snag your very own hero at this singles Meetup which gathers the city's hottest FIREMEN & EMT at one of NYC's hottest places!  Our last mixer had 100+ attend!  

*MUST GET TICKET IN ADVANCE HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/fireman/dates/Apr-19-2016_at_0700PM

*Prepay Only Event. NO Tickets Sold At Door.

This event is open to WOMEN of ALL professions.   

But only open to men from legitimate Fire or EMS service including: FDNY, NYC 911 Voluntary Hospital, any Area Municipal, Private or Volunteer Organization.  

All MEN MUST show your agencies photo ID Card indicating title of "Firefighter," "EMT," or "Paramedic" at the door to be admitted (no exceptions). 

Everyone must purchase a ticket in advance to attend.

Prepay Only Event. First 5 group members save $5 by using code "HOT" at checkout ($20). 

Get tickets at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/fireman/dates/Apr-19-2016_at_0700PM

What to expect:

• Complimentary Appetizers (7-8pm) 

• Drink Specials 

• Fireman Trivia Ice breaker For Prizes 

• Hottest Fireman/EMS Provider contest

​•  DJ Spins Great Music At Conversational Level

MUST GET TICKET IN ADVANCE HERE (No Tix Sold At Door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/fireman/dates/Apr-19-2016_at_0700PM

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event is not age or ethnic specific. We will have a wide mix of ages (21-50s). 

How many members will attend? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  Based on RSVPs from other groups and pre-payments, we will have 100+ attending.
results.name: Fireman/EMT Singles Mixer. Snag Yourself A Hero. (Prepay Only)

results.description:
Welcome to the Hebrew Language April 2016 Meetup.  Hag Pesah Sameya!

Shalom, this meetup is open to all levels of Hebrew speakers, tzabars, and students of the language.  

Bvakasha (please) take advantage of this opportunity to converse in Hebrew of any level.

The venue is a vegetarian (plus fish, eggs) kosher diner. Its menu includes Western and Israeli choices.

The $1 meetup fee will continue to be waived to all who RSVP.
results.name: The New York City Hebrew Language Meetup Group April Meetup

group.name: The New York City Hebrew Language Meetup Group

results.description:
A brilliant website means little if no one can find it. Your customers are going to want users and customers of their own, so what should we integrate with our sites to give buyers the tools that they need for a successful marketing initiative? From increasing traffic to tracking growth, actions, and conversions, there are a number of plugins that are essential to website marketing.

Join us as we explore WordPress plugins for SEO, Google Analytics, and eCommerce and how these plugins can help users of your theme - or your own website - generate more traffic and sales.

PRESENTED BY: David Veldt

OPENING PRESENTATION: Using your Voice to Promote Your Brand

With the current hype around podcasting and audio, many people want in on the action. Oliver will go over a few different options that are out there to promote your brand and connect with your audience, just by using your voice (no camera needed!)

PRESENTED BY: Oliver Wellington

ABOUT THE PRESENTERS:

David Veldt is the founder of Interactually, a digital marketing and media company based out of Grand Rapids, Michigan. Interactually's core services are search engine optimization (SEO), pay per click advertising (PPC), and analytics management. David has worked with companies ranging from national, global and Fortune 500 brands to local businesses and non-profits.


Oliver Wellington was a co-founder of nRelate, a content recommendation company that had its core user base in the WordPress community. He is currently building a voice communications company called SpareMin, with his old team.
results.name: Essential Website Marketing Using WordPress Plugins

results.description:
Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, use our tools, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. Visitors are strongly encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.


If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least thrice before applying.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.
results.how_to_find_us: We’re on the second floor of the building in the far end
results.name: Tech Tuesday Open House at Hack Manhattan

results.description:
Newcomers are always welcome! We will continue the class and what we started, learning new songs on the spot, getting some pointers on style, musicianship, and the voice itself. 

I'll bring music for everyone and you can get in a lot of singing while you help or be helped by the person next to you. There will be some exercises as well and we may do a bit of harmony. 

Bring your $8 and your good spirits. I look forward to seeing you all. Michael
results.how_to_find_us: Please check the electronic board on floor 16.
results.name: Singing, Sightreading, & Performing Tips -- third class

results.description:
The Church has scheduled  a meeting for Monday 18 April to discuss Port Authority construction that could affect the church building.  We will meet on Tuesday evening, 19 April, this week.

A warm welcome to Scottish country dancing! Come and enjoy the fun! Everyone is welcome! (Please remember to bring soft-soled shoes.) We will be providing instruction starting with the basics. Then we'll have a break followed by one more dance for everyone. After that the instruction will be geared to experienced country dancers!
results.how_to_find_us: Ring the bell!
results.name: DATE CHANGE -- ONE TIME ONLY --Join us for enjoyable Scottish country dancing

results.description:
For our April 2016 Forum we are thrilled to welcome Emmy-nominated creative leader Ben Hughes, the Executive Creative Director of Stinkdigital New York.

Ben Hughes is an Emmy-nominated creative leader who has been lucky to work with some of the world’s top advertising agencies, digital studios and brands. With experience at Wieden+Kennedy, Mother, B-Reel, R/GA and 72andSunny, he has built a body of work that stretches from conceptually-led film storytelling to digital products and experiences. His clients include MTV, Google, Facebook, Twitter, Jeep, Delta Air Lines, Cole Haan, Target and Esquire.

In addition to his projects as a creative director, Ben is an accomplished filmmaker and photographer. His work is included in the permanent collection at the Museum of Modern Art in New York.
results.name: Ben Hughes / Stinkdigital

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

See the Highline in a totally different way with the spring cutback which exposes a lot of what is covered during the summer also if it is a clear night you can peer through the telescopes of the Amateur Astronomers Association and see the stars and planets! 

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day! 

The Highline is New York’s most popular attraction! The Highline is an elevated freight train trestle that operated in NYC from the 1930’s to the 1980’s. After years of neglect The Friends of The Highline have saved the structure and transformed it into a beautiful park featuring many of the elements from its’ rich history! Your tour guide will share the history of the highline and the surrounding neighborhoods and show you amazing photo’s from before the trestle was built, while it was in operation and what it looked like while abandoned.

Join us for a fun evening of socializing and learning.  Following the tour, the group will go out for food and drinks. $15 includes the tour only. 

(PLEASE PAY THE $15 WHEN YOU ARRIVE & BE SURE TO BRING EXACT CHANGE)

What to Wear: Dress casual/business casual. Wear comfortable shoes

What to Bring: A camera, a bottle of water for the walk and your sense of adventure!

What to Expect: 10-20 fun and friendly people who are looking to make new friends and learn a little about the city.

The group will meet at The Death Avenue Cafe at[masked]th avenue at 28th street between 6:30pm-7pm.  Come closer to 6:30 if you want food or drink.  We will end at Gansevoort Street.
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorkers: Highline Sunset and Stargazing History Tour/Happy Hour

group.name: 365+ Cool Things To Do With Fun People In New York

Your tour guide will share the history of the highline and the surrounding neighborhoods and show you amazing photo’s from before the trestle was built, while it was in operation and what it looked like while abandoned.

Join us for a fun evening of socializing and learning.  Following the tour, the group will go out for food and drinks. $15 includes the tour only. 

(PLEASE PAY THE $15 WHEN YOU ARRIVE & BE SURE TO BRING EXACT CHANGE)

What to Wear: Dress casual/business casual. Wear comfortable shoes

What to Bring: A camera, a bottle of water for the walk and your sense of adventure!

What to Expect: 10-20 fun and friendly people who are looking to make new friends and learn a little about the city.

The group will meet at The Death Avenue Cafe at[masked]th avenue at 28th street between 6:30pm-7pm.  Come closer to 6:30 if you want food or drink.  We will end at Gansevoort Street.
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorkers: Highline Sunset and Stargazing History Tour/Happy Hour

Meetup.com/JoinTheClubNYC

Class Part 1: 7pm-8pm

-Common American English Idioms, Idiomatic Phrases, Puns, Clichés, and other Figures of Speech!
-Pronunciation practice
-Group discussion

Class Part 2: 8pm-10pm
Open conversation practice with other students & Native English speakers

It is $10 to attend the class. There are only 8 spots, so please be serious about attending if you sign up. You will be removed from this group if you signed up for event and fail to attend

Bring a notebook, questions & a pen!

Also, please purchase food or drink at this establishment when you arrive!

results.description:
NYC is full of people looking for something different that challenges them. We don't want to live on a daily routine until we get old. 

This meet up is for those who are in the process of changing their mindset from an employee to an entrepreneur. We will educate ourselves with books by Robert Kiyosaki, John Maxwell , Eric Worre , Napoleon Hill, Randy Gage, etc. I will provide weekly trainings and challenges in the business world. 

Network and meet others who want to apply new ideas to their life. 

You can reach me at:

[masked]

[masked]

We'll have our own outdoor private zen garden.  :)

Tuesday, April 19th   
@Sushi Para 88
212 W 14th St
New York, NY 10011 between 7th Ave & Avenue Of The Americas 
West Village

** To minimize wait time, we invite you to print out the menu here, check off what you want to order and bring it with you to the restaurant.

Here is the menu http://www.nypt.info/springforwardparty2016 ;

</a><a href="http://www.sushipara88.com/index.html">http://www.sushipara88.com/index.html for directions

We will also have a special guest comedienne for part of the evening. :)

Bring your business cards!  Get ready to connect with like minded people.

Be prepared to add value!  

Recapture that energy and passion for life!

Looking forward to seeing everyone then!


1-2-3 You Rock!

All the best, 

Frank Clark

Joseph Varghese

results.name: NYPT April 19th Networking Party - Dinner!

results.description: If you subscribe to the Caledonia mailing list you probably saw an email about this event.  However, the event was a paid event, boo!  I was talking with Trevor last night and he said Deanston paid for the event so now it's complimentary, yay!  I know this is short notice but I can't pass up free scotch.  Deanston is a highland scotch so fans of non-peated malts will be happy.  Since these are less aggressive scotches, this will be an excellent introduction to scotch for newbies!  We will be tasting 4 of their expressions, definitely the 12yr, virgin oak, and 2 others.  I will get there early, around 6:30-7 but the tasting starts at 8 so you have plenty of time to meander up to the UES.  The 86th St. 4,5,6 stop is really the only subway stop nearby.  Walk east to 2nd ave and down to 83rd St.
results.name: Deanston Tasting

results.description:
Great work being done!  Really wonderful to see member's getting creative with their own web-series, one-acts and short film scripts... and other members raising up to play those roles! 

Bring your monologues, your scenes for auditions, or come ready for cold/warm reads on some of the scenes were casting!  There is no cost and all we do is split the studio rental fee ($5 each) and then get supportive and incisive feedback on the performances.  

We had a great turnout and some incredible people coming out for the first time!   Looking forward to more great sessions to come!


PS... Please let us know if we can help you find material or scenes to prep for the gym. Though preparation is not required and everyone is more than welcome to jump in on a cold read, being familiar or off book with a script can really allow you to challenge yourself and get more out of the gym and your acting. Also, feel free to use the messaging system on our Meetup page to find scene partners or share material with those who have RSVPed to a session.

PPS. We also have a piano for use in Musical Theatre type projects :)

Thanks Everyone and see you soon!
results.name: April Showers Bring Actors to the Gym 3!

results.description:
Are your dreams just out of reach? Does something always seem to interfere with achieving your dreams? Do you feel your dreams are not in your control? Perhaps you desire to find your soulmate or regain health or start a business?  You can manifest anything you want. The only thing standing in the way of your dreams is you. We can support you on the path of rediscovery and clarity.

 
During this workshop, in collaboration with Transformational Coach Hope McGrath, we will first discuss the planning process of our dreams - “The Dream Plan” . 

We love Free Raffles!  Will you be the lucky winner  of a Biofeedback demo session or the winner of a Spark Transformational Coaching session?  But even if you are not, everybody walks away with the benefits received from the hypnosis and guided meditation as well as a packet of great take-home information. 

What changes do we need to make to fulfill the Dream Plan? Let’s look at the options and methods to make those physical, financial or behavioral changes. Here you will get a taste of the power of manifestation and gain insights on transformational healing modalities such hypnosis, biofeedback and powerful guided meditations and coaching. The result is the Dream Plan blueprint. 


Now that we have a Dream Plan blueprint, how do we make this a reality? Learn a variety of methods to enhance your life force understanding the energy body as a doorway to your Dreams.


Live Life Empowered!
results.how_to_find_us: between 7th and 8th Avenues
results.name: MANIFEST YOUR DREAM PLAN

results.description:
Your chance to learn how to Dance Tango is FINALLY here! (And to have Fun & make friends!) 

Bring your partner or just come by yourself.

This is an introductory Tango course to learn the basics so you get a good taste of it. Come with good energy to Have Fun & Make Friends!

When: TUESDAYS

Time: 7:00 to 8:00 pm (60 minutes class). Then, we go out for drinks!

Location: Adelante Studios: 25 W 31st street, New York, NY  (Lots of trains, even the Path)

Price for the course: $22 online OR $25 at the door (per hour, per person).

Write me if you have questions.

Best,

Laura :-D

-------------------------------------

Where Are The Classes Taught?

Adelante Studios: 

25 W 31st street
New York, NY 10001
(Lots of trains, even the Path). 2nd Floor, studio 1.


How Do I Get There?

Lots of trains and buses near by. Even the PATH if you live in NJ. 

What Should I Wear?

Wear comfortable clothing (except pajamas :-D). Women can bring something sexy if they wish and shoes that slide easily with a closed heel like strap or full heel (no sandals neither flip-flops type)

Men need also shoes that slide easily. You should not wear any shoes with rubber soles. Almost anything but sneakers.


HOPE YOU CAN JOIN US! 
Cheers,

Laura


. 
PS1: Get a gift certificate for your brother, sister or friend. They will enjoy it! 
PS2: Eighty percent of success is showing up. (Woody Allen)

You agree that neither you nor any third party will hold the group, any of the group's leaders, representatives, instructors, or sponsors liable for any injury, loss, or damage to your own person or any members of your family, friends, acquaintances, pets, or property, arising directly from or as a consequence of any group activity.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles
results.how_to_find_us: CRS is located one block east of Broadway and one and a half blocks south of Union Square, above Think Coffee shop.
results.name: Walk-In Spiritual Healing Clinic

results.description:
Tuesday, April 19, 2016 — Ramsey, New Jersey

7 to 9 pm 
New Jersey Raw Food Support Network
42 New England Drive
Ramsey, NJ 07446
Tel:[masked]

 Talk by Ken Rohla of <a>www.FreshandAlive.com:</a> 

"How to Reverse GMOs and Grow Your Own Nutrient-Dense Superfoods for Pennies"


$15 advance registration required. Go to this link:


http://events.freshandalive.com

Are you concerned about the health effects and environmental consequences of genetically modified plants, animals, and microbes? Do you think eating organic, vegan, or raw/living food is all you need in your diet to stay healthy? Even most organic food is sadly lacking in nutrients these days, and most raw food supplements and "superfoods" contain mold and often do not even contain what is listed on their labels. But all is NOT lost! There are ways to revert GMO DNA in plants and animals back to the original non-GMO forms, and heal GMO damage in the body. Ken Rohla will show you how to test your own food in your own kitchen to see for yourself what you are actually eating, or rather, what you're not! But what can you do about nutrient depleted organic food that comprises the majority of what's available to us? No matter how limited your space, time, or money, Ken will show you specifically how you can grow, ferment, sprout, and create your own superfoods, supplements, and medicines beyond organic, beyond biodynamic, for massive nutrition and healing power. Ken will reveal ancient secrets and modern discoveries for creating superfoods and supplements with high amounts of extremely regenerative ORMUS minerals, and imbue them with very healing subtle scalar and other energies. Ken will also tell you how to use the same techniques to make your own kombucha (healing tea), pet supplements, plant food, plant growth accelerator, compost accelerator, nontoxic household cleaner, odor eliminator, mold and mildew remover, and more. Bring paper and writing instrument, Ken always gives out a lot of very specific useful info!


Go to this link:    http://events.freshandalive.com
results.name: Reverse GMOs & Grow Your Own Nutrient-Dense Superfoods for Pennies withKen Rohla

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Our next Meetup will take place at:

The Mirage Diner on Tuesday, April 19, 2016 @ 7 PM.

717 Kings Highway, on the corner of E. 8th Street

Take the F train to Kings Highway and McDonald Avenue, where you can connect to the B82 bus towards Pennsylvania Ave., or the B or Q trains to Kings Highway and E. 16th Street, where you can connect to the B82 bus towards Cropsey Ave. For those who are driving, a parking lot is available at the diner.

The only requirement is that you order a minimum of $6.00 worth of food and/or drink during our Meetup.

We will be meeting in the back room. Please ask for Michele or Joe when you arrive. There is a wheelchair accessible ramp, if anyone has difficulty climbing steps and there's a wheelchair accessible bathroom as well. If you use the ramp, you will be entering into the back room.

Thank you for joining the group. Make it a great night playing Scrabble! Enjoy!

All the best,

Michele

results.description:
WHAT IS HRCS (HUDSON RIVER COMMUNITY SAILING)?

We're a 501(c)3 nonprofit community sailing center.  We offer a year round afterschool program,  dozens of youth internship positions.  We also have an adult sailing club membership and offer public lessons.

HOW DO I SIGN UP?

Use this link:

https://hudsonsailing.org/registrations/?epl_action=process_cart_action&cart_action=add&event_id=33925&_rand=56c784898a5ce&_date_id=5qQASw&_time_id=dee082

WHO'S THIS FOR?

This event is a workshop for the HRCS membership which are sometimes opened to the public.  There is no fee.

WHAT'LL HAPPEN?

Workshops are usually in the Classroom at the Boathouse.  If they're not, you'll be directed elsewhere (there are only 3 rooms).  

Learn about the elements of sailboat racing: the art of the start, rules, tactics in close-quarters.   This workshop will include visual presentation of common racing situations and be taught be Don.   This is a great chance to get into racing, meet other crew and racing captains.  The situations will generally be specific to sailing aboard our J24 sailboats in NY Harbor. 

WHO'S LEADING THE EVENT?

Don Rotzien, our racing director and jack of all trades.
results.name: Racing Intro & Rules of the Road Workshop

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Hayes Law Firm & Big Apple Py

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

results.description:
In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the nuance and richness of connection, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness. You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, authentic relationships Ive seen become possible for them.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more I've seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, and grow in their natural presence and love for others.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! The cost is $25 for one session or a bundle of 4 sessions for $80 that includes a one on one Circling conversation with the facilitator.

To ensure a full experience for everyone, the meetup will start promptly at 7:00. Please arrive no later then 6:55 to set up and be ready to begin.
results.name: Tuesday Night Circling: Creating Love and Connection

results.description:
TAKE YOUR DIDGERIDOO PLAYING TO THE NEXT LEVEL

TUESDAYS, APRIL 19 – JUNE 14, 2016, 7-8:30PM EST

LIVE IN GREENPOINT, BROOKLYN AND WORLDWIDE VIA VIDEO STREAM

PROGRAM INCLUDES:

SIX IN-PERSON DIDGERIDOO CLASSES WITH DIDGE PROJECT DIRECTOR AJ BLOCKVIDEOS OF EACH CLASS, YOURS TO KEEP FOREVERTHE DIDGERIDOO SKILLS COURSE HANDBOOK (NOT AVAILABLE ELSEWHERE)BONUS: INSTANT ACCESS TO WORLD RHYTHMS FOR DIDGERIDOO, OUR 45-MINUTE ONLINE COURSE

WELCOME TO THE DIDGERIDOO SKILLS COURSE, A PROGRAM SPECIALLY DESIGNED TO HELP YOU DEVELOP A HIGH LEVEL OF MUSICIANSHIP AS A DIDGERIDOO PLAYER.

With a special focus on world rhythms, breathing patterns, expanding your palette of sounds and finding relaxation while you play, this course is guaranteed to make you shine as a didgeridoo player. After you learn the skills given in this class you will never again be at a loss for what to practice on didgeridoo. This program is led by AJ Block, co-founder and director of Didge Project.

This course is for you if you already play didgeridoo and are looking to take your playing to the next level. Topics include rhythmic playing, intonation, syncopation, playing with other musicians and writing and performing original compositions.

HEAR WHAT OUR CLIENTS SAY :

I have taken two group courses with Didge Project, and both of them were fantastic, inspiring and uplifting. AJ and the Didge Project team are wonderful teachers, great people to be around, and their teaching style is very diverse. The didgeridoo is the first instrument I really enjoy playing because it is so profoundly basic and yet engages you physically and spiritually in complex and fascinating ways. I was actually surprised how quickly I could learn to make sounds and rhythms. The classes are clearly structured and methodical, lots of hands-on practice and personal guidance. I am now playing didge in yoga classes and people absolutely love the experience of its healing earth vibrations. I highly recommend any group classes or private sessions with Didge Project, please check it out and embark on a journey into peaceful sound!
– Nora Heilmann, Jivamukti Yoga teacher NYC

I’m into healthy lifestyle. I like to meditate and do other practices to help my health. That’s why playing the didgeridoo for sleep apnea is a wonderful thing for a person like me. It incorporates my interest in musicianship and world cultures.  I thought it was going to be difficult but it really isn’t… I would really encourage you. It can change your life.
– Cathy, Actress, Singer and Artist

In addition to the benefits of learning the didgeridoo, members of our programs typically experience a positive, ripple effect of enjoying an increased abundance of confidence, self-esteem, self-worth and greater joy. The Didgeridoo Skills Course is more than just a “program,” it’s a way of believing in yourself that benefits you in many ways and is designed to help you:

* Strengthen your rhythmic abilities
* Play with other musicians
* Refining the quality of your sound
* Integrate vocal technique into your playing
* Learn to play longer on the didgeridoo
* Breathe deeper
* Expand your lung capacity
* Reduce and eliminate symptoms of sleep apnea, snoring and other respiratory conditions
* Channel stress into a positive outlet
* Explore meditation through sound

The Didgeridoo Skills Course includes:

Six in-person didgeridoo classes with members of Didge Project

Each class blends in-depth training, exercises, practice regiments and multifarious approaches to get to the goals of didgeridoo playing including: circular breathing, playing with a beautiful tone, and rhythmic playing. This new and exciting format is designed to help you understand at a deep level how to move your playing forward by quantum leaps instead of by incremental steps. Expect to be challenged and supported as we guide you to create a plan of action for your development as a didgeridoo player.

Video Summaries of Each Class

Each class comes with a 10-15 minute summary video covering all techniques learned. You will have access to each video immediately after each class, allowing you to review the material with visual reference indefinitely.

The Didgeridoo Skills Course Handbook (not available elsewhere)

You will never be at a loss for what to practice because all exercises will be provided for you in both written and video format. You will be given the exact steps to take in order to master the technical side of didgeridoo playing.

BONUS: Instant access to World Rhythms for Didgeridoo

World Rhythms for Didgeridoo is a 45-minute online course that will show you exactly what it takes to develop a wide palate of musical rhythms on your instrument. Drawing on music from Africa, Cuba, Brazil and the Middle-East this class will get you connecting to your inner pulse and learning the key rhythmic elements syncopation and subdivision. Through a combination of video, audio and PDF worksheets you will be guided through a number of approaches to enhance your didgeridoo playing.

Location:

Our in-person class location is The Ark, a beautiful loft space in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. Address, 107 Green St. #G55, Brooklyn, NY 11222

Online Participants:

Attend live via video chat or watch the full class video anytime at your own convenience. The class videos are yours to keep forever.

Dates:

We are confirmed for the following dates (all Tuesdays, 7-8:30pm EST): April 19, May 3, May 10, May 17, June 7, June 14.

FAQ:

What if I miss a class?

Each class is recorded in full so you will have access to the full length video, yours to keep indefinitely.

How Does Livestreaming Work?

Online Participants will connect to our livestream video and will be able to follow along in real time. Additionally, all classes will be recorded so you can take each class on your own schedule.

Program Cost: $180

Nowhere else will you get this much value for your money: Six live classes, video recordings, and course book, all with an experienced teacher who has worked with hundreds of didgeridoo players!

Register now at http://didgeproject.com/skillscourse/

Tiffany

results.description:
• 7:00pm - 8:00pm - Networking

• 8:00pm - 9:00pm - Dynamic On-Location Portraits with Neil van Niekerk

-----------------------------

Ashland welcomes guest speaker, Neil van Niekerk to this month's meetup. Neil will be discussing lighting and posing for on location portraits.

When shooting on location, we don’t always have the luxury of ideal settings and conditions. So we have to make it work!

Learn some practical steps to develop and achieve consistency with your on-location portrait photography. Neil will discuss real-world practical building blocks you can use to help you when challenged by tough lighting scenarios. Refine your technique and also define your own style in portrait photography. No vague feel-good fluff here, but actual info you can use!

By looking at the thought-process in how we set up an on-location shoot, we’ll look at posing and specifically the lighting (whether available light is enough or additional lighting is needed). We will look at all the factors that have to come together for a successful portrait and a consistent style.

-----------------------------

ABOUT NEIL:
Neil van Niekerk is a photographer based in northern NJ, specializing in portrait and wedding photography.

"I’m originally from South Africa where I worked as a TV Broadcast Engineer. Then in 2000, my wife and I decided to settle in the USA with our daughter – and I have pursued photography here as a full time career since. In addition to working with my clients, I have written five books on photography, two of which have been translated into other languages. I also maintain a popular website for photographers and I teach workshops on photography. I really love what I do! I get real pleasure from sharing the happiness with the people that I photograph, and knowing that I’m creating images that will evoke wonderful memories for a lifetime."

Neil has also presented workshops on lighting, in the USA and the UK and Ireland. In addition to that, Neil has written several books on lighting and flash photography. He also maintains a website for photographers, Tangents, which is loaded with tutorials. His wedding photography can be seen on his blog: One Perfect Moment.
results.how_to_find_us: When you enter the complex we are located in the building on the right.  Frosted glass door says "Ashland". Parking is available along the center street.
results.name: Networking and FREE Class with Neil van Niekerk - Dynamic On-Location Portraits

results.description:
This month we'll feature the following presentations:


Bruce Mittelman will give a demonstration of the ColorMunki Smile, color calibration system for monitors and iOS devices.

Bob Helmond will give an overview of the Silver Efex Pro. Part of the Nik Collection from Google, Silver Efex Pro provides all the features and options necessary for producing creative black-and-white interpretations of your photos.

Catherine Mascis will give a rundown of several useful websites for writers.

George Ajjan will give another installment of "Three Things To Know On Your Mac " in which he'll show interesting tips and tricks that anyone can use to improve their Macintosh workflows. This month will focus on 3 useful Macintosh functions.

Louis Perez will give another installment of his popular "Magical Mystery Tour of the Web", which showcases a collection of interesting websites on a given topic. This month's tour will focus on "Cool Tech" - new gadgets for the home, office, etc. including must haves.

Plus we'll discuss all of the latest Apple news and have our "Question & Answer" session where our experts will try to solve your problems.

As always, a meeting you won't want to miss! Hope to see you all there!


About NJMUG: 
The New Jersey Macintosh Users Group (NJMUG) is open to all persons, whether they are a current or future Macintosh user. An individual membership in NJMUG costs $30.00 per year. If you are thinking of becoming an NJMUG member but would like to check the group out first, we allow non-members to attend two meetings as a "guest". Once you become a member of NJMUG you are entitled to attend all monthly meetings as well as gain access to all of the member benefits including member discounts on hardware and software, free USB flash drive, monthly distribution files, and eligibility in all raffles and member giveaways.  Check www.njmug.org for more information.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the meeting room at the back of the library.
results.name: ColorMunki Smile - Silver Efex Pro - Writers Websites - Cool Tech

results.description:
IMPORTANT: RSVP ON EVENTBRITE AS WELL https://www.eventbrite.com/e/evolution-consciousness-and-the-possibility-of-higher-purpose-tickets-24519372102

Scientific and technological progress have transformed the intellectual landscape, changing the way we understand the universe and our place in it. How—if at all—can spiritual thought adapt to this new and challenging context?


In this five-part series, Robert Wright outlines a new spiritual world view that is not just compatible with modern science but deeply informed by it—and by developments in technology and social science as well. He also explains why a “new agnosticism” is taking shape—an agnosticism open-minded enough to accommodate a flourishing of different “spiritual but not religious” worldviews.
results.name: Evolution, Consciousness, and the Possibility of Higher Purpose

results.description:
Talk by Julian Togelius

NYU's Associate Professor Julian Togelius works at the intersection of artificial intelligence (AI) and games—a largely unexplored juncture that he has shown can be the site of visionary and mind-expanding research. Could games provide a better AI test bed than robots, which—despite the way they excite public imagination—can be slow, unwieldy and expensive? According to him, the answer is resoundingly yes.  Could an artificially intelligent operating system exhibit more originality than a human game designer? Togelius thinks so. "I'm teaching computers to be more creative than humans," he says.

More info - http://engineering.nyu.edu/news/2016/03/10/teaching-computers-be-more-creative-humans

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.

results.description:
The NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group Is Accepting New Members

The NYC Atheists’ Advanced Writers Group, now going for four years, is open to talented writers who want the support and camaraderie of other secular writers in polishing their work and getting happily published. Our group meets once a month; we gently critique each other’s work, but our main focus is on helping each other get published. There is no charge for this workshop; we ask only that you commit to meeting once a month, reading the work of the other members and offering your suggestions for improvement in an upbeat, encouraging manner.

What do we mean by “advanced writers?”

We mean those writers who are close to being published or have already been published in some form. We also mean writers who, we can see by reading samples of their writing, have great potential but until now have not been mentored or encouraged to treat their work seriously or to aim for publication.

How do you know if you fit our criteria for a writer with promise?

You don’t. Writers are often poor judges of the level of their talent. We suggest that you give us the opportunity to judge that, because we can often sense that spark of talent even if you yourself do not. Additionally, we have recently instituted a new member category, dubbed “Apprentice author”--individuals who demonstrate potential but who have not yet been published anywhere or achieved commercial capability.

Submit a Sample

If you are interested in joining this kind of a close and involved group of writers, submit a sample of your writing (15 pages or less) to the group,plus a personal letter telling us a little about your background, what you are aiming for and what you think we can do for you. Your sample submission may be a play, fiction or non-fiction. If fiction, it can be a short story or a chapter of a book. If non-fiction, the sample can be an article or a chapter of a non-fiction book. If a play, send only Act One.

If you are accepted into the group, we ask only that you encourage and support each group member by reading his or her material, critiquing it in a kindly, professional manner and attend our monthly meeting to discuss it in a group setting. There is no charge whatsoever for membership in the Advanced Writers Group. Our goal is to encourage more good secular writers to enter the literary marketplace.

Bear in mind that once you are accepted, everyone in the group accepts that you are headed for publication; this is not a “learn to write” group. This is a group whose members have shown themselves to have solid skills and need only minimum critiquing or, more importantly, encouragement in tackling the publishing industry, which, when done alone, can be discouraging. We are there as friends, as your cheerleaders, your mentors, your colleagues.

Jane Everhart, Facilitator NYCA Advanced Writers Group

NYC ATHEISTS CONTACT: [masked]

TO APPLY, PLEASE SEND A SAMPLE OF YOUR WRITING (15 pages or less) plus a brief bio and a letter telling us what you think we can do for you, to:

NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group c/o NYC Atheists Inc. Box 6060 NY, NY[masked]
results.name: The NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group Is Accepting New Members

results.description:
Dear members,


Please join us to either work on some civic tech projects, learn new tech skills, share and showcase some of your amazing civic tech projects, or simply to be connected to others in the technology/government/education industries. 

Please RSVP to our Meetup if you plan on attending.


We have a Code for JC Meetup every other Tuesday evening 7:30pm at the new Boys & Girls Club, 18 Park Avenue

Please join our Slack communication tool to chat with our network here.

7:30p 

Welcome & Introductions

About CJC (overview presentation) 2016 plan (high level) 

8:00p

Speaker: Nick Milak of the following initiatives..

City of Trees:

In partnership with The City of Jersey City, the JCPC launched City of Trees, a citywide commitment to plant more than 2,020 new trees in parks, streets, and public spaces. Beginning October 2016 and continuing through 2020, this program will serve to replenish a staggering tree canopy deficit in Jersey City. Complementing the tree planting will be the JC Tree Lovers Crew, a brigade of volunteers trained to help monitor and maintain public trees.  


 Jersey City OpenTreeMap:

OpenTreeMap is a tool we are using to provide a practical means of inventory through citizen lead data-collection. A component of City of Trees’ mission is to create a progressive maintenance program alongside our municipal partners.  OTM allows the public to be part of this process. As the community gets involved, their awareness and interest become more of an integral part of their lives, and a sense of interconnectivity grows. In turn, our credibility as an organization becomes more valuable to the public by providing them with an outlet to be heard.


Getting involved is easy to do and the data collection is very accurate. Users simply register their info, and begin mapping the trees around them.  At the basic level, they take a photo, measure the circumference (or diameter), and enter the tree species. OTM uses the USDA’s i-tree software to automatically generate various eco-benefits, which we then present as cost-befits to funders and city agencies.


After the primary information is entered, users have the option to enter alerts such as: “needs water” “tree has been topped” “dead tree” etc. They can also add information about the planting sides: “empty tree pit” “needs concrete removal” “remove trash”.  After stewardship tasks have been completed, anyone can click back on that pin and record the actions taken. In the end, this process embodies the idea that the most effective way to bring about change is not by empty complaints or government handouts, but a combination of top-down support and bottom-up expertise.

8:15p - Projects List + Working Session


See you soon!

Read About Code for JC Brigade Program.
Read About Code for America Brigade Network.

results.description:
Join us this every Tuesday as we cross paths with the sun in a Silent Walking Meditation. 

Our silent walking meditation will start at the Stone Field in the Hudson River Park. It is near 24th Street in Chelsea at Pier 63. 

Depending on our path, our journey may either take us along the river to the Meat Packing, where we will land on the steps of the Whitney Museum for tea, coffee and conversation, or through the Stone Field Greens, where we will land for tea, coffee and conversation at Chelsea Piers.


The walk and conversation is always FREE. The beverages are whatever the café charges.

Watch The Sun Journey Through The Seasons

As our walk crosses the sun's path every week, we will witness the seasons change as the sunsets pass us and we it.

When we begin, the sun will set just minutes after we meet. By the middle of summer we will walk with sun overhead. By September 22nd, when this series ends at the Autumnal Equinox, the sun will again set just after we join together.

Join us and be a witness to how the great wheels spin around us, and we within them.

Walks are generally less than 1 mile and last between 20 – 30 minutes.

Our Walking Meditation

We walk at a slow and even pace while placing our attention on our breath.

Walks start promptly at 7:30 and continue until approximately 8:00. You are always free to leave at any time.

We request silence during the walk, as there is time for conversation & community afterwards to share your experience with those around you. 

The Guided Walking Meditation is free, the refreshments are whatever the park or museum charge.

Please look both ways when you cross the streets as traffic can move very fast on the highway & arrive safely. 

Follow the traffic lights as you cross at 22nd Street, Walk North to Pier 63, which is near 24th Street. You will see the Stone Field between 12th Avenue and the Hudson River.

Click here to learn more about walking meditation

If you have any questions, please email [masked]

Bring a song to share. It's best if you have at least some printouts of the music. Traditionally at a bluegrass jam people take turns leading the songs. If you don't have any bluegrass songs other country or folk songs fit too. If you don't have a song or don't want to lead, that's ok too. In case you were thinking that you don't play much bluegrass, come anyway! Most bluegrass is pretty easy to play. The plan is to do these jams every first and third Tuesday of the month.

Email me for more info: [masked]

See you there!
results.name: Bluegrass jam (ukes and traditional instruments)

results.description:
Join Us For $2 Tuesdays At Wallington Lanes!

We'll Be Joined By 2 Other Meetups Groups.

Bowling is always a fun activity no matter your age. The AMF Wallington Lanes is a huge bowling alley that has a bar and a concession stand to order food. They play some good upbeat music as your bowling. They also added a game area with basketball shooting, racing arcade games, and pool tables.

You only pay $2 for bowling shoes, $2 per game, and $2 for Pabst Blue Ribbon Draft Beer.

Expect To Pay About $7 As We'll Play 2 Games Per Person Plus The Shoe Cost.

2 Games x $2= $4 Plus Tax

Bowling Shoes= $2 Plus Tax

Any food or drinks you want to order will be at your expense. If your interested in just coming out to watch and not play, that's ok to. The bowling alley is located on Paterson Plank Road in Wallington NJ. It's brightly colored in Red & Black paint on the exterior of the building.

We'll meet by the bar and table area. Look for a meetup sign. Please arrive by 7:30pm so we can start shortly after.
results.how_to_find_us: MEET BY THE BAR & TABLE AREA. LOOK 4 MEETUP SIGN.

results.description:
Everyone said they had a good time, so let's do it again.

If you're  looking to get out and try something different, may I suggest coming out and playing Trivia Quiz.

We have had a very nice group of regulars that have been participating and are always looking for more people to join us.

It is free to play and there is no Meetup fee for this event. So give it a try. And if you're coming right from work The Garth Road Inn does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.

The Garth Road Inn has been serving the Scarsdale community for many years.  It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.



**There will be a prize for the winning team!**

 
And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!

Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*


There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!

****All are welcome to attend!****

 
And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Mike when you arrive.
results.name: Trivia Quiz Night @ The Garth Road Inn in Scarsdale

results.description:
Learn & Sweat Bhangra sessions are for you 

- if you love to sweat it out to heart pumping music


- if you think fitness doesn't mean lifting weights

- if you want to learn and groove to energetic Bhangra while burning serious cals.

The class begins with a warm up, high energy and high fun, this Bhangra class combines the strong, festive moves of traditional Bhangra dance with a follow-me fitness-class style. 

Each week participants also have the opportunity to learn a more in-depth piece of Bhangra choreography to a popular dance floor hit. 

If you love Bhangra music and you’re looking for a fun, unique way to keep fit, join us to sweat it out while partying to the beats.

No previous dance experience is necessary - just bring in your smile! Our Instructors are professional, friendly, and open minded. So come on in and let swag emerge!

Wear comfortable clothes and shoes.

The drop-in price is $20 and can be paid here on meetup, or head over to our website www.nycbhangra.com/nycbhangra/signup for other options to pay.

Checkout our BEGINNER BHANGRA classes too!
results.name: Learn & Sweat BHANGRA

results.description:
Ingrid Vollset was born in Los Angeles to Norwegian parents and moved back to Norway at an early age where she spent her childhood and early adolescence. Upon finishing high school she moved to Paris where she began studying theater at Acting International. Having completed the 3 year theatre programme there under Robert Cordier, she moved to New York where she went on to study at the William Esper Studio. Graduate in 2012 she has been in numerous independent films since then. She is also active on the writing, producing and directing side of things and is currently working on the script for an independent feature. Learn more about her here: http://www.ingridvollset.com/

http://www.taginedining.com

results.description:
Hi All!

Please join Black Developers Meetup for a meet and greet and quick coding session with community members. As this is our fist meetup, we'll shake hands, share code, and get a chance to meet other members of the community. The event will be hosted at Abacus (https://www.abacus.com/), a fast growing start-up (with an amazing office) in Manhattan.

We have had a ton of interest over the past week from job recruiters, start-ups, and other organizations who want to present to our group. I will be sure to keep you posted on who has reached out, and I thought we might take this first meeting to see where our interests intersect as a group, and who we might want to present over the upcoming meetups.

Additionally, if you are interested in giving a brief presentation on a project that you've completed or are currently working on, please drop me a line.

I will be following up this message with an agenda and additional notes for the upcoming meeting, so please stay tuned. I'm looking forward to meeting you all, and very excited for our first meetup!
results.how_to_find_us: Abacus Office, 4th Floor
results.name: Black Developers Meet and Greet

results.description:
If you are learning English or if you are a native speaker of English, join us for relaxed conversation and to make new friends! All levels are welcomed!

This meetup is for:
-Students that want to improve their speaking & pronunciation
-New arrivals to the U.S.
-People looking to make new friends, discuss and learn about language & culture

Topics we are open to discussing
-Weather
-Hobbies
-News
-Politics
-Anything you want to talk about

Aspects of English we focus on
-Speaking: Pronunciation, Accents
-Listening: Definitions, Vocabulary, Synonyms
-Slang, common ways Americans express themselves

Please only sign up if you are serious about attending, we remove members that do not honor their RSVP!
It will be $2 to join. Also, Please support the venue by purchasing a coffee or something to eat when you attend.

Write what your native language is in the comments section!
results.name: ESL English Practice Night!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!
results.how_to_find_us: soccer, indoor soccer, futsal, new york futsal, futsal across america, futbol, futbolito, fifa

results.description:
Note that we will be in building 500 (not 519). And we are back to starting at 8pm again :)

Location: Pearl Studios, 500 Eighth Avenue New York, NY 10018

Room: 412 (4th floor)

Fee: $15 per class (cash only). You do not pay in advance. you pay when you take a class only.

Time: 8pm - 9:30pm.

Our third class is coming up next. We will review the right-turn and learn the left turn. For partnerwork, last class, we learned to lead and follow the right turn. For this coming class, the leads will learn to do the turn with a partner and we will learn a turn combination. This will be a fun class as usual :)

This will be the last full open house class. It means that anyone can join this class and they will be able to catch up. So tell your friends and family so they do not miss it as this will be the last basic-step review. Level 1 is for people who have never done any Salsa dancing before or for people who only have a little bit of experience. You do not need to bring a partner since we rotate during class. I will be teaching salsa on2 new york style, which is what is danced in New York. sample:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ep-cNukVLJo

Anyone can learn this no matter your age, body type, race, religion, etc. This dance will give you confidence and enhance your social life further. A better/alternate way to keep up with updates, room changes, tips, videos, and in contact with other students is to join the facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Here is a partial syllabus for the first 6 weeks out of the 12:

During each week, the following concepts will be taught along with the material when necessary:

(Posture) (Weight Shifting) (hand rotation) (spotting) (pacing) (balance) (distance control) (musicality) (timing) (body coordination) (body isolations) (etc)

Week 1 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Basic Step, Basic variations, upper body movement, Body isolations and coordination exercises, Timing, Music

Partnerwork: Open Hold, Close Hold, Hand placements, Correct Frame, Correct Tension

Week 2 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Previous class review, Right-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Leading The right-turn, Following the right-turn

Week 3 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Previous class review, Left-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Cross-Body-Lead and Follow.

Week 4 (semi open house - only those who know the material taught on weeks 1 & 2 can join. A special class will be offered for those who want join the cycle and need to catch up)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 1 and 2 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Cross-body-Lead combined with Inside Turn, Turn Combinations

Week 5 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 3 and 4 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Open-Break Step

Week 6 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 5 and 6 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Walk-Around Turn

Week 7 - 12

More fundamental footwork and partnerwork (Variations)
results.name: Level 1 Salsa Class Cycle (last open house class)

results.description:
Seemed like April would never GET HERE, but, thankfully, it did, and here we are! The flowers are blooming, the birds are singing, and it's TIME TO MAKE ART! Join us Tuesday for a night of fun and creation!  It's a Figure drawing event--it's a variety show--it's a party!

As always we have four outstanding nude art models, a profoundly entertaining DJ, and live comics and musicians! For four hours! What more could you ask for? Well... we are inside New York's best rock and roll tiki bar with some AMAZING alcoholic creations (no obligation.. I'm just sayin').


And it's all only $20 smackers at the door! Wotta bargain!


So grab your favorite art materials and your weirdest friends and expect to have a blast! It's a fun art party for beginners and old pros alike!

As Always:
Over 21 only--IDs will be checked
Bring your own art supplies
No outside beverages
Ticket price does not include beverages
results.name: Draw-mania! 49  TUESDAY, 4/19, 8pm-midnight $20

group.name: Figure Drawing NYC--Summer Sketch Group and Draw-mania!

results.description:
O'Connors has a great Trivia game going every Tuesday. Tom always has challenging and diverse questions, and our team frequently wins! The game starts at 8:30, so let's try to arrive around 8 to hang out a bit before it starts. Come to win a drink or two, make some new friends, see old ones, and play a fun and intellectually stimulating game of trivia!

Great times and great friends!  New and returning members welcome!
results.name: Trivia Night!

results.description:
Hi Guys! 


On this coming Tuesday (4/19) we're taking over Mile End, the acclaimed Montreal-Style Jewish hotspot located in NoHo. The restaurant is both a NY Times and NY Mag Critics' Pick, and the chef has put together an incredible 9-Dish Feast for us that will feature a bunch of off-menu dishes and some Mile End classics. Chef Antony Nassif, who grew up in Montreal and cut his teeth working at some of the city's top restaurants, will be coming out throughout the meal to introduce the dishes and share the stories behind them.

RSVP at: https://tastingcollective.com/events/20

Please note, you MUST buy tickets via the link below to grab seats. We will not be able to accommodate RSVPs on meetup.com who haven't purchased tickets via the link below. 

The price is $50 plus tax and tip, which covers the full lineup of 9 dishes.

This is one of our favorite restaurants, and this feast is going to be super special. Join us!

-Nat
results.how_to_find_us: We're taking over the whole restaurant for this one.
results.name: 9-Dish Montreal-Style Jewish Feast at Mile End!

group.name: Communal Feasts at Top NYC Restaurants!

results.description:
Part 1: Dinner

The April Dinner & Discussion will start with Dinner at Jose Tejas Mexican Restaurant on Route 46 in Fairfield at 6:30 PM. Here's a link to their menu:

http://www.bordercafe.com/#.

Note: Tejas is always crowed. Anyone there by 6:30 will be at our table. Anyone arriving late is on their own. At dinner we talk about everything in the world except the evening's topic.

- - - - - - - - - - - -

Part 2: Discussion

We'll be discussing movies, television series, and works of fiction set in the West containing elements of science fiction, fantasy and horror.  A few movies to get you started:  COWBOYS AND ALIENS, THE WILD WILD WEST and JESSE JAMES MEETS FRANKENSTEIN'S DAUGHTER.

Dinner & Discussion is held on the third Tuesday of the month (except December). Here's a list of topics we've discussed in the past:

https://sites.google.com/site/sfassnofbergencounty/home/discussions-and-other-activities/topic-discussion-group 

If you have an interest in science fiction / fantasy / horror, please contact me directly at SFABCPhilmu (at) gmail.com to learn about lots of other north Jersey events.
