results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON Games @ UpperWestSide

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday at 8:30pm as La Luz hosts an ALL LEVELS, OPEN,  DROP-IN Improv Comedy Class!!!

We begin the class with a focus on group activities and fun games as we  move towards some individual character building, short and long form scenes, listening, supporting our partner(s), and performing in front an audience.

Each week is a bit different with various teachers from Upright Citizens Brigade, Magnet Theater, the PIT and places all over the world! Every instructor is a new experience and want our students to have a dynamic well rounded learning experience.

Classes are donation based so please come anyway. We ask $10-13.

Now get on over to La Luz and Let’s Play!!!!

At 9pm, we end our organizational meeting (see previous event), and have a brief introductory discussion about freeganism. Newcomers are always welcome and encouraged to attend our full meeting, but if you just want an introduction to freeganism, you can come just for the Freeganism 101 discussion. results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

It's simple...

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!


Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study hard, practise conversation, and share good energy.

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Whatever you're learning, good, daily study habits will make you fluent. 

Try it out!
results.name: Let's Get Fluent! Language Study at Starbucks

This is a core strength workout. We do boot camp style exercises, so think pushups, situps, planks, squats, burpees, etc. And there's a lot of high fives, smiles, and laughing involved, too...

Do you like getting up early and starting the day with inspiring conversations or even better: pair programming on your pet project? This is your meetup! :) 

Skip the morning run and instead meet us between 6:30 AM and 8:30 AM bi-weekly to chat, code and have the first coffee together to start the day off with developers or other software professionals who care about the quality of the code and passionately looking for ways to improve themselves. 

The venue: There is a Starbucks open from 5:30 am and behind it the lobby of The Lexington NYC hotel, which is a pretty cool space, they have free, fast wi-fi, plenty of seating and a lot of sockets in the wall :) I asked, and we are allowed to gather so don't be shy and have a look around. results.description:
Are you looking for a way to grow your business? Would building relationships with professionals in other industries help your career?

If the answer is yes, you may want to consider visiting BNI Platinum Chapter 14! We meet each week to discuss our businesses and ways we may be able to help one another. Our members work in a wide array of industries including: financial services, real estate, legal services and many more!

Our members are focused on fostering relationships with one another which naturally lead to business referrals over time.

We welcome visitors to come see what we are all about!

Where: Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, Upstairs Board Room

148 W 51st St, 2nd Floor 

Between 6th and 7th Ave's

When: Wednesday mornings (7am-8:30am)

To see a list of our members and more about our chapter visit our web page at http://bit.ly/1MgHufC

*If you have been to a BNI chapter before, you know that we are only allowed to have one person per profession. If you see that no one fills that role, then you should be welcome to come! However, if you notice a potential conflict our members will work with you to see if our chapter would be a good place to visit, or if it would be better to visit another one of the BNI chapters.

If you are interested in visiting our chapter please reach out to one of our visitor hosts: 
Brett Sigler - [masked]

results.description:
Are computers becoming obsolete and where is technology going?  Today’s popular devices may be almost extinct in only a few years from now.   Join us and listen to Andrew Coyle, President of Armidillo Services, explain the future of technology.  Is the tablet and cell phone taking over the PC world and discarding the PC the same as the typewriter, vinyl records, beepers, and the Betamax? Some industry experts aren’t prepared to say the desktop PC’s are becoming obsolete, but that time may be coming.  The Desktop and Laptop used to be viewed as the most functional devices, but recent technological advances have given tablets and cellphones equal footings.  Also Mr. Coyle will be discussing what cloud storage and cloud printing are and the benefits of each.


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on April 20th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
Hello Business Professional! 

If you are a business professional in the Bellmore, NY area and are looking to grow your business, as well as increase your network of businesses that you can trust and rely on look no further than Simply Referrals! 

Simply Referrals is the type of business networking group that is all about developing long-lasting relationships, as opposed to contracts, and membership fees and ultimatums that other groups have. S.R. has no contracts, no fees, and no nonsense. A membership cannot be purchased. Simply Referrals is also an exclusive membership, which means you will be the only one from your respective profession. 


Spots are filling fast so don't delay! 

S.R. is a true network of business professionals that you can trust. Our #1 goal is to develop a team of businesses that not only its members can trust to refer and work with, but a team of businesses that can be counted on by local businesses, family, and friends to always act in good faith, and always do the right thing. If Simply Referrals sounds like a business networking group that you would like to be a part of, please see us at our next meeting! 

Next meetings are scheduled for 3/30 and 4/20. 

Regular meetings are approximately every 3 weeks, and held Wednesday mornings at 7:00 a.m. If you have any questions please email or call at[masked]-1691. 

Please find Simply Referrals Bellmore on Facebook! 

https://www.facebook.com/simply.referrals.bellmore/

If you have a facebook business pg. please tell us! We would love to share your posts and blogs. 


Thank you, 


Steven Bellafiore
Simply Referrals

results.description:
Shark Tank Tour Background Information


In 2015, I worked with Values Partnerships to develop and lead the

<a> first nationwide casting tour</a>

 for ABC's Shark Tank focused on bringing more diverse ideas and voices to the show.


Last year, we hosted 11 casting calls in 6 cities and engaged over 1000 diverse entrepreneurs.


Many of the entrepreneurs from our events, including  

<a>Sprëtz </a>

and 

<a>PiperWai </a>

have appeared on Season 7 of Shark Tank.

Additionally, we worked with over 20 organizational partners to provide pitch prep, entrepreneurship education, and access to capital discussions and networking to add value for every entrepreneur that pitched at our events.
We kicked off the 2016 tour in Miami, FL!  
Prior to the event, we sat down with <a>Black Enterprise</a> to discuss the 2016 tour and the state of entrepreneurship in America. At each tour stop we will interview entrepreneurs - like <a>Cuffed Design</a> - and the organizations that support them. These interviews will be posted to Black Enterprise throughout the tour.  
Following our <a>Miami </a>casting call, we hosted entrepreneurs in <a>Austin, TX</a> at Urban Co-Lab during SxSW. 
We always look to add value for the entrepreneurs who pitch at our events. At our Austin casting call, we <a>announced a new partnership</a> with the Nasdaq Entrepreneurial Center and US Chamber of Commerce to develop a "pitch toolkit" for entrepreneurs. 

NYC is the next step on our casting tour. On April 20, 2016 we will host two casting calls in NYC; a morning event at the New York Institute of Technology and an evening event in the Bronx. 
Casting calls are also planned in following cities: 
Detroit, MI - May 15SF/Oakland - May 26 DC - June 15NO - July 2 (Essence Festival) Cincy - July 16 (NAACP)
Visit <a>www.valuespartnerships.com/sharktank</a> for more information. 

"Shark Tank Casting Call for Diverse Entrepreneurs
With the support of Producer Mark Burnett, Values Partnerships is leading a nationwide casting tour supporting minority entrepreneurship and recruiting diverse voices to pitch on the show. 
Register to pitch your business at the Shark Tank NYC casting calls on April 20, 2016 
Morning Casting Call at NYIT 

- <a>http://www.valuespartnerships.com/sharktank/nyit</a>;

Afternoon Casting Call in The Bronx - <a>http://www.valuespartnerships.com/sharktank/bronx</a>; 

On a first come, first serve basis, companies may be selected to pitch their businesses to the casting team from ABC’s Shark Tank. results.description:
Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle

results.description:
This meetup is hosted by IndieGrove. Please refer to the included link for all RSVP details.

Topics of discussion will be: 

Legal business structures and the tax and legal implicationsFinance structures for raising new capital and the pros and cons of each1099 contractors vs. W2 employees 

Role of your accountant and attorney in your company General Admission- $10 Until 4/15/16, then $15      

RSVP Link: www.indiegrovejc.com/calendar 

Presented by Sara Shah – Founding Attorney of Sara Shah Law, PC & Jennifer Kirkland, Owner of Kirkland Services LLC


Sara Shah is a New York and New Jersey corporate attorney and her firm counsels individuals, startups and small businesses from pre-formation through to raising capital, and are there to advise and mitigate risk every step of the way.Sara decided to pursue her own practice because she was intrigued by how startups have disrupted the traditional model of running a business. Unfortunately, legal services have not been as quick to evolve, and she recognized that the legal industry needs to conform to accommodate for this exciting fast-paced modern way of conducting business.She strongly believes that the focus of a startup should be dedicated to transforming their dreams into reality, while allowing Sara Shah Law custom tailor all their legal requirements at an affordable flat-fee rate. 

Jennifer Kirkland’s passion for tax began at the early age of 14 when her dad passed away and her mother was left to manage the financial affairs of the family.  At the time, her mother was a stay at home mom and Jennifer witnessed her mother’s struggle to understand and handle family finances.  That is when she knew that she wanted to learn more about accounting and taxation. Jennifer graduated summa cum laude in 2007 from Lehman College with a Bachelor of Science degree in accounting.  She began her accounting career as an auditor at the big four, PwC. In 2008, Jennifer decided to start her own tax, real estate and financial planning practice in addition to her daily job.  After receiving her CPA, she moved to Barclays to work in their tax department specializing in the State and Local Tax Area and was recently promoted to Assistant Vice President.  She is currently at NYU studying law and taxation and will graduate with a Masters in Tax in spring 2017. Jennifer’s primary goal is to help others achieve their financial goals by assisting them with their tax, audit, and compliance needs. She is very passionate about the financial markets and feels that in these economic times it is very important for everyone to have an understanding of how accounting affects their lives.
results.name: Lunch & Learn: The Ins and Outs of Startup Funding

Do you want to travel the world but something's been stopping you, such as lack of time and money?

Do you desire a loving and passionate relationship but have trouble attracting the right person?  

Do you find that your thoughts and emotions are getting in the way from achieving joy and fulfillment?

The good news is that I'll be discussing HOW to achieve the above, and will be guiding you through a POWERFUL visualization process that has been scientifically proven to work miracles (no pun intended).

Anyone whose ever joined us on this webinar has had a truly profound and heart felt experience. 

Can't wait to share with you! 

Xox, 

Ayelet 

Testimonials from previous Life Transformers: 

"While attending Ayelet's webinar we were guided through a visualization technique to create the best version of who we will become in 10 years from now. In the middle of that awesome visualization I felt a burst, a huge leap of energy expanding in my heart chakra (and since I am an energy healer it makes so much sense). Ayelet gave me a major breakthrough! I will be using the techniques we were taught to bring forth all this new power I have. I now feel as though this power is already here and now fully available to me, and I will use it to melt away my hesitation, doubts and fears. I can feel at ease knowing I have this new tool in my hands, it's as though I am warping time to manifest the best version of who I will become. Thank you Ayelet!" -Ricardo, New Jersey 

"I listened to your webinar today from the UK and I wanted to first thank you for hosting this. I have been doing a lot of things, such as the law of attraction, access consciousness, and yoga, and I must say that I love the way you broke it down! I've done all this reading / learning and no one does it your way. I love how you said to write down all your thoughts/ lists about yourself, as well as goals, to see where the conflicts lie. I haven't really come across anyone who breaks it up into mini pieces that make sense. Normally I'm left confused, everyone [else] guides you with what to do, they just don't explain how to do it. Again thank you so much." - Natasha, U.K.

"I met Ayelet at a free Lust to Love Meditation that she was leading. It was a very transformative experience. I didn't know what to expect. Well, less than ten minutes in I started crying and I didn't know how to stop. The tears just kept flowing. By the end of it, I felt like I let go of my anxiety and my fears of never being good enough.

Ayelet (www.Facebook.com/Ayelet.Shimron) is a relationship expert. I asked for her advice regarding my recent breakup with my boyfriend of six years, which is why I went to her event. Ayelet explained that we have a tendency to constantly chase guys who don't treat us right, and we have expectations of other people that in turn, create unhappiness in our lives. Working on the root chakra helps us let go of those expectations and find inner peace.

The meditation event helped me get through my break up immensely, and not only that, I fixed my constantly dysfunctional relationship with my parents as well. I feel like I've become more confident and let go of many of my fears.

Ayelet is definitely an authentic and go-to person when it comes to improving relationships. The free meditation she led was life changing for me."- Annie Yang, NYC

Do you have your mobile marketing strategy well planned?

If you don't have a solid strategy, here are a few things to consider:

• 70% of mobile searches lead to online action within 1 hour.
• 75% of Americans admit to bringing their phone to the bathroom.

results.description:
Dr. Jennifer Chayes

Distinguished Scientist and Managing Director of Microsoft Research New England

Once Upon a Graph: How to Get from Now to Then in Massive Networks

Abstract: Networks are increasingly important in many aspects of our world: physical networks like transportation networks, utility networks and the Internet, online information networks like the WWW, online social networks like Facebook and Twitter, epidemiological networks for global disease transmission, genomic and protein networks in computational biology, and many more. How do we model and learn these networks? In contrast to conventional learning problems, where we have many independent samples, it is often the case for these networks that we can get only one independent sample. How do we use a single snapshot today to learn a model for the network, and therefore be able to predict a similar, but larger network in the future? In the case of relatively small or moderately sized networks, it's appropriate to model the network parametrically, and attempt to learn these parameters. For massive networks, a non-parametric representation is more appropriate. Here I show how to use the theory of graph limits, developed over the last decade, to give consistent estimators for machine learning of massive sparse networks, and moreover how to do this in a way that protects the privacy of individuals on the network.

Biography: Jennifer Tour Chayes is Distinguished Scientist and Managing Director of Microsoft Research New England in Cambridge, Massachusetts, which she co-founded in 2008, and Microsoft Research New York City, which she co-founded in 2012. Chayes was Research Area Manager for Mathematics, Theoretical Computer Science and Cryptography at Microsoft Research Redmond until 2008. Chayes joined Microsoft Research in 1997, when she co-founded the Theory Group. Her research areas include phase transitions in discrete mathematics and computer science, structural and dynamical properties of self-engineered networks, and algorithmic game theory. She is the co-author of about 125 scientific papers and the co-inventor of about 30 patents.

Chayes has many ties to the academic community. She was for many years Professor of Mathematics at UCLA. She serves on numerous institute boards, advisory committees and editorial boards, including the Turing Award Selection Committee of the Association for Computing Machinery, the Board of Trustees of the Mathematical Sciences Research Institute and the Institute for Computational and Experimental Research in Mathematics, the Advisory Boards of the Center for Discrete Mathematics and Computer Science, the Howard Hughes Medical Institute Janelia Farm Research Campus, and Women Entrepreneurs in Science and Technology. Chayes is a past Chair of the Mathematics Section of the American Association for the Advancement of Science, and a past Vice-President of the American Mathematical Society.

Chayes received her B.A. in biology and physics at Wesleyan University, where she graduated first in her class, and her Ph.D. in mathematical physics at Princeton. She did her postdoctoral work in the mathematics and physics departments at Harvard and Cornell. She is the recipient of a National Science Foundation Postdoctoral Fellowship, a Sloan Fellowship, and the UCLA Distinguished Teaching Award. Chayes has recently been the recipient of many leadership awards including the Leadership Award of Women Entrepreneurs in Science and Technology, the Leading Women Award of the Girl Scouts of Eastern Massachusetts, the Women to Watch Award of the Boston Business Journal, and the Women of Leadership Vision Award of the Anita Borg Institute. She has twice been a member of the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton. Chayes is a Fellow of the American Association for the Advancement of Science, the Fields Institute, the Association for Computing Machinery, the American Mathematical Society, a National Associate of the National Academies, and an Elected Member of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences.

Chayes is well known for her work on phase transitions, in particular for laying the foundation for the study of phase transitions in problems in discrete mathematics and theoretical computer science; this study is now giving rise to some of the fastest known algorithms for fundamental problems in combinatorial optimization. She is also one of the world's experts in the modeling and analysis of random, dynamically growing graphs, which are used to model the Internet, the World Wide Web and a host of other technological and social networks. Among Chayes' contributions to Microsoft technologies are the development of methods to analyze the structure and behavior of various networks, the design of auction algorithms, and the design and analysis of various business models for the online world.
results.name: Colloquium Event | Jennifer Chayes | Once Upon a Graph

Note: This is a musical performance at the German Consulate. This event is not exclusive to our group & many people simply go there to enjoy the performance, there might not be as much mingling as some other events. Please follow the Consulate's rules for registration. The consulate has staff members on-site that can help & assist you. Please arrive on time to allow for a few minutes to go through security before the performance starts at 6pm.


After finishing your RSVP here, please immediately proceed to

 https://www.eventbrite.com/e/el-violin-latino-no-2-concert-with-gregor-huebner-tickets-23061605884 

to secure your spot. 

The Consulate's registration will close as soon as capacity is reached for this event.

The German Consulate General presents

in cooperation with the Consulate General of Luxemburg: the award-winning German violinist and composer Gregor Huebner with the El Violin Latino Quartet at the German House on April 20. 


About the Artist
Gregor Huebner always had a passion for Latin music. He has been a member of tango groups, jazz formations and much more. His excellent violin performances can be heard on many albums, including solo projects.

Gregor Huebner’s first recording project under the name “El Violin Latino” was released in 2011 to rave reviews in Europe as well as the USA in publications including the Wall Street Journal.

About the Performance

With the help of a fundraising campaign Indigogo, where he raised almost $20,000.00, he has now recorded his second solo album. On “El Violin Latino-No.2” Gregor collaborates with musicians from Cuba, Brazil, and Argentina – making it one of a kind.

On April 20, coming off of a two-week European tour, Gregor Huebner will return to the German House to perform “El Violin Latino-No.2”. At his upcoming concert, he will present the different musical styles of Cuba, Brazil and Argentina with the support of the El Violin Latino Quartet – featuring Klaus Müller on piano, Itaiguara Brandao on bass - and hailing from Luxemburg, Jerome Goldschmidt on percussion.


Admission

Admission is free for this event, but your registration at 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/el-violin-latino-no-2-concert-with-gregor-huebner-tickets-23061605884  is required to gain access.

How do I get there by subway?

6: 51st St

4/5/6/7: Grand Central Terminal

E/M: Lexington Av/53rd St

Since the event is near 1st Ave & 49th St, there is going to be a bit of a walk involved, keep that in mind for your timing & check google maps for details. 

And please - as always - change your RSVP status if your plans change. We appreciate it very much!


Thomas

results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Let's face it, the idea of "no need to reinvent the wheel" is not 100% applicable in the age of media.  What once worked as a good publicity tool in the age where magazines, newspaper, and TV dominated the media doesn't necessarily work for more internet and mobile media platforms.  What once worked as a key strategy to dominate Google's search results based on Google's algorithm can become obsolete overnight.  At this event we will address adapting to new media platforms and algorithms.  While also proving that viral content and quality content are as connected as tasty pizza is to cleansing toothpaste.

Video-  We will have a presenter talk about new tools people can use to create content that "wows!" people by utilizing live streaming and virtual reality.  How to use new content like 360 video, VR, and live streaming where it is more than just a gimmick and why gimmicky content might "wow!" a visitor but not stick.  We will also talk about video platforms like Masquerade and Snapchat.  While also learning ways you can create online short videos that are engaging and take less than 15 minutes to make and only require a smartphone.

Photos-  We will discuss which photos on Facebook and Instagram are the types that not only generate page views but also encourage comments and discussion, and how to create memes that encourage engagement.

Our main presenter is founder and Chief Editor, Olga Kaushan. Olga Kaushan's website and app receives approximately 12 million hits per month, and is a Google Premium Publisher.  Olga will provide insight how she has made a successful site with a powerful social media presence strictly through SEO and social media marketing and not advertisements or a staff force.

Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite http://www.eventbrite.com/e/content-creators-get-together-fireside-chat-with-the-chief-editor-tickets-24185323955
results.name: Content Creators Weekly Get Together and Leveraging New Media

** Please RSVP with your full legal name; ID will be requested by building security. **

In our April meetup we will start to review of what you need to know about Mitaka, the latest release of OpenStack.  And we have a guest speaker from Datera to talk about Cinder Block storage use cases and their solution.


Title: 


OpenStack Cinder delivering Intent-Defined Infrastructure: 

Abstract: 

OpenStack provides a ubiquitous platform for application deployment and scaling. However, for stateful applications the ability to scale is physically bound to the infrastructure capabilities. There is a need to define the application requirements through clean contracts and abstractions to the infrastructure. The underlying infrastructure should translate this intent to best address the requirements for the application. In this session, we present an implementation to enable intent-defined storage for OpenStack through the notion of application templates. 

Speaker:

Matt Smith is a Software Engineer with 5 years of experience in Python automation frameworks and is currently working for Datera, a startup that provides Elastic Data Fabric™, an elastic block storage solution for next-generation public clouds. Matt joined the OpenStack community in 2015 and is an active contributor to the Cinder OpenStack project. Previously Matt worked for Riverbed Technologies on their SteelScript Application Framework design team.
results.name: What Do you Need To Know About Mitaka? / Cinder Intent-Defined Infra by Datera
Wednesday soccer @ 6PM!

results.description:
Please text me at[masked] if you need help getting up to 7th floor.

Let's face it, the idea of "no need to reinvent the wheel" is not 100% applicable in the age of media.  What once worked as a good publicity tool in the age where magazines, newspaper, and TV dominated the media doesn't necessarily work for more internet and mobile media platforms.  What once worked as a key strategy to dominate Google's search results based on Google's algorithm can become obsolete overnight.  At this event we will address adapting to new media platforms and algorithms.  While also proving that viral content and quality content are as connected as tasty pizza is to cleansing toothpaste.

Video-  We will have a presenter talk about new tools people can use to create content that "wows!" people by utilizing live streaming and virtual reality.  How to use new content like 360 video, VR, and live streaming where it is more than just a gimmick and why gimmicky content might "wow!" a visitor but not stick.  We will also talk about video platforms like Masquerade and Snapchat.  While also learning ways you can create online short videos that are engaging and take less than 15 minutes to make and only require a smartphone.

Photos-  We will discuss which photos on Facebook and Instagram are the types that not only generate page views but also encourage comments and discussion, and how to create memes that encourage engagement.

Our main presenter is founder and Chief Editor, Olga Kaushan. Olga Kaushan's website and app receives approximately 12 million hits per month, and is a Google Premium Publisher.  Olga will provide insight how she has made a successful site with a powerful social media presence strictly through SEO and social media marketing and not advertisements or a staff force.

Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite http://www.eventbrite.com/e/content-creators-get-together-fireside-chat-with-the-chief-editor-tickets-24185323955
results.name: Content Creators Weekly Get Together and Leveraging New Media

results.description:
Click the link below to purchase a ticket to this event:


http://www.bigmaven.com/experience/after-hours-the-polish-consulate/

Join New York Adventure Club for an exclusive tour of The Consulate General of the Republic of Poland in New York, located in the magnificent Joseph Raphael De Lamar mansion.

Led by the Consul General himself, our once-a-year experience will take us into the main parlors of the 1905 C. P. H. Gilbert designed mansion, which was designated a landmark by the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission in 1975, and  added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1983.

Afterwards, we’ll grab some food and drinks at a local eatery!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: After-Hours Tour @ Polish Consulate’s De Lamar Mansion

results.description:
Players of all skill levels are welcome. Westchester FC is about playing the beautiful game in a fun environment where everyone can get a good workout and improve their skills. It doesn't matter if you are the Messi of White Plains or you have never kicked a ball before, all you need are shoes.

While we will spend most of the time playing pick-up games, we will start with some warm-up to get the blood flowing. SPREAD THE WORD and get your friends to sign up!

I can't stress enough that fun is the top priority, because of this, no rough play (slide tackling is prohibited) or rude language. Violators will be warned, sent off, suspended or banned from Westchester FC games. We want everyone to feel comfortable so that we can really grow this club.
results.how_to_find_us: Don't worry if you are going to be late, we play until it is too dark.
results.name: Friendly Soccer in White Plains

results.description:
If you are a screenwriter, this is the meetup you should not miss every month. Share your work, listen to the work of other writers, and also take advantage of the monthly educational resource, entertainment attorney Hakim Mulraine.

In past committee meetings, we have spoken with Reggie Bythewood, Michael Starburry, Devanshi Patel and Sheldon Candis, as well as participated in many table reads. If you are a writer, the writers committee is a great resource!

We have room for pages from one more script to be table read at this week's upcoming Writer's Committee Meeting. Please send your pages to [masked] (no more than 8 pages via pdf).

results.description:
Please click HERE to register on the AIANY site. 


This program will focus on the history of Social Science and Architecture collaborations: where the disciplines have intersected in the past, changes in this relationship over time, and exploration of the future. This conversation will address the evolution of these two disciplines over time - prehistory, early architectural history, modern architecture, and contemporary theory - in order to inform and inspire the future of our profession and the work of the Social Science Research and Architecture Committee.


Speakers:

David Chapin

David Chapin is Architect and Environmental Psychologist at CUNY with a unique way of looking at architecture and design. During the 1970s and well into the 1980s Chapin worked as part of the ARC Group in Cleveland, Ohio, funded by the Ohio Department of Mental Health, Office of Program Evaluation and Research. Architecture-Research-Construction was a collaborative group of 22 very creative people who worked in many different “treatment” settings to design, build and evaluate changes to institutional environments. Behavioral Change on Ward 8. The early work was in mental hospitals but expanded into other settings such as places for people diagnosed as “mentally retarded.” This work became more and more participatory to the point that they carefully measured the effect of participation, itself. Today David is passionate about studying and creating designs that are sustainable in our ever changing world.

Ingrid Erikson

Ingrid Erickson is currently an Assistant Professor of Library and Information Science at Rutgers University. Ingrid received her PhD from the Center for Work, Technology & Organization at Stanford University in 2008. Her scholarly interests lie at the intersection of technology studies, communication, and organizational behavior, with a particular emphasis on the emergent practices surrounding locative technologies (e.g., GPS) in social contexts. Using primarily qualitative, ethnographic methodologies, she also focuses on understanding the implications of ubiquitous and mobile technologies on conceptualizations of place and space, boundaries of public and private, and rhetoric in the media. She has conducted research with the Social Computing Group at IBM's T J Watson Research Center and at Boeing's Phantom Works research division.

Richard Wener

Richard E. Wener is Professor of Environmental Psychology in the Department of Technology, Culture and Society at the Polytechnic Institute of New York University, where he co-directs the Sustainable Urban Environments program, and is a faculty affiliate of the Rutgers University Center for Green Building. In 2010 Professor Wener was a Fulbright Fellow at the Vienna University of Technology.For more than thirty years Professor Wener has studied the way correctional architecture affects facility operations and the behavior of staff and inmates. This work began in 1975 with evaluations of the first of the “new generation jails” – federal Metropolitan Correctional Centers in Chicago and New York. He has since conducted evaluations of dozens of prisons and jails and several large nationwide surveys of correctional facilities. He has consulted in the area of facility design and planning for adult and juvenile detention and corrections facilities.

Katrina Johnston-Zimmerman 

Katrina Johnston-Zimmerman is an urban anthropologist with City ID in New York City specializing in research and analysis of behavior in public space. Her prior work has included analyses of public spaces including an ethnography of the Occupy Portland campsite and a ethnography of place conducted on a Portland State University plaza, where she completed her Masters in Urban Studies. Before that she was a part of a transdisciplinary academic research group assessing open space in cities worldwide, and assisted in the creation of the collaborative urban interventions group Better Block Portland. At City ID Katrina has worked on site analysis, data gathering, user experience reviews, user-scenario development, concept and network planning, and wayfinding rationale. She is always looking for ways to improve the human experience in cities through Right to the City concepts in combination with our physical and mental needs as a species.


Moderator: 

Eve Klein, Associate AIA


Eve Kleinis an architect and planner specializing in cultural institutions and higher education.  She is currently a doctoral student in Environmental Psychology at CUNY focusing on how the social sciences can contribute to the design process.  This year she co-founded and is co-chairing the AIA NY Committee on Social Sciences and Architecture.  Until 2013, she was NYU’s Assistant Vice President of Planning and Design, overseeing facilities planning and space management at the University. 

Organized by: AIANY Social Science and Architecture Committee

Price: Free for AIA members and Students with valid ID; $10 for non-members
results.name: Exploring the Past, Defining the Future

group.name: Social Research, Architecture and Design Meetup

results.description:
iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a consumer SLA Resin 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.
The following points will be covered during the training session:
• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer.
• Intro to the printer - B9 Creator
• Intro to the Software (slicer)
• Ongoing maintenance 
• Common troubles
• Workflow, tips and tricks
If you have any question, please email us at [masked]
We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: Intro to 3D printing with Resin (SLA)

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.

results.description:
Hey Sole Mates, dust off those sneakers and come on out and walk together for a Wednesday evening walk.  We'll meetup @ 6:00PM SHARP in the parking lot of the Verona Park, near the boathouse for a 3 mile walk! 


This Wednesday evening will be a walk only.  For all of our members, who haven't walked with us yet, this is a perfect time to come out and see what we're all about.  You'll see what a warm and friendly group we are and how we love to have fun.  So come on out and join us and I promise, you'll be back again.  I hope to see many new and familiar Sole Mates this evening!!

Thank you all again for coming at least 10 minutes early. Lets keep up the great success that we're having by doing this!

I'm hoping that the weather will be beautiful for us!  Please feel free to bring a friend!!  

Also, there is no need to post a comment if you cannot make it.  We'll see you next time!

Thank you :)
results.name: Wednesday Evening 6PM Walk (3 Miles) & Talk  @ Verona Park

DIRECTIONS:

• Take the Campus Drive exit off of Park Avenue [If you’re coming in from Rt. 24/Columbia Turnpike, this will be a right-hand turn into a jughandle].

• Once on Campus Drive, turn right into the parking lot for 100 Campus Drive.

• There are guest parking spots on either side of the main driveway heading towards the building.

• Go straight into the main building entrance and follow signs for West Elevator Bank [The lobby is under construction.]

Take the elevator to the 2nd floor.  Once you exit the elevator, turn left down the hallway.  There’s a phone on the wall by our door.


Join us for our Content Strategy New Jersey Kick-Off event! We'll have time for networking (wine, beer, snacks provided by Logical Design Solutions). Our agenda will include introductions, brainstorming and gathering feedback on topics and formats for upcoming meetings.  What do you want to get out of these Content Strategy New Jersey? Interested in being a speaker, or on a panel? We want to hear from you so please bring your ideas for how we can make the most of future meetings!

Be sure to let your colleagues know about this event and encourage them to join!

results.description:
Kwame Dawes (Ghana/Jamaica), poet, actor, editor, critic, musician, and a Chancellor Professor of English at the University of Nebraska where he teaches post colonial literature and theory, African American Literature, and Caribbean Literature, and where he is a member of the creative writing program at UNL.

New York-based Poets & Writers named Dawes as a recipient of the 2011 B&N Writers for Writers Award, which recognises writers who have given generously to other writers or to the broader literary community.

Emmy Award winner in the category of New Approaches to News & Documentary Programming: Arts, Lifestyle & Culture. His project documented HIV/AIDS in Jamaica. Director of the Calabash International Literary Festival, a yearly event in Jamaica. Author of 'Duppy Conqueror: New and Selected Poems' (The book is amazing!)
results.name: The Chinua Achebe Legacy Series

results.description:
Open Play for Advanced Beginners and Intermediate Players.

Our game starts promptly at 6:00pm.  You are welcome to come slightly earlier to change and warm up.

We can accommodate 3 teams, 7 players per team max (single rotation). Rally scoring. Game to 15 cap 17. 

IMPORTANT - Skill Level Required for our Open Play

Know how to rotate on the court, serve, pass, set, spike and block. Know how to hold your position on the court during defense and offense.  This is meant for players that have experience playing.

Rules will be enforced to protect all players from safety and fun.

Recreational players and beginners can practice on the side or come watch for FREE. We also run a skills clinic to improve your game. Please ask!

If you will be attending for the first time, please check in with me for a quick 3 min assessment. 

Thanks and hope to see you on the court!

May

Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.

We have permission from the owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consume something.

• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.

results.description:
RSVP to [masked]  http://www.meetup.com/Conversations-New-York/events/229812006/ 

Conversation hosted by Ron Gross, about BULLSHIT: Faking It, Hypocrisy, Lies, “Truthiness”, Factoids, Humbug, Hokum, and Phoniness -- in our Personal, Professional, and Political Lives 

Please come join our BS-free zone 
to share your experiences, ideas, feelings, 
values, and insights. 

Suggested optional reading: 
On Bullshit, by Harry G. Frankfurt, Princeton University Press; 
The B.S. Factor: The Theory and Technique of Faking It in America, Arthur Herzog, Penguin. 

WE START AT 6:15 SHARP, SO PLEASE PLAN TO ARRIVE BY 6:00 FOR MEET-AND-GREET! THANK YOU.

The Conversation is followed at 8:15-9:00 by the Conversations New York (CNY) Activists’ Conclave -- Join us in providing our fellow New Yorkers with these kinds of conversations, anytime, anywhere, on any subject. LET'S TALK, NEW YORK! (if you pronounce it like a REAL New Yorker, it rhymes!)

Conversations New York (www.conversationsnewyork.com) is a community of volunteers which has promoted more and better conversations among New Yorkers by such activities as an annual Conversation Day in Bryant Park, an on-line calendar featuring 1,000 conversations a year, and the first national symposium on The Power of Conversation held at Columbia University.
results.name: "BULLSHIT" - A Conversation with Ron Gross, #CNY

group.name: FREE IN NEW  YORK CITY :  FREE IN NYC :  FREE GIVEAWAY,EVENT

Kyle Simpson, speaker and author of the “You Don’t Know JavaScript” book series, will dig into new changes to JavaScript as of ES6.

The most important takeaway is that ES6 is not about new capabilities, but rather new expressivity. If your goal is to write cleaner, clearer, more understandable code—and it should be—ES6 offers myriad improvements that make our efforts so much more effective.

We’ll cover block scoping, rest/spread operators, defaults, destructuring, and template literals.

Tired of the rat race? We don't blame you...no need to worry!!! Come to our CashFlow in Jersey City and learn how to get out of the rat race while having fun.


During this game you will see how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the fast track where your money works for you instead of you working hard for money to pay liabilities. You will also have the opportunity to network with local successful real estate investors and learn from their strategies.


Use this game to practice real world investing with play money. Cashflow is an educational board game that teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time. It makes learning fun and is recommended for adults and children age 10 and older.

We create a perfect environment to meet new people, make friends, and learn to make smart financial decisions so you can get out of the rat race for good. This board game teaches people how to think like a successful real estate investor. It brings out your investment style and shows you why you are successful or not. It is Monopoly on Steroids.

We'll be doing a beginner to moderate after work hike at the Rockleigh Woods and Lamont Reserve (Bergen County, NJ) on Wed, April 20. The hike is only 2.3 miles.

Dogs are allowed on a leash. The hike will have some great views and a waterfall.

We will be finished before dark hits.

We'll meet at 6:20 PM at the back of the Rockleigh Municipal Building. Driving directions are below. I estimate the hike will take one and a half hours. My cell phone number is[masked]-4403.
Driving Directions:

Take the Palisades Interstate Parkway to Exit 4. Turn left at the bottom of the ramp onto Route 9W (if coming from the north, turn right onto Route 9W) and proceed for 1.1 miles, entering New York. At the next traffic light, turn left onto Oak Tree Road and, in 0.2 mile, turn left onto Closter Road. In 0.5 mile, after crossing under the Parkway, you reenter New Jersey, and the road becomes Rockleigh Road. Continue for another 0.2 mile to the Rockleigh Municipal Building (26 Rockleigh Road) and turn left into the driveway. Park in the rear of the building.

Mark Baker

-on-

What's new in Ubuntu 16.04 (Xenial Xerus)?

Note: WE ARE MEETING AT CIVIC HALL!! We'll need names, and you will need IDs. RSVP will open Wednesday Apr 6th, 2016, 4:30pm.

Mark Baker, Ubuntu Server and Cloud Product Manager at Canonical, will talk about the recently? (4/??/16) released Ubuntu LTS (Long Term Support) 16.04 Xenial Xerus, which, as an LTS release, will be supported for the next five years. 

Most importantly, Mark will answer the pressing question, "What is a Xerus?"
  In addition, Mark will be thoroughly reviewing  the major changes in 16.04, with a particular goal to explain why the changes are important and how they impact users, whether they are running Ubuntu in the cloud, on the desktop or in their pockets. 

Mark will also touch on some recent changes in Ubuntu's kernel maintenance policies, and other timely Ubuntu news.

Links:  
http://www.ubuntu.com/ 


Afterwards:
Join us afterwards at The Storehouse Pub where we'll continue the discussion over drinks and/or food. The Storehouse Pub is located at 69 W. 23rd Street.

Speaker Bio:
Mark is the Ubuntu server and cloud product manager at Canonical where he has spent the last 4 years helping drive the platform for next generation application delivery. Prior to Canonical Mark worked at MySQL and Red Hat where he enjoyed disrupting large Billion dollar incumbent technology companies. With OpenStack and Ubuntu Mark continues to have fun following this same path.

WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING 

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.

This mini pricing workshop is for portrait photography ONLY. We will NOT be discussing how to price your fine art or commercial work. That will be in a future meet up. 

Are you being paid what you're worth? Are you just starting out and have no idea what value to place on your services? Have you been running a business for a while but still struggle with pricing?

results.description:
6:30-7:00PM: Food & Mingling (no admission prior to 6:30) 

7:00-8:15PM: Snappy Data & Spark Streaming Talk & Demo

8:15-8:30PM: Wind down

Data scientists and developers alike have been inspired by the possibilities of using Spark Streaming for analytic stream processing applications. But the truth is that Spark Streaming lacks the robust data management capabilities that even moderately sophisticated applications require.


But with SnappyData as part of your solution, now you get the benefit of powerful data management capabilities such as data consistency and transactions, complex querying, and high availability - all at in-memory processing speed.


SnappyData is a new open source project that deeply integrates the Apache Geode in-memory data grid, an in-memory scale out SQL store, and Spark into a single unified cluster. This provides (i) low latency transactions, (ii) a new cluster manager capable of avoiding queuing and scheduling for low latency operations, (iii) and HA for all the components. This novel architecture transforms a spark cluster into a hybrid database with OLAP (compressed columnar tables) and OLTP tables with full HA and recovery. 


In this Meetup we'll discuss response time challenges with analytic queries on streams. We'll outline "Synopsis" synopses data structures available in SnappyData, such as stratified sampling, that reside along side "exact" data for fastest processing.  We'll also present our design pattern for an Analytics SQL cache that combines Apache Spark and the Greenplum DB as the backend to speed up interactive query processing while accommodating continuous streaming writes.  

We will demo Snappy working with Spark and Spark streaming, how to use them with the Spark programming model, and SQL/Spark Dataframe extensions for supporting approximate query processing.  We'll show how we achieve 10X performance gains of using SnappyData with Spark streaming compared to Cassandra and showcase similar gains when running OLAP queries on the ingested data compared to Spark SQL (using Stratified samples). 

ABOUT THE SPEAKER:

Jags is a founder and the CTO of SnappyData. Previously, Jags was the Chief Architect for “fast data” products at Pivotal and served in the extended leadership team of the company. At Pivotal and previously at VMWare, he led the technology direction for GemFire and other distributed in-memory products.

results.name: SnappyData - create robust analytic applications with Spark Streaming

results.description:
Book Description:


A breathless story of love and survival in war-torn Algeria-past and present
The devil has entered our country, and his footprints are everywhere.

Nine-year-old Jallal is old enough to know that his life in Algeria is precarious at best. Having run away from home, he survives by selling peanuts and single cigarettes on the street. The proposal by the elderly Swiss woman named Anna is shocking and preposterous: go to the mountains with her, as a translator, so she can find her lost lover from decades ago and pray over the graves of their murdered children.

Anna and Jallal's journey is wrought with danger and unspeakable tragedy. It was under similar circumstances that Anna first met the Arab Nasreddine. Ousted from the traveling circus where she performed as a trapeze artist, she had little choice but to accept Nasreddine's dangerous offer to live with him in a makeshift tent. But it was here, amid poverty, racism, and terrifyingly random violence, that they fell in love.

A best seller in France, The Lovers of Algeria is an unflinchingly candid story about a country where terrorism and government corruption are commonplace. As Anna and Nasreddine, beaten by time and memory, circle each other in Algeria, Anouar Benmalek shows with heart-wrenching detail that love can endure even the most inhuman conditions.
results.name: The Lovers of Algeria: A Novel by Anouar Benmalek

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

All our classes are compatible with a regular work schedule and our campus is conveniently located in Manhattan. This is not your traditional lecture class. Expect a healthy mix of group work, one-­on-­ones with mentors, and a hands­-on experience building your own digital product from end to end.

results.description:
The concept of chakra originates in Hindu texts and features in tantric and yogic traditions of Hinduism and Buddhism. Its name derives from the Sanskrit word for "wheel" or "turning" (cakraṃ चक्रं [ˈtʃəkrə̃], pronounced [ˈtʃəkrə] in Hindi; Pali: cakka चक्क, Thai: จักระ, Telugu: చక్రo, Tamil: சக்கரம், Kannada: ಚಕ್ರ, Chinese: 轮, Tibetan: འཁོར་ལོ་; khorlo).[1]

The chakras are believed to be a number of wheel-like vortices which, according to traditional Indian medicine, exist in the surface of the subtle body of living beings.[2] The chakras are said to be "force centers" or whorls of energy permeating, from a point on the physical body, the layers of the subtle bodies in an ever-increasing fan-shaped formation. Rotating vortices of subtle matter, they are considered focal points for the reception and transmission of energies.[3] Different belief systems posit a varying number of chakras; the best-known system in the West has seven chakras.

results.description:
We are thrilled to host a Coder Career Series every other Wednesday at Byte Academy. The events will help attendees brush up on programming on-the-job or land that perfect job. Regulars range from people who recently learned how to code, to developers at the New York area's top technology companies. Cracking the Coding Interview (5th or 6th edition) by Gayle Laakmann McDowell will be followed. Although the event will break individuals into groups to discuss the topics of choice, this session’s focus is Chapter 3. Chapters are non-cumulative, and coders of all different skills and languages are welcome.

The series will run every other Wednesday and is a joint event with the Fin-Tech Meetup, http://www.meetup.com/Byte-Academy-Finance-and-Technology-community/.

About Byte Academy: Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)
results.name: Algorithms and Interview Prep at Byte Academy

results.description:
Join DM Jonathan Rodgers at his first D&D adventure with Wildpig Comics!

A land ravaged by a war long past. Untold treasures and mysteries await out on an ever shifting Ocean. Will the sea claim another victim, or will you rise above to learn what the sea below claims?

    The War of the four planes caused massive destruction and mayhem on the land of Invariel for an untold number of years. Humans used as soldiers and pawns barely managed to survive the ordeal. The end came suddenly as the God of water pulled a drastic and world changing move. Breaking the boundary between the Water and material plane, Water began flooding the world drowning billions. Afterwards, the Gods fell silent,  leaving the world to rebuild. Millennia passed and order has been established in the form of a Monarchy on the only landmass of the world  The rest of the world is covered in a vast  ocean known to everyone as the Shifting Sea. For an unknown reason, landmasses rise and fall from within.  Navigation maps and navigators able to read and interpret the movement of these land masses is a necessity to traverse the waters of Invariel.


Due to the nature of the world, fire magic has been severely diminished. While fire is still available any arcane fire damage is halved

A campaign for 1st level. Focused on exploration and role playing.


In addition to the normal base classes, other classes allowed will be:
Blade Mage - https://www.dandwiki.com/wiki/Blade_Mage_%285e_Class%29
Elemental Assassin - https://www.dandwiki.com/wiki/Elemental_Assassin_%285e_Class%29
Gunslinger - https://www.dandwiki.com/wiki/Gunslinger,_Variant_%285e_Class%29
Psion - https://www.dandwiki.com/wiki/Psion_%28Discipline_Variant%29
Slayer - https://www.dandwiki.com/wiki/Slayer_%285e_Class%29

Untouchable Blade - https://www.dandwiki.com/wiki/Untouchable_Blade_%285e_Class%29

results.description:
New York Times bestseller, “When Breath Becomes Air”, by Paul Kalanithi chronicles the author’s transformation from a naïve medical student “possessed by the question, given that all organisms die, of what makes a virtuous and meaningful life”? Paul, an aspiring neurosurgeon at Stanford working in the brain, that most critical place for human identity, becomes a patient and a new father confronting his own mortality.


We’ll explore what makes life worth living in the face of death. What do we do when the future, no longer a ladder toward our goals in life, flattens out into a present that now sees an ending? Are we allowing the fear of death to rob us of being fully alive?


These are some of the questions that we’ll be addressing over four Wednesday evenings as we discuss how we or our loved ones can “go on”, or in popular parlance “keep on keeping on”, particularly when facing a terminal illness prognosis. We invite you to bring your personal insights, your questions, even your doubts and fears as we take hope from the author as he quotes Samuel Beckett’s famous 7 words: “I can’t go on. I’ll go on.”

facebook event
https://www.facebook.com/events/957739621014139/ Launch of NEW YORK CACHAÇA CINEMA CLUB.
US Premiere of Yorimatã, award-winning Brazilian music documentary | Cachaça tastings by Avuá Cachaça An introductory talk about the film and the role of Umbanda religion in Brazilian counterculture by Alex Minkin of Ticún Brasil. Suggested donation: $15/$10 (general/students) 6:30PM

ABOUT THE FILM:
Yorimatã, Brazil,116 min, 2014. Directed by Rafael Saar.

Luhli and Lucina, Gilberto Gil, Ney Matogrosso, Zélia Duncan and more in documentary on Brazilian independent music scene in the 70s and role of Umbanda, a Brazilian syncretic religion, in artistic creation.

In the 1970s, at the time of hippie movement, Luhli and Lucina live in an alternative community and dedicate themselves to radical musical experimentation; they become pioneers in Brazilian independent music scene. Having written more than 800 pieces, using guitars and other instruments such as self-made drums, they say "no" to record labels and dive into Umbanda, Brazilian syncretic religion, and into artistic creation. They form a love triangle with photographer Luiz Fernando Borges da Fonseca who films their lives. This footage, the independent recordings of their concerts and personal life, recreate their spiritual-musical universe in a film about freedom and search for Brazilian primitive cultural roots. The cast includes Gilberto Gil, Ney Matogrosso, Zélia Duncan and other prominent personalities of the history of Brazilian popular music.
results.name: US Premiere of Yorimatã, Brazilian Music Documentary | Cachaça tastings

Please join us on April 20th to network with startups and investors at our monthly pitch night. For more details please RSVP on the link here: https://districtpitch.splashthat.com/

We will have press attending to scope out start-up stories so it's a great forum for upcoming startups to network and not only get investor access but also media exposure! If you have a start-up and want to pitch please apply here.

We will be inviting all applicants to our VC mentorship hours in April. Please spread the word to your start-up friends!

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.comand several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

NYSN founder Dave Cervini goes back to his radio roots for a super fun trip back in time trip to a make believe 1980's pop/alternative radio show live at Lexington's at The Cort Hotel! This is actually our normal Wednesday Happy Hour with a little twist!  Dave will be at the DJ booth and play 4 hours of great 80's music as if it was an actual radio show from April 20th 1989 complete with entertainment reports, commercials and of course the best music from the 80's decade!  We will also have special 80's themed ice breaker games, drink specials and more!

Between 1988 and 2003 Dave was on 102.3 (Long Island) and 105.1 & 103.5 here in NYC.  Over the years those stations had many formats but the most fun was the 80's music!  This is going to be a fun night to socialize, meet new people, reminisce, and hear some fun tunes.  Feel free to dress up in your favorite 80's gear!

Here is how it works:

-Come anytime between 6pmand 8pm for the best socializing.

-Drink specials are until 8pm

-Ice breakers happen at 7:30pm

Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the party.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending usually come on their own

Dress code:  Business casual
results.name: Dave Cervini's 1980's Rockin' Radio Show & Happy Hour

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for thirteen years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

results.description:
To CJK Experts and Native Speakers:

We practice like this (including, but not limited to):

Session 1 (7pm-8pm): Interpretation methods practice

For example, words, phrases or sentences interpretation, target language repeating, shadowing and summarization, etc.

We set  tables to practice Chinese, English and Korean separately (Japanese is on hiatus due to low membership). The session is basically for intermediate & above Chinese, English, and Korean learners.

Session 2 (8pm-9pm): Topic-based speaking practice

Summary, speak or discuss the topic you are provided or you have prepared by your target language (Chinese & Korean).

Also, everybody can move to any table as they want. If you would like to practice English, or Chinese those tables will be running simultaneously at the same location by Jaewan and Yi, respectively

How to find us...

Go to 53rd street and Lexington Ave. The building is across the street from a CVS pharmacy on 53rd St, there are two main entrances. The top entrance in the picture is on 53rd St between Lexington avenue and 3rd avenue. The bottom entrance is on the corner of 53rd St and Lexington avenue. The building is called the Citigroup Center but the area where we sit is also called the Atrium Shops and Cafes. Which is located on the bottom floor: a big open area which has many round and square tables and chairs. The ZIP CODE is 10022. If you still have problems finding us look for a high rise glass building. Barnes and Nobles and 24 Hr Fitness are also located in the same building except on the upper level. If you enter on the upper levels then take the escalator down to ground floor where all the people and tables are. There is also a  GRAND BLACK PIANO.

Looking forward to practicing with you all!

Organizers
results.name: Regular Interpretation & Speaking KOREAN-HANGUL Practice

group.name: Chinese, Japanese, Korean (CJK) + English, Practice & Social
