results.description:
Celebrate the Sun’s transit into Taurus with gentle harmonious movement. Experience the fascinating unity of a circle of people moving together in a eurythmy Circle led by Soulful Wizardess Marta Stemberger. We’ll move gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry. Register early http://bit.ly/move-circle. Space allows only up to 12 people.
$18 paid in advance via PayPal with credit or debit card
$20 at the door (cash only) if there is room.


The Sun enters the constellation of Taurus on April 19. The orange Bull offers humanity the gift of the consonant R. This air sound rolls with brightness in some languages, and gives us some grounding in English. Now is the time to have fun while expanding the projects we began in March and April. 

 
- Move some gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry
- Learn to move the eurythmy gestures for the consonant R and the vowel O
- Listen to a short talk about Taurus, and the sounds R and O 

 
Open to all who can walk. No prior movement experience is needed. We’ll simply breathe and flow in harmony with the sound and each other. 

 
Please wear loose fitting clothes with long-sleeved tops and long loose pants or skirts. The tops should allow you to freely move arms all the way up, and still cover your belly area. We’ll move barefoot. No slippery socks or footwear please.  


For more info visit and to register visit http://bit.ly/move-circle.
results.name: Eurythmy Circle and Talk: EXPAND AND HAVE FUN

results.description:
Our last Battle Of The Sexes Trivia Meetup was our biggest one yet!

As seen on NY1 News and more! This is a singles gaming trivia event. We will put together teams of 3-5 and you will work as a team to answer trivia questions. 

*THIS SELLS OUT EVERY TIME, SO RSVP & GET TIX ASAP (ESPECIALLY WOMEN) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Apr-20-2016_at_0700PM

Trivia is a perfect "non-pressure" activity where you can gauge as to how smart, attractive, creative and collaborative your "teammates" are and perhaps find a potential future "mate". 

The winning team each round receives a FREE round of shots! After each round, we'll switch up teams so you get to meet the majority of singles in attendance.

What to expect:

• Complimentary Appetizers

• All-Night Drink Specials

• Free round of shots for the winning team after each round

• Overall men & women's trivia champ receives a free round

 *50% off tix for group members ($15 - regular price $30)

*MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Apr-20-2016_at_0700PM

RSVPing alone will not get you into this event. You must also purchase a ticket in advance.  (Tickets will NOT be sold at door). This is non-ethnic specific and will be mostly 20s-40s.

Multiple Meetup groups are promoting this event so don't just go by the RSVPs you see here. We'll have up to 50 members attending - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Apr-20-2016_at_0700PM
results.name: Singles Trivia Night w/ Comp Apps (Must Prepay)

results.description:
ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!! Turf shoes and indoor shoes are ay-okay.  

Permit Disclosure: We have a permit.

PLEASE BRING A WHITE SHIRT, A DARK SHIRT & A BRIGHT COLORED SHIRT

Game Host - JJ

Co-leader - JP Matiz

Location -We're playing outdoor at John Murray Playground in Long Island City.

PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 6:45pM!! Teams will be picked from this time.

Rules:


Fun Play 
No Sliding 
Goals after half point only. 
Kick-ins.. no throw ins. 
Corner kicks. 
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect PS2G plays clean soccer! This means no cursing, insulting, complaining, arguing or fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style or if you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

***BRING TURF SHOES OR SNEAKERS & A DARK, WHITE & A BRIGHT COLORED SHIRT*** 

AGAIN - NO CLEATS ALLOWED!

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)


If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free.

http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: Wednesday 645PM CO-ED Soccer @ LIC (7v7 x2games 1 hr) for PS2G

group.name: PS2G NYC-Coed Soccer Pickup for Charity -Play Soccer 2 Give

results.description:
Caetano Veloso and Gilberto Gil are going to play in Brooklyn. Let's go?  The show starts at 8pm. We will meet at 7pm at BAM Cafe for some drinks, and head to the show afterwards.


Two Friends, One Century of Music

Two major artists of the 20th century—Caetano Veloso, arguably Brazil’s greatest contemporary songwriter, and Gilberto Gil, the renowned Brazilian guitarist and singer who led the 1960s Tropicália movement with Veloso and others—come together for a celebration of music and friendship. In this rare convergence over two evenings, these hugely influential, Grammy Award-winning musicians perform songs from throughout their prolific careers, reflecting on everything from the revolutionary spirit of Tropicália and the early days of their friendship to the myriad influences that have pervaded both of their distinct sonic palettes.

Tickets start at $35. For more information and to buy yours, check http://www.bam.org/music/2016/caetano-veloso-and-gilberto-gil

There will be another show on Thu 4/21.

I hope to see you there on Wed!

Aparecida Teixeira
results.name: Caetano & Gil in concert - sold out (check the theater for more information)

group.name: The New York Brazilian Portuguese Meetup Group

results.description:
Byte Academy is thrilled to host a Coder Career Series every other Wednesday with the Problem Solving Practice for Coders group.

The events will help attendees brush up on programming on-the-job or land that perfect job.  Regulars range from people who recently learned how to code, to developers at the New York area's top technology companies.

Cracking the Coding Interview (5th or 6th edition) by Gayle Laakmann McDowell will be followed.  Although the event will break individuals into groups to discuss the topics of choice, this session’s focus is Chapter 15.  Coders of all different skills and languages are welcome.

We will host this meet up group every other Wednesday which is a joint event with the Algorithms & Interview Prep Problem Solving Practice for Coders Meetup http://www.meetup.com/problemsolving/

About Byte Academy:  Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive a $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)

results.description:
We're inviting all single Manhattan professionals ages 25-45 to join us at popular Midtown hot spot House of Brews for a casual after-work networking social and speedmeeting social.

This gathering is for professionals who have completed or are currently pursuing an advanced or specialty degree i.e. Masters, MBA, PhD, Paralegal, JD, or other specialized certificate program.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 - prepay only (we need approximate head count in advance)

http://advdegspeedmeet.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Schedule:

7pm -  Check in and mingle (Please try to check in by 7:30pm) Appetizers served from 7-7:30 or until gone.

7pm-8:00pm - Icebreaker & Mingle

8:00-8:30pm - A select amount of 3 minute speed rounds with other guests of the opposite sex.

8:30-9pm - More mingling

How it works:

-Arrive at House of Brews for socializing, cocktails and registration. You'll be given a name tag and your host will write your name and industry. You will also be given a sheet of paper that you can use to write down the names of people you met.

-Get your ice breaker piece to use for the mingling portion of  the happy hour.

-After the happy hour portion ends, you'll be seated and have a select amount of 3 minute "meet ups" with other guests.

-You'll turn in your sheet of paper where you've swritten down the names of people you wish to see again and you'll turn the sheet into the host. You will be able to choose betweem Friendship, Dating, and Professional (or all three!) as your preferred connection. If you have any mutual matches, we'll email you the email address of your matches within 48 hours.

ALL GUESTS ARE WELCOME TO EXCHANGE BUSINESS CARDS AND CONTACT INFO!

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

Dress code?  Be comfortable but keep it neat.

What is included?  $20 includes admission to the event,drink specials, and platters of appetizers served from 7-7:30pm or until gone.
results.name: Advanced Degree Singles  Social - Ages 25-45

results.description:
EVERY Wednesday Night!

New York City's hottest open mic in the heart of Queens' cultural mecca and in the homiest underground spot around - one level downstairs in the Q4 Hotel in Long Island City.

Produced by the long-running independent performance series, The Inspired Word (http://inspiredwordnyc.com), which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO Def Poetry stars, this open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - musicians, comedians, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, storytellers, performance artists, dancers, etc.

20 performance slots, 6-minute time limit for anything spoken, 7 minutes for anything musical. **Note to musicians: If you have backing tracks, bring them on an mp3 player or smartphone. Note to piano/keyboard players: You must bring your own keyboard.**

We are dedicated to celebrating the best of Queens' performing arts and developing a warm local artistic community. 

NO AGE RESTRICTIONS.

*****

When: Every Wednesday Night

Where: Q4 Hotel
http://www.q4hotel.com/

29-09 Queens Plaza N.
Long Island City, NYC

Time: 7pm sharp

Admission: $7 online for solo performer or audience member, $10 at the door

This is a very popular open mic. You can pay online or at the door, but we STRONGLY suggest you purchase a ticket in advance to guarantee a performance slot.

*****

By subway, take the E to Queens Plaza, N/Q/7 to Queensboro Plaza.

*****

Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word

http://inspiredwordnyc.com

"It's not just a series...It's a movement."

#SupportLiveArtsNYC
results.how_to_find_us: Go to front desk and ask where the downstairs stairwell is to the open mic.
results.name: Wednesday Night Open Mic @ Q4 Hotel - Music, Poetry, Comedy, Spoken Word

group.name: The Inspired Word NYC Open Mic - Poetry, Music, Comedy

venue.name: High School on Center Blvd (aka Academy for Careers in Television and Film)

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).
results.how_to_find_us: High School on Center Blvd (aka Academy for Careers in Television and Film)  1-50 51st Ave, Long Island City, NY
results.name: Mens Indoor Pick-up Basketball in Long Island City

group.name: LIC Hoops - Men's Indoor Pickup Basketball in Hunters Point

results.description:
You’re a deep thinker, and you probably have a ton of questions about God, the Bible, and faith in general. Excellent — this is just the group for you. Whether you are a committed believer, a seeker, an agnostic or atheist, or you are a part of another faith, this is a fun and safe place to look for answers. We’ll gather for snacks, friendship, and to discuss some of the most intriguing questions out there.

Week 1: Is there evidence for God's existence?
Week 2: Is there evidence for the trustworthiness of Genesis? (Creation, Flood, Genealogies, etc.)
Week 3: Is Bible prophecy proof for the Bible?
Week 4: How do we know that Jesus was really sent from God?

Besides these four major questions, this will be a great context to bring up many of the other questions you’ve had. You'll learn of some excellent sources for finding answers, voice your thoughts, and hear the thoughts of others on these fascinating topics. Hope to see you there, and feel free to invite your friends along.

Wednesdays, 7:00-8:30pm April 13 - May 4th (4 weeks). Latecomers welcome!
Location: Midtown Manhattan, IBM Plaza (590 Madison Ave. @ 57th Street)
Contact: Beau ([masked])
results.name: Answering Tough Questions

results.description:
The Fixers' Collective(fixerscollective.org) is holding a fixing session at Hack Manhattan!

Bring something to fix, or help fix things. All are welcome, whether you have something to fix or just want to observe and watch.

We encourage people to bring in their items early, so we can devote the most time to the item.  If you arrive in the middle of a fix, we’ll try to accommodate you as best as we can.

results.description:
Deep inside each one of us is the power of our heart. We are holding the key to knowledge of the past, present and future. Together we are learning, or more exactly remembering how to “unlock the gate” to our heart.

People have a hard time accessing this information and knowledge due to emotional traumas. Through the meditations, exercises and techniques brought to us by Drunvalo Melchizedek we will work on the heeling process of emotional traumas, finding a way back into the heart.

The heart is holding the key to all knowledge. Creating from the heart in UNITY brings us into a level of consciousness. HOW IT WOULD BE TO CREATE IN EVERY MOMENT YOUR OWN REALITY? How would this change your life?

Remembering we are ONE, all connected in the same consciousness, is the power we all need during the Ascension Process as we shift from the 3rd dimension into higher dimensions.

Come and join us in our quest for Truth, Peace, Light, Harmony, Love and Trust with Reverence for ALL.

Love and Light, In ONE SPIRIT.

Michelle
results.how_to_find_us: Contact Michelle Pacheco  - mihapach@gmail.com
results.name: Awakening the power of your heart - The path to a higher consciousness

group.name: New York Spiritual Growth, Meditation, and Breathwork Meetup

venue.name: Bread & Butter at 29 St. and Park Ave. Manhattan, Upstairs

results.description:
Truth is at best partial, at worst error. We are at best explorers, at worst believers. If we desire to fully grow we must keep exploring. . . Welcome Explorers! (And curious believers too!)

This is a group for exploring and testing each other's new ideas, and for the potential of creating even more together!

As a starting point we'll discuss the possibility of:

A natural morality based on our passion's values;

A politics that roots out resentment so we can enjoy

a unified diversity;

And a culture of 7 billion honest individuals---

with not one truth!

 

This morality, politics, and culture have one goal: That we each flourish--that we each fully bloom into all that we are--together.

 

Can it happen? Should it happen? What do you propose? Let's talk about it!

 

 

Note: Ripple Effect Photo by Segiu Bacioiu.
results.how_to_find_us: 29th St. & Park Avenue, Manhattan
results.name: Supplement: our new medium of exchange.

group.name: Exploring New Ideas in Morality, Politics, and Culture NYC

results.description:
Who wants to come hang out and play with some new apps and gadgets? We at ideaphore hope the answer is you. 

Bring your laptop, tablet, smartphone, and/or your curiosity for all things tech. We'll bring the pizza, beverages, and tech. RSVP early. 

If anyone wants to contribute to the "shut up and take my money" segment, real products or not, we'd love that. Just shoot us a message through meetup or email info -at- ideapho.re 

Looking forward to seeing you there.

Funnster

Making fun stuff happen. 

That's all you need to know for now O_O

 Brooklyness designs and markets intelligent products for urban mobility. We can't wait to play with and discuss their latest creation with all of you. 

ideaphore

That's right, our very own ideaphore open innovation platform is expanding. We're launching a whole new wing for our web app in April and we want you all to be among the first to play with it and give us feedback.

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Greetings Success Seekers,

I hope you're all doing well!  We've officially reached the start of the 2nd Quarter of 2016 and I've decided that it's time to check in with each of you to see how you've progressed with bringing your 2016 vision to life. You are cordially invited to attend our Vision 2016 - Q1 Recap Session.  We'll talk career goals, family goals, or whichever goals you're focused on for the year.

When we met in January, we each set a goal of making 2016 awesome! For those of you who were unable to finish your Vision Boards at our event, I hope you were able to complete it shortly thereafter.  If not, I strongly recommend setting aside some time in the coming days to get it done.

For those who weren't able to make the first one, I still encourage attending our next session and sharing some of your goals with us.

This event is free and will be held in the same location as the first Vision Meet Up.  The goal of the recap session is to allow you to celebrate any achievements from the first quarter of the year, and to give you an opportunity to re-focus on the goals that you've set for 2016.

Please RSVP to ensure that you are included on the Guest List given to the Reception Desk. Thanks for your continued support!

Rudy R. Racine
CEO/Founder
HireLearners
(E) [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the Ziegfield North Conference Room where the first Vision Board event was held
results.name: Vision 2016 - Q1 Vision Board Recap Meeting

results.description:
Celebrate the Sun’s transit into Taurus with gentle harmonious movement. Experience the fascinating unity of a circle of people moving together in a eurythmy Circle led by Soulful Wizardess Marta Stemberger. We’ll move gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry. Register early http://bit.ly/move-circle. Space allows only up to 12 people.

$18 paid in advance via PayPal with credit or debit card

$20 at the door (cash only) if there is room.

The Sun enters the constellation of Taurus on April 19. The orange Bull offers humanity the gift of the consonant R. This air sound rolls with brightness in some languages, and gives us some grounding in English. Now is the time to have fun while expanding the projects we began in March and April.

- Move some gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry

- Learn to move the eurythmy gestures for the consonant R and the vowel O

- Listen to a short talk about Taurus, and the sounds R and O

Open to all who can walk. No prior movement experience is needed. We’ll simply breathe and flow in harmony with the sound and each other.

Please wear loose fitting clothes with long-sleeved tops and long loose pants or skirts. The tops should allow you to freely move arms all the way up, and still cover your belly area. We’ll move barefoot. No slippery socks or footwear please.

For more info visit and to register visit http://bit.ly/move-circle.
results.name: Eurythmy Circle and Talk: EXPAND AND HAVE FUN

group.name: "Cosmic Health NYC - Meditation, Breathe, Spirit, Light"

Please wear loose fitting clothes with long-sleeved tops and long loose pants or skirts. The tops should allow you to freely move arms all the way up, and still cover your belly area. We’ll move barefoot. No slippery socks or footwear please.


For more info visit and to register visit http://bit.ly/move-circle.

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, March 30th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The April session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (March 30th - April 20th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (March 30th - April 20th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (March 29th - April 19th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor & make a left. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.
results.name: Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino Classes!

results.description:
Time to kick off the NYCJS Meetups for 2016!

From Spotify to SoundCloud, audio is more popular than ever! Want to learn more about HTML5 Audio and the Web Audio API? Interested in adding movie quality audio to your web sites, apps or games? This talk is for you! Titus Blair will walk you through coding an app using HTML5 Audio and the Web Audio API with movie quality, premium audio. You will leave with the ability to start building your own web sites, apps or games with HTML5 Audio and the Web Audio API.

About the Author:
Titus Blair is the developer evangelist for Dolby Technologies. He is a family man, world traveler and hacker who successfully built a million dollar ecommerce business as well as mobile apps with downloads in the millions. He started coding as a teenager and became a college professor at age 18 teaching programming and computer animation. He is a frequent speaker at conferences and meetups in silicon valley where he teaches developers how to build + grow + market amazing sites, apps and games.

===================
If you're working on a web app that leverages Web Audio you can Dolby Digital Plus and get a chance to win $10,000! https://bit.ly/dolby10kchallenge
results.name: Harness the power of Web Audio

results.description:
Comic time! This week: Twilight and Big Macintosh, and Rainbow Dash and Fluttershy.  So pack your books and come over to this week's meetup for Friends Forever #17 and #18(descriptions and download links below) 

http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/e/e0/Friends_Forever_issue_17_sub_cover.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150318052507

Friends Forever #17

At the Castle of Friendship, Twilight Sparkle struggles to solve the increasing pile of friendship problem requests that she gets in the mail. Though she is determined to carry out her duties as the Princess of Friendship, her workload is causing her stress and depriving her of sleep. From Spike, Twilight gets the idea to talk with other ponies and see how they handle work-related stress. Twilight tries to talk to Applejack, but Applejack is about to make a delivery of apples to Canterlot and will be gone for a week. She suggests that Twilight talk to Big Macintosh, who's an even harder worker than she is.

Written by: Ted Anderson
Artwork by: Brenda Hickey

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friends-Forever-17/digital-comic/243628

http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/2/22/Friends_Forever_issue_18_cover_A.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150422044602

Friends Forever #18

Rainbow Dash is in the middle of practicing speed-flying, with Fluttershy timing her, when the two of them receive invitations to their flight camp reunion in Cloudsdale. Rainbow is excited to be showered with praise by her old camp mates, but Fluttershy has reservations about going, having bad memories of being teased at camp.


Written by: Christina Rice
Artwork by: Jay P. Fosgitt

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friends-Forever-18/digital-comic/250017

******************************************************

Due to colder weather we will be meeting at the Atrium rather than the usual place in Central Park.

601 Lexington Ave – Btw. 52nd & 53rd Street – Take the 6 train to 51st Street. The building itself is actually connected to the 53rd Street E/M/6 MTA subway station and is one of New York's largest skyscrapers.
results.name: Mlp Comic Book Reading-Relaxing and Exercising Edition

results.description:
Join us as we "learn through play" a term used in education and psychology to describe how we can learn to make sense of the world around us(using both English and Korean). This game will be a fun and comfortable process.

Also, It is our beloved Obi's birthday, we will be celebrating this special time with her, so come along.

Admission is $5

Please fill free to bring snacks, drinks, plates or cups to share with others. The KLCEM Team will also serve some tasty food.

안녕하세요 다음 주에는 교육연극에서 배웠던 재미있었던 게임을 통한 언어, 역할놀이 등을 할 계획입니다(드디어 제 전공발휘하나요~) 처음으로 하는거라 저도 기대가 많은데 많은 분들의 적극적인 참여 부탁드립니다. 회비는 $5이고 마실 음료, 과자 등 함께 나눌 수 있는 다과가지고 와주세요~ 돌아오는 수요밋업, KLCEM프로그램을 통해 여러분이 더 많은 친구들과 언어의 장벽을 허물 수 있는 기회가 될 수 있도록 최선을 다해서 프로그래밍하도록 하겠습니다. 주말 잘 보내시고 다음 주에 뵈용!!!(아싸 좀 있음 외모지상주의 뜬당^^)

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.comand several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

NYSN founder Dave Cervini goes back to his radio roots for a super fun trip back in time trip to a make believe 1980's pop/alternative radio show live at Lexington's at The Cort Hotel! This is actually our normal Wednesday Happy Hour with a little twist!  Dave will be at the DJ booth and play 4 hours of great 80's music as if it was an actual radio show from April 20th 1989 complete with entertainment reports, commercials and of course the best music from the 80's decade!  We will also have special 80's themed ice breaker games, drink specials and more!

Between 1988 and 2003 Dave was on 102.3 (Long Island) and 105.1 & 103.5 here in NYC.  Over the years those stations had many formats but the most fun was the 80's music!  This is going to be a fun night to socialize, meet new people, reminisce, and hear some fun tunes.  Feel free to dress up in your favorite 80's gear!

Here is how it works:

-Come anytime between 6pmand 8pm for the best socializing.

-Drink specials are until 8pm

-Ice breakers happen at 7:30pm

Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the party.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending usually come on their own

Dress code:  Business casual
results.name: Dave Cervini's 1980's Rockin' Radio Show & Happy Hour

ABOUT NEW VOICES IN BLACK CINEMA

New Voices in Black Cinema (NVBC) returns for its sixth (6th) year with narrative features, documentaries, and shorts that redefine the black experience in America and around the world.

Presented in partnership with BAMCinematek, NVBC is a multi-genre film festival of quality movies geared towards getting audiences to appreciate and support quality, independent films from, by, and starring the African and Latino diasporas. The further purpose of this series is to give filmmakers the opportunity to showcase their talent on a grand stage where they can develop opportunities for limited distribution and create buzz for future industry contacts.

results.description:
FANTASTIC FICTION at KGB reading series, hosts Ellen Datlow and Matthew Kressel present:

Elizabeth Bear was born on the same day as Frodo and Bilbo Baggins, but in a different year. She is the Hugo, Sturgeon, Locus, and Campbell Award winning author of 27 novels (The most recent is Karen Memory, a Weird West adventure from Tor) and over a hundred short stories.

&

Scott Lynch was born in Minnesota in 1978. He has been a World Fantasy Award, Campbell Award, and Locus Award nominee, and won a British Fantasy Award in 2008. His most recent novel, The Republic of Thieves, was a New York Times, Times of London, and USA Today best seller. His forthcoming novel, The Thorn of Emberlain, continues the story that began in 2006 with The Lies of Locke Lamora.

Wednesday, April 20th, 2016, 7pm at KGB Bar, 85 East 4th Street (just off 2nd Ave, upstairs.) http://www.kgbfantasticfiction.org/ Subscribe to our mailing list: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/kgbfantasticfiction/ Readings are always free. Please forward to friends at your own discretion.
results.name: Fantastic Fiction at KGB - Elizabeth Bear & Scott Lynch

results.description:
Register on our site to reserve your seat:

http://civicrm.fatcatfablab.org/civicrm/event/register?reset=1&id=16

Cost: $50 for members, $75 for non-members.

We'll start with a prepared g-code file and cover the basic usage and safety for our Camaster Stinger 1 CNC machine.

Prerequisites:  There aren't any prerequisites for the class, but know that without prior CAD/CAM knowledge and a post-processor for our machine, you may not get to use this information on your own projects for a while.

Please note, you may cancel your class booking up to 24 hours before the event. Value can not be refunded, but credited towards a future class of the same type.

FYI we're using Autodesk Fusion 360 for CAD/CAM and will have classes on that in the future. Let us know what CAD/CAM you have and we'll check with Camaster for a post.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the "Spy Store" sign.
results.name: CNC Class: basic usage and safety

results.description:
Alan Watts puts forward a worldview, drawing on Hinduism, Chinese philosophy, Zen Buddhism, panentheism, and modern science, in which he maintains that the whole universe consists of a cosmic self playing hide-and-seek (Lila), hiding from itself (Maya) by becoming all the living and non-living things in the universe, forgetting what it really is; the upshot being that WE ARE ALL IT in disguise. In this worldview, Watts asserts that our conception of ourselves as an "ego in a bag of skin" is a myth; the entities we call the separate "things" are merely processes of the whole.   en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Watts#Worldview

Please listen to these two short selections and let's see where the discussion takes us! 

Fascinated by Maya {8.5 min}
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JlfVjKzyN5Y

The Dream Of Life {3.5 min}
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wU0PYcCsL6o
results.name: Fascinated by Maya & The Dream Of Life

results.description:
RAVENLOFT RETURNS!

Join us for the launch of a brand new season of D&D Encounters! Ravenloft, the classic D&D setting of gothic horror, rises from the grave as we begin with the exclusive Adventure’s League adventures leading up to Death House. This is a 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons game for 6 players. Reserving a seat is no charge, but players pay a $10 door fee. Adventurer’s League passes can be purchases for $80, which cover 10 sessions of play.

In order to RSVP, players must go to our registration page and sign up for a specific table. Be sure to read the description to find out if the table matches your experience level! Be warned that signing up on this Meetup page does NOT guarantee a player a spot at a table.

Register here: bstrat.eventsmart.com

Play begins around 7:30pm and ends at 10:30pm. Late arrivals and early exits should try to notify their DM in advance, but are rarely a problem.

We will be creating characters during this first session and then running a three-week introduction to the game, a perfect opportunity for players who are looking to begin a fresh new campaign. Players are welcome to bring ideas for their character, or even build a 1st level character in advance and help the newer members. Character sheets, pencils, paper, dice, miniatures, and battlemaps are all provided by the store; copies of rulebooks are available to borrow, but are limited by supply. Players are welcome to bring their own gaming supplies as well as snacks and beverages.

Encounters welcomes brand-new players every week, so don’t hesitate to jump into one of our Beginner-level tables with no prior RPG experience!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Curse of Strahd

results.description:
WHAT IS HRCS (HUDSON RIVER COMMUNITY SAILING)

We're a 501(c)3 nonprofit community sailing center.  We offer a year round afterschool program,  dozens of youth internship positions.  We also have an adult sailing club membership and offer public lessons.  Our programs include youth development, youth racing, public sails and lessons, adaptive sailing, cruising courses, senior sailing, group events, regattas and more.

WHO'S THIS FOR

This event is for people who have been a long time sailor, used to sail often, or have outdoor guiding experience and want to bring their passion to the water. 


WHY

Being a sailing instructor is the most fun you can have in New York City.  Instructors receive paid training, access to our fleet of sailboats and get to join a fun community. Schedules are flexible with opportunities for day-time, evening and weekend instructing with minimal commitment. 

WHAT'LL HAPPEN

At the event you’ll get to meet and connect with other outdoor and sailing enthusiasts.  We'll explain the steps to becoming an instructor.  And yes, there will be snacks.  Afterwards, we’ll migrate to a local bar.  


FACEBOOK.....

Want to invite more Friends?  You can send them this Facebook Event invite:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1710481432555927/
results.name: Captain & Instructor Recruitment Party

Our last Battle Of The Sexes Trivia Meetup was our biggest one yet!

As seen on NY1 News and more! This is a singles gaming trivia event. We will put together teams of 3-5 and you will work as a team to answer trivia questions. 

*THIS SELLS OUT EVERY TIME, SO RSVP & GET TIX ASAP (ESPECIALLY WOMEN) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Apr-20-2016_at_0700PM

Trivia is a perfect "non-pressure" activity where you can gauge as to how smart, attractive, creative and collaborative your "teammates" are and perhaps find a potential future "mate". 

The winning team each round receives a FREE round of shots! After each round, we'll switch up teams so you get to meet the majority of singles in attendance.

What to expect:

• Complimentary Appetizers

• All-Night Drink Specials

• Free round of shots for the winning team after each round

• Overall men & women's trivia champ receives a free round

 *50% off tix for group members ($15 - regular price $30)

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.
results.name: Live Model Drawing - Union Square

results.description:
OK guys. And gals.

Let's do it.

Julia Cameron tells us: "There are a number of ways to use this book. Most of all, I invite you to use it creatively." So lets do that!

For this Meetup, we'll be discussing Chapter One: Recovering a Sense of Safety from our beloved book The Artist's Way. Then the following time we meet.....you guessed it; we'll be going through the second chapter. (Chapters are usually spaced out by a week, but that's where our creativity comes in -- by stretching that out over time :). 

This is going to be a bit of a pilot program...let's see how it goes. 

Try and read through chapter one BEFORE we meet. If you're not able to, then I guess it's no big deal. But if you can -- how glorious it will be when we all come together to discuss!

And finally, if we have time at the end, we'll work through an exercise together.

Amazing. Can't wait!
results.name: Discussing Chapter 1: Recovering a Sense of Safety

results.description:
On this 4/20, come to The Alchemist's Kitchen for an evening of education on medical marijuana and CBD by Dr. Julie Holland and Jeremy Wolff, followed by Cannabinoid Storytelling led by Lex Pelger.
The psychiatrist Julie Holland edited "The Pot Book” and wrote "Moody Bitches.” Her husband, the international photographer Jeremy Wolff authored the excellent cannabis essay "Thots on Pot.” They'll be sharing about the medical potential of marijuana and then taking questions from the audience. It's a wonderful chance for a free consultation with two experts.

Then they'll kick off our Cannabinoid Storytelling segment of the evening with their own stories about an important event in their life mediated by cannabis. Moderated by Lex Pelger, a local drug writer & host of Psymposia, we will feature more cannabis storytellers as well as taking submissions from the audience. If you have a pot story to share - beautiful, bad or strange - bring it along and we'll try to get you in front of the microphone.

This event marks the official launch of the Bowery Cannabis Club, located at The Alchemist’s Kitchen. BCC is an educational community forum for people interested in and engaged with the health and wellness aspects of the cannabis plant.

Tickets
$10 Online
$15 Door

Purchase: https://420cbdandmedicalmarijuana.splashthat.com/
results.name: What You Need To Know About CBD and Medical Marijuana

results.description:
Soldering Wednesday is the perfect open event if you don't have a project - drop by, pick up a kit, and make something cool with our members at your side.

No obligation to buy a kit - bring your own project and hack with the MakerBar community.

Current kit menu:

The TV-B-Gone - A universal remote that turns off any television. ANY TV. Reduce distractions at the bar, cause havoc at Best Buy, and feel like a superhero. Exclusive MakerBar Swag Edition developed by members! - $30 - 2 Hours - Medium Difficulty

The Joule Thief - A super-bright flashlight that runs on dead batteries. WHAT?! Exclusive MakerBar Swag Edition developed by members! - $10 - 1 Hour - Easy Difficulty

The Sonic Pencil - A pencil that makes extraordinarily silly sounds as you draw. Great soldering and fun for kids and adults. Exclusive MakerBar Swag Edition based on Drawdio open hardware! - $20 - 1.5 Hours - Easy Difficulty

XProtolab - An entire electronics bench on a circuit smaller than most erasers. Snaps into a breadboard and features a dual-channel oscilloscope, logic analyzer, FFT, voltmeter... Dense surface-mount soldering with special components means you'll use special toys to build it! Expert solderers only. Yes, it actually works; you can try ours first. - $35 - 3 Hours - Extreme Difficulty

Soldering Wednesday is open to the public and repeats on the third Wednesday of every month. The event is organized by Travis Jones.

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.] 


MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.  

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar

results.description:
Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.
results.name: Wednesday Evening Tennis at Lincoln Park

results.description:
We'll meet in front of MP Taverna for a loop run along Buckout St to Mercy College, through Dobbs Ferry and back. Afterward, everyone is welcome to stop in at MP Taverna for drinks and/or eats.


Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the parking lot in front of MP Taverna. We'll head south on Buckout St and Half Moon Lane and then we'll use the little wooded short cut to the Ardsley Train Station. We'll run past the station, veer right onto the lit walking path into the Mercy College campus, and through the campus, exiting on to Broadway at Landing Dr. We'll head south on Broadway and then we'll weave through Ardsley Park, taking Langdon to Belmont to Field Terrace to Osceola, before exiting right onto Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: MP Taverna parking lot (One Bridge St, Irvington, NY)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Dobbs Ferry Loop

results.description:
Topic: Picasso, Modigliani, and Frank Haviland in Ceret

We'll learn about how the little town of Céret in the Pyrénées became a center for modern art.

Dearest Beloveds,

I am deeply honored and grateful to share this 10 month journey of The Path Of Love with each of you.

The Path of Love opens you to the energy of creation and calls to you to open your heart gateway to your eternal self so that you may begin to anchor all that you are upon the Earth in unconditional love and open embrace of your Divinity.

This is the creation dreaming path where you enter the void and begin to access your highest potential through an open heart. It is here that you begin to see all the possibilities that are open for you and know that each choice you make brings you close to your divine power.

It is a deep path of self discovery where all is illuminated and you are called to embrace and honour yourself deeply. The Path of Love is the road home to all that you are.

Much Love and Gratitude,

Julie

NYSN founder Dave Cervini goes back to his radio roots for a super fun trip back in time trip to a make believe 1980's pop/alternative radio show live at Lexington's at The Cort Hotel! This is actually our normal Wednesday Happy Hour with a little twist!  Dave will be at the DJ booth and play 4 hours of great 80's music as if it was an actual radio show from April 20th 1989 complete with entertainment reports, commercials and of course the best music from the 80's decade!  We will also have special 80's themed ice breaker games, drink specials and more!

Between 1988 and 2003 Dave was on 102.3 (Long Island) and 105.1 & 103.5 here in NYC.  Over the years those stations had many formats but the most fun was the 80's music!  This is going to be a fun night to socialize, meet new people, reminisce, and hear some fun tunes.  Feel free to dress up in your favorite 80's gear!

Here is how it works:

-Come anytime between 6pmand 8pm for the best socializing.

-Drink specials are until 8pm

-Ice breakers happen at 7:30pm

Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the party.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending usually come on their own

Dress code:  Business casual

results.description:
Continuing with Ch. 4, we'll learn about identifiability of more complex interventions than the atomic do(X_i)!  

Do read the material before the meeting, but it's okay if you don't understand all of it! If you get stuck somewhere, make a note of where. It's likely others got stuck in the same place! Try to push through and understand as much of the rest of the material as possible. We'll try to get everyone on the same page at the meeting!

We're an extremely informal group, and the format is generally to put the book up on a screen, and talk through the material. We stop and discuss sticking points (your notes!) throughout, and dwell on definitions and theorems.

You can also ask any questions about the material in our piazza course page, using the access code stats101 ! -- and it supports latex! http://piazza.com/nyc_ml_study_group/fall2015/stats101 Recommended Pre-requisites:

• Probability Theory (intermediate): Know what a joint and conditional distribution is. Know what marginalizing is. Understand conditional independence. 

• Causality up to Sec. 4.1. 

• Graphical Models (intermediate): Know how to factorize a graph. Understand what it means for a distribution P to be "Markov relative to" a graph G. Understand what a "Causal Model" is. 

Analysis (intermediate): Be comfortable with product (big Pi) notation, indices, basic methods of proofs, basics of set theory, analysis notation 

Logistical Notes:

• Be sure to be on time! If you're more than 15 minutes late, you may have trouble getting in. 

• Be sure to bring ID for security! 

• There will be signs upstairs ("Math Meetup") directing you to the room.
results.name: Discuss Causality, Ch 4.1 - 4.4

results.description:
You will get to keep all the materials. Please register here: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/binary-numbers-and-truth-tables-tickets-24272847741?aff=meetup

Hello,


This month we will be working on binary numbers and truth tables. Our computers use binary numbers. Most computers cannot hold more than two possible states: 1/0, true/false. Digital Circuits are circuits that deal with signals that have two different states, such as binary numbers. This workshop we will work binary numbers and build a self-countdown/countup timer. We will do a 30-45 minute lecture follow by DIY activity.

You will get to keep all the materials.

Materials includes:
• Breadboard
• 9V Battery
• Capacitors
• Resistors
• Jumper Wires
• 3 IC Chips
• Worksheet
• Battery Clip

[update]
Your instructor for this workshop will be Yu Wang, MIT MSE. Her background is in physics and hardware engineering. 

This workshop is $35. Please register from the link above so we can get the number of materials ready. Thank you!

We look forward to having you!

Jaime

Counting down with logic gates
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-8PYCnxUrw
results.name: Binary Numbers and Truth Tables

"When you find peace within yourself, you become the kind of person, who can live at peace with others." Unknown

Peace is a state of well being;  freedom of the mind from distraction, strife, an obsession, annoyance and/or anxiety. With our hectic schedules and living in a busy city, peace is often lost. Can we find our peace? What does peace look like to us? We will explore what peace is for us and how we can find tools to bring us to a state of peace.

We meet every other week to talk about being gay and topics of spirituality.  This is NOT a group about religion. This is a great way to connect with other men who have an interest in spirituality. results.description:
Hailed by the New York Times as a “player with quiet virtuosity”, violinist Dan Auerbach joins award-winning pianist and prolific recording artist Joshua Pierce for an exciting program of traditional, virtuoso, and avant-garde classical music. Works include Tartini’s “Devil’s Trill” sonata (a work inspired by the devil), Bloch’s Baal Shem Suite (the composer’s vision of Chassidic life), Hába’s Hudba for Solo Violin (all quarter-tone music), the majestic G Major violin sonata by Brahms, Mozart’s lamenting E minor violin sonata, and a few Paganini caprices. This concert will mark 25 years of the duo’s fruitful collaboration. - See more at: 

http://www.kaufmanmusiccenter.org/mch/event/an-evening-of-music-pierce-auerbach-duo/#sthash.awjU9CiA.dpuf

results.description:
Full title: Can option trading strategies enhance CTA/trend following trading strategies? - an analysis

Abstract: In this talk, we investigate whether we can improve the risk adjusted returns of a traditional, directional (CTA style) trend following strategy by employing systematic option trading strategies. We shall be looking at several markets including FX and equities.


Bio: Jacob Bartram has extensive experience in trading at both banks and hedge funds. His background includes FX option and volatility trading, along with trading system design and development. He has presented at numerous industry conferences, including Global Derivatives and TradeTech FX.
results.name: Seminar (London) - Can option trading strategies enhance CTA/trend following

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly:
[masked]


Time:
The closer to 7:15 pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description:
Wednesday night training tends to focus on randori (free response training), and with work on one or two techniques or drills. If you are new to training, this will not be as intense for you as for people that have been training long term. Please check the FAQ if you have any questions. If there isn't an answer there, shoot me an email, and I'll respond as soon as possible.

Class is free if it's your first time.  You can start training in sweats and a T-shirt or bring your own gi. We also ask that your fingernails and toenail be clipped short to avoid injury.  

Please fill out this form (just name, address, contact information, and sign date it) and bring it with you.  Do not worry about paying the fee.  You'll do that if you continue training with us.  It's just that the form is also the liability waiver.

Dojo visitors from other training groups (Judo, BJJ, DZR) may pay the one time mat fee to train.

Approximate breakdown of class:
7:30: setup and change
7:45: Begin stretching and ukemi work
8:15: Begin technique work
8:30: randori/sparing 
9:20: Conditioning
9:30: Class ends, put away mats, change.

Dojo visitors from other training groups (Judo, BJJ, DZR) may pay the one time mat fee to train.

From Broad Street: Take the Light Rail to Washington Park.  Turn right onto Washington Street, then left onto Halsey Street.  Walk 1.5 blocks South on Halsey Street (cross Central Ave) to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.

Insight Summit is a peer led group, facilitated by MBSR teacher-in-training, Jessica O'Neill. Our sangha is overseen by meditation teacher, Kerry Rasp, who will attend and lead our group, on occasion.

This week's group will include a guided sitting meditation in the Vipassana (Mindfulness) tradition, followed by discussion.

Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted. (Suggested donation $10, but please give what is right for you.)

Enter the church on the side facing Waldron Ave. The double doors are locked, but the single door all the way to the right is open (you'll see a sign on it). We'll be meditating in the large room on the left. Please try to arrive 5 min early so you can get settled before we start promptly at 7:45pm. If you're running late, it's okay. Just enter quietly and take a seat.

There's a public parking lot located on DeForest (between Woodland and Maple). Or you can park on Springfield. All lots and meters are free after 6pm. (If other spaces are available, please try not to park on Waldron.) 


* You do not need to be a member of this (or any) church to attend. This is a completely independent meditation group.

* The Meetup RSVP list doesn't reflect actual attendance, since those from Insight Timer and other meditation groups also attend.

results.description:
Sponsored by National Arts Club. Free and open to the public - business attire required.

Please join us for a presentation by Margot Ellis, co-author of Americans in Paris, which tells the story of an influential group of American architecture students who attended the École des Beaux-Arts and went on to design and build many of our nation’s most recognized buildings and monuments. American alumni of the world-renowned school, famous for being the greatest art and architecture school in the world at the time, include Richard Morris Hunt, Guy Lowell, John Russell Pope, Julia Morgan, and many others.
Margot M. Ellis was educated at Manhattanville College and Harvard University, where she received a bachelor’s degree in French Studies and a master’s degree in Anthropology, respectively. Hired as a research assistant by the late Jean Paul Carlhian, Miss Ellis spent 15 years completing the manuscript and brought it to publication after the death of Mr. Carlhian in 2012. She is an author and editor based in Tucson, Arizona.
Carlhian is most noted for enlivening the National Mall in Washington, D.C.. He designed the National Museum of African Art and the Sackler Gallery of Asian Art, both part of the Smithsonian Institution, and buildings on the campus of Harvard University. He graduated from the École des Beaux-Arts in 1945, and, as a Wheelwright Fellow at Harvard University, received a master’s degree in City Planning in 1947.
results.name: Americans in Paris (École des Beaux-Arts )

http://www.lecoqriconyc.com/

RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future.

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.

About the Host

Hilda Abla - aka "Hildos" is a Lebanese-Armenian artist living in Brooklyn. She started her artistic ventures at age five at the children's program at Lebanese American University, the same institution where she earned her Bachelor of Fine Arts years later. Her painting studies continued at the School of Visual Arts, and she has exhibited her work in Beirut and New York, and been featured in magazines New York Art Magazine and Art Fuse. She believes that art comes with a responsibility, and her latest work is committed to changing the way women view their bodies and themselves. You can view her work at <a href="http://hildos.com">hildos.com , including her TEDx talk on "Seeing Beauty in Imperfection".

results.description:
Come join us for a special TurnOn event lead by Rachel Tayeb! 

How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


A bit about Rachel: 

For those of you she has never met: “I wouldn’t be here if it weren’t for Rachel” is one of the most common things long-time students and teachers of Orgasmic Meditation say when asked about Rachel Tayeb. A decade-long practitioner of OM, Rachel is a powerhouse of a woman. Electric, sharp, and clear-sighted, she takes a stand for wake-up in a world of asleep and never relents. A precision dismantler of her own mind, Rachel was once a Substance Abuse Counselor helping alcoholics and addicts find a higher power and get sober. She can be found behind the scenes always, tinkering with the subconscious and unraveling energetic knots in herself and her clients. Once she’s taken you on, you’re never really outside the reach of her heart again. She’s fiercely loyal and uncompromisingly loving. She calls out every incongruent location she finds and her quality of attention often first confronts people, and then has them be able to trust her deeply, because she is quintessentially her true self in every location, every situation, in every group, with every friend.

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City with Rachel Tayeb

results.description:
Having trouble fully absorbing A Course in Miracles (ACIM) or another non-dualistic spiritual tradition? Then A COURSE OF LOVE may be just for you! Channeled by the same voice that authored ACIM but in more easy to understand and feminine language, Mari Perron’s A Course of Love speaks to the heart rather than the mind. Let’s explore this important new text together and use it as a springboard to become peaceful miracle workers. Led by CRS co-founders and ACIM Teachers/Healers Yasuko Kasaki and Christopher Pelham, this class work its way through the text week by week. 

We're just starting (fall 2015) but you can join in later any time. Like yoga, it's really more experiential than progressive learning.

You can easily order the book online from Amazon or BN.com, and e-book versions are available.

It may be astonishing to hear that there is a “continuation” of A Course in Miracles, but it is true. Forty years ago Jesus dictated ACIM to the scribe Helen Schucman. More recently, over three years, he similarly dictated A Course of Love. Jesus himself referred to what he was dictating as a “continuation of A Course in Miracles.” Students of ACIM will recognize the Voice. Students of truth, whatever their background, will find that ACOL resonates with the heart.

A Course of Love builds upon the same non-dualistic thought system as ACIM, yet it is a course for the heart. ACOL and ACIM work hand-in-hand. Yet remarkably, ACOL bypasses the mind. It uses thought to go beyond thought. Those yearning to access the heart’s knowing will find help here. This is your invitation to live the purposeful, meaningful life of the new—the reality of heaven on earth.

Wednesday nights from 8 – 9:30 pm at CRS
Classes are $20 and class cards are available.

results.description:
This will be the third class for this Level 2 Salsa Cycle. It will be the last full open house class. That means that anyone who fits the requirements below can join this class and still be able to catch up. 

If you have the minimum requirements detailed below or if you attended the first two classes of this Level then come and take this awesome class. This level is very fun and there is a lot of important material to learn. Let's do it!!

As the minimum requirement for this class, you should know the following:

-basic step
-right turn
-left turn
-cross-body lead (and cross-body lead-inside turn combo)
-open break
-walk around.

If you do, come and take this class and learn Level 2 foundational steps, moves, and footwork.

Location: 519 Eighth Avenue, New York, NY

Time: 8:30pm - 10pm 

Room: Studio H (12th floor)

Fee: $15 per class (cash only)

For tips, instructional videos, schedule, updates, music, info about shoes, where to go dance, and to connect with the other students, join our facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/


What we will learn:

In Level 1 we concentrated on doing footwork using the basic timing. in addition to basic timing, In this class you will learn footwork with more intricate timings such as: chord beat, full count, and syncopation.

For partner-work we will be learn how to do hammerlocks, trading places, mambo jazz, copa, wraps, traveling spin preparations, traveling spins, hooks, and variations of these moves.

We will also continue learning about execution, technique, and music.

Let's do it!!!!
results.name: Level 2 Salsa Class Cycle (Last Open House)

This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8:30-10:30pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

Story Party is a comedy show unlike any other comedy show in NYC. Performers share stories and parts of their one-man shows that have been showcased in festivals around the world. These stories are hilarious, sad, exciting, heart-wrenching and most of all TRUE!!

The show is FREE and takes place at Stone Creek Bar in Murray Hill, just 2 blocks from the 6-train 28th St stop.

Seating is limited and by reservation only. To Reserve a seat, RSVP through Eventbrite w. your best email and show your confirmation at the door. There will also be FREE DRINK and FREE COMEDY CLUB Ticket giveaways!!

Eventbrite LINK: http://bit.ly/1WsaBSg

Come solo or bring friends its all good. 

Meetup starts at 9 in the front bar.. Seating starts in the back showroom at 9:30 and the show starts shortly after. 

I'll be there w. the MEETUP SIGN! 

**The show is free and has a 1 item minimum.**
results.name: Story Party FREE Storytelling Show Meetup!

Check us out at Maxwell's in Hoboken for our weekly "Hump Day Ha-Ha" showcase!

Never a cover!  Always an epic night!  Every week we invite a headliner to join us as we rotate our lineup of NCA members!


Past headliners include Kevin Bartini, Bob Dibuono, Krystyna Hutchinson, Dustin Chafin, Frankie Pace, Tommy 5K, and Neko White! 


Our weekly guest will be announced on Monday!

There is a 2 drink minimum.  No maximum though.

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

It's simple...

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!


Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study hard, practise conversation, and share good energy.

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Whatever you're learning, good, daily study habits will make you fluent. 

Try it out!
results.name: Let's Get Fluent! Language Study at Starbucks

results.description:
Rise and shine, it's almost the weekend! Join us for a casual 3-mile loop between Woodside and Jackson Heights, starting at 6:30AM. All paces are welcome, and nobody gets left behind -- we always keep things cool and fun. 

We will wait up to 5 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. Remember, (almost) everyone has to go somewhere after (aka work, ugh). Please be prompt!

Comments, questions, suggestions? Message us! :)

- - - - - - 
Please see our full calendar of events 
http://www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com/events/calendar/ 
connect with us on Google+

like us on Facebook 
https://www.facebook.com/WoodsideSunnysideRunners 
and follow us on Instagram 
https://instagram.com/woodsidesunnysiderunners/ 
- - - - - -

results.description:
NED is starting to have exclusive Roundtable event for Executive Directors only!! You must be a current ED of a nonprofit to attend.  

The roundtable will be held the third Thursday of every month for a light breakfast. We recommend that you sign early as this Roundtable will be limited to 12 Executive Directors and will fill up quickly. 

LOGISTICS: This is an exclusive event for Executive Directors. The venue information will be e-mailed to confirmed Executive Directors. This will be an in person only Roundtable. 


Agenda (subject to change) 


7:30-8:00 AM EST - In-Person Networking
8:00-8:15 – Introductions
8:15-9:30 – A group discussion of struggles and success of fundraising.

A sponsored light breakfast and coffee will be served: 

When you register there are four questions to answer. Can you please answer them so I can get everyone's information. Thank you!!
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.linkedin.com/grp/home?gid=8242890&trk=my_groups-tile-flipgrp
results.name: Executive Director Roundtable - Topic: Best Practices of Fundraising!
